Jeffrey Epstein er blevet en omtalt skikkelse blandt tilhængere af QAnon og Pizzagate-teorien, blandt andet fordi han havde tætte bånd til flere kendte, rige og magtfulde personer, heriblandt til det engelske kongehus og Bill Gates
Han ejede øen Little Saint James i Det Caribiske Hav, indtil han i 2019 blev fundet død i sin fængselscelle, hvor han begik selvmord. Det var blandt andet på øen, at Jeffrey Epstein angiveligt forgreb sig på mindreårige.
Men det er ikke alle, der tror på, at han begik selvmord. Ifølge tilhængere af konspirationsteorien QAnon var det eliten, der dræbte ham i fængselscellen, så han i retten ikke kunne nævne navnene på alle de kendte personer, der har besøgt hans ø for at deltage i pædofile aktiviteter.
Hans død er for mange dermed blevet det endegyldige bevis på, at en ikke nærmere defineret elite i samfundet har gang i lyssky og ulovlige aktiviteter.
Jeffrey Epstein nåede altså aldrig for retten i forbindelse med de nye anklager, men hans tidligere kæreste, Ghislaine Maxwell, blev efterfølgende idømt 20 års fængsel for at have assisteret, faciliteret og deltaget i Jeffrey Epsteins misbrug af af mindreårige piger ved blandt andet at hjælpe ham med at rekruttere, groome og i sidste ende misbruge de mindreårige.
QAnon-bevægelsen har eksisteret i USA siden 2017, men har siden også bredt sig til Europa og Danmark. TjekDet har tidligere skrevet om bevægelsen, der blandt andet går på, at der eksisterer en lyssky satanistisk og pædofil skyggeregering, som består af en 'verdenselite'. Teorien ser Donald Trump som Messias.
Den såkaldte Pizza Gate-sag var en falsk historie på de sociale medier, der cirkulerede på sociale medier, hvor en pizzarestaurant blev beskyldt for at drive en pædofilring under ledelse af den daværende demokratiske præsidentkandidat Hillary Clinton. Rygtet førte til et skyderi på restauranten.
Hvis du kan lide vores artikler og vil være sikker på ikke at gå glip af den nyeste, så følg os på Facebook ved at klikke her.
Translation:
Kamala Harris is linked to controversial criminal
-
A photo is shared on social media that allegedly shows US Vice President Kamala Harris with sex offender Jeffrey Epstein
-
But the image is manipulated
-
In the right picture, it is Kamala Harris' husband, Douglas Emhoff, who is standing by her side
On Sunday evening Danish time, the American president, Joe Biden, resigned as the Democrats' bid for the next president of the United States, to be found in the election in November this year.
The Democrats will thus have to find a new presidential candidate, and here several arrows point to the current vice-president, Kamala Harris.
Not many hours passed after Joe Biden withdrew his candidacy for several users on social media to share defamatory claims about Kamala Harris.
This applies in particular to a photo that allegedly shows Kamala Harris arm in arm on the red carpet with the late Jeffrey Epstein, who was an American financier who in 2008 was sentenced to 18 months in prison and a year of house arrest for soliciting a minor for prostitution .
Later, he was accused of several matters, but he never made it before a judge when he committed suicide in his prison cell in 2019.
But the image of Kamala Harris and Jeffrey Epstein is manipulated.
Manipulated image
Check It begins with using an image processing program to crop Kamala Harris out of the viral image. That way, we can do a reverse image search on the picture of Kamala Harris, without Jeffrey Epstein also appearing in the picture.
The reverse image search results in Google Images results in numerous search results from the image service Getty Images. Here you can see Kamala Harris wearing the exact same dress, but next to her stands a different man than Jeffrey Epstein. Furthermore, you can guess that the background of the pictures is the same.
The photo's description reveals it dates from September 17, 2015 and is credited to photographer Jerod Harris. In the picture, Kamala Harris and her husband, Douglas Emhoff, are seen on the red carpet for an event in Los Angeles in the US state of California.
In the manipulated image shared on social media, Jeffrey Epstein's head has thus been edited onto Douglas Emhoff's body.
The doctored image was first shared on social media in 2021, when Kamala Harris was inaugurated as vice president.
Surrounded by conspiracies
Jeffrey Epstein has become a talked-about figure among supporters of QAnon and the Pizzagate theory, partly because he had close ties to several well-known, rich and powerful people, including the English royal house and Bill Gates
He owned the island of Little Saint James in the Caribbean Sea until he was found dead in his prison cell in 2019, where he committed suicide. It was, among other things, on the island that Jeffrey Epstein allegedly molested minors.
But not everyone believes that he committed suicide. According to supporters of the conspiracy theory QAnon, it was the elite who killed him in the prison cell, so that he could not mention in court the names of all the famous people who have visited his island to participate in pedophile activities.
For many, his death has thus become the definitive proof that an undefined elite in society is involved in shady and illegal activities.
Jeffrey Epstein thus never went to trial in connection with the new charges, but his former girlfriend, Ghislaine Maxwell, was subsequently sentenced to 20 years in prison for having assisted, facilitated and participated in Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of underage girls by, among other things, helping him with recruiting, grooming and ultimately abusing the minors.
The QAnon movement has existed in the USA since 2017, but has since also spread to Europe and Denmark. TjekDet has previously written about the movement, which, among other things, assumes the existence of a shadowy Satanist and pedophile shadow government, which consists of a 'world elite'. The theory sees Donald Trump as the Messiah.
The so-called Pizza Gate case was a fake social media story circulating on social media in which a pizza restaurant was accused of running a pedophilia ring run by then-Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton. The rumor led to a shooting at the restaurant.
If you like our articles and want to be sure not to miss the latest, follow us on Facebook by clicking here.
false_claim: Images of Kamala Harris were circulated showing her hugging Jeffrey Epstein.

content:
Не, труповете в Буча не са инсценировка с живи статисти
- Тази публикация е по-стара от една година.
- Публикувано на 05 април 2022 г. в 18:19
- Обновено: 06 април 2022 г. в 16:18
- Време за четене: 10 минути
- От: François D'ASTIER, AFP Франция
Copyright © AFP 2017-2024. Всяко използване на това съдържание с търговска цел изисква абонамент. Кликнете тук, за да научите повече.
На 3 април 2022 г. Telegram каналът на руското Министерство на отбраната, следван от 200 хил. потребителя, споделя пост с кратко видео, към което има следният коментар: "Фейк: руските военни се изтеглят от Буча, като преди това оставят огромни жертви сред цивилното население". "Видеото с телата буди недоумение: тук на 12 секунда "трупът" вдясно движи ръката си."
Съвсем бързо обвиненията в манипулация набират скорост в социалните мрежи, където се разпространяват на различни езици (френски, румънски, немски), както и на български.
Български потребители споделят както краткото видео, така и по-дълго от новините на руския Первый канал, излъчено на 3 април 2022 г. , в който се виждат същите кадри, а водещият говори за "очевиден фейк". "Сценарий по улиците на Буча", пише потребител споделящ видеото. "Още за украинските фейкове", гласи друг пост. "Съмнителни детайли във видео за убити цивилни", гласи заглавието на тази публикация.
Откъде е видеото?
Видеото, заснето от автомобил, следващ украински военен конвой, показва няколко тела, лежащи на разрушена от сраженията улица в града, който се намира северозападно от Киев. Точното местоположение е улица "Яблонска". Видеото е публикувано на 2 април в YouTube канала на украинската телевизия Espreso.TV. Журналистът описва кадрите като доказателство за "зверствата, извършени от руските окупатори на Буча".
По-дълга версия с по-добро качество на кадрите е публикувана същият ден в Twitter канала на украинското министерство на отбраната. В нея се казва, че "Местни цивилни граждани са били екзекутирани произволно".
New Srebrenica. The Ukrainian city of Bucha was in the hands of animals for several weeks. *Local civillians were being executed arbitrarily*, some with hands tied behind their backs, their bodies scattered in the streets of the city.#RussianWarCrimespic.twitter.com/outzejdidO
— Defence of Ukraine (@DefenceU) April 2, 2022
Тела, които мърдат?
В подвеждащите публикации видеото е забавено и с лошо качество. Но, както забелязаха много интернет потребители (1,2,3), ако се вгледаме внимателно във видеото с по-добро качество, ще видим, че тези тела не мърдат. Първият мъж вдясно на видеото не вдига ръката си - това всъщност е капка върху предното стъкло на автомобила, от който се снима:
Getting fed up of this “it’s a moving arm” bullsh….. it’s a raindrop on the windscreen, alongside an inverted channel version for more clarity. The whole arm moving thing is just ridiculous. pic.twitter.com/ZiuEX4rFWc
— Aurora Intel (@AuroraIntel) April 3, 2022
Екипът на AFP на място потвърждава видяното
Журналисти на AFP бяха в Буча на 2 април и потвърдиха, че са видели около 20 тела в цивилни дрехи. Едно от телата е с вързани ръце.
Екипът, в който са журналистът Дани Кемп, фотографът Роналдо Шемидт и видеожурналистът Николас Гарсия, пристигна на мястото на събитието на 2 април около 15:30 ч. местно време, съобщи Кемп за AFP Factuel.
"Веднага щом пристигнахме, видяхме, че улицата е осеяна с тела. Първоначално видяхме група от трима души, а след това забелязахме, че има още в двете посоки. Те бяха разположени по улицата на неправилни интервали на разстояние около 400 метра, някои сами, а други на малки групи от по двама или трима души. Минахме по цялата дължина на мястото на инцидента поне два пъти. Преброихме телата, като отбелязахме, че те са 20, снимахме ги и ги заснехме на видео. В нито един момент не видяхме някой от тях да се движи", казва Кемп в имейл.
"През това време забелязахме, че всички тела бяха облечени в цивилни дрехи. Те имаха восъчна, посивяла кожа, имаха сковани на вид пръсти, а някои от тях бяха с обезцветени нокти. На някои от тях крайниците бяха застанали в нетипични пози. Някои бяха с отворени очи, а други - с отворена уста. Явно са били мъртви от няколко дни, ако не и по-отдавна."
Сравнихме изображенията, които се споделят в подвеждащите публикации, със снимките, направени от AFP на мястото на инцидента. Има няколко признака, че те показват една и съща сцена. Тук сме оградили в червено тялото на жертвата, а в зелено - повредения автомобил, стълб и част от бордюра:
Предупреждение за съдържание
Дани Кемп изпрати две снимки, които е направил на 2 април, в деня, в който са открити телата:
Предупреждение за съдържание
Две други снимки на AFP, направени ден по-късно от втори екип, пристигнал на мястото на инцидента, показват общински служител от Буча, който се готви да постави същото тяло в чувал за трупове.
Предупреждение за съдържание
Друго тяло, за което в някои публикации се твърди, че се движи, се явява на два пъти във видеото от 2 април - първо на земята, а две секунди по-късно в огледалото за обратно виждане на автомобила, от който е заснето:
Предупреждение за съдържание
Трупът е заснет и от AFP на 3 април, т.е. 24 часа след като е направено видеото, да лежи същото място и в същата поза:
Предупреждение за съдържание
"Свидетели от Буча ни казаха, че са видели колона от около 70 руски бронирани машини да напуска града във вторник, 29 март, но че руският обстрел е продължил и в сряда, 30 март, и че последният обстрел е бил в четвъртък, 31 март", каза Кемп.
"Журналистите на AFP, намиращи се в района на Ирпин, в непосредствена близост до Буча, са чули обстрел в четвъртък. До петък беше невъзможно да се стигне до района, тъй като украинските власти заявиха, че не е безопасно да се влиза там. AFP влезе в Ирпин в петък, 1 април, и в Буча в събота, 2 април."
В свое собствено разследване Би Би Си също установи, че твърденията, според които масовите убийства са инсценирани, са неоснователни. В него се обяснява, че привидното надигане на тялото, което се наблюдава в огледалото за обратно виждане, вероятно е ефект от изкривяване на отражението.
Какво знаем за смъртните случаи в Буча
Малкият град Буча е окупиран от руската армия на 27 февруари и остава затворен повече от месец. Бомбардировките спряха на 31 март, а украинските сили успяха да влязат напълно в града едва преди няколко дни.
Украйна обвини руснаците, че са отговорни за тези смъртни случаи. Това беше отречено от Москва, която обяви, че ще разследва това, което според нея е "отвратителна провокация", целяща да обвини руските сили.
Според кмета на Буча Анатолий Федорук хората са били застреляни от руски войници с "куршум във врата". Телата на 57 души пък са били открити в масов гроб, заяви в неделя, 3 април, ръководителят на местните спасителни служби Сергей Капличний, показвайки мястото на екип на AFP.
Зад църква в центъра на града се виждат десетина тела, някои от които са погребани само частично. Няколко от тях са поставени в черни чували за трупове, а тези, които можеха да се видят, бяха в цивилни дрехи.
На 2 април Федорук заяви, че "280 души" са били погребани "в масови гробове", тъй като не са могли да бъдат погребани в гробищата на Буча. Точният брой на жертвите все още не е известен, заяви пред AFP кметът на Киев Виталий Кличко, който посети Буча на 3 април. "Смятаме, че са загинали повече от 300 цивилни граждани".
Кадри от сателит
Сателитни снимки, публикувани на 4 април, също опровергават руските твърдения, че откритите в Буча трупове в цивилни дрехи са се появили там, след като руските сили са се изтеглили от опустошения град.
Сателитните снимки са направени в средата на март и изглежда показват няколко тела на цивилни граждани, лежащи мъртви върху или непосредствено до пътното платно. "Спътниковите изображения на Maxar с висока резолюция, направени над Буча, Украйна (северозападно от Киев), проверяват и потвърждават наскоро публикувани видеоклипове и снимки в социалните медии, които показват тела, лежащи по улиците и оставени на открито в продължение на седмици", заяви в понеделник говорителят на Maxar Technologies Стивън Ууд.
The New York Times публикува анализ на сателитни кадри от улица "Яблонска" в Буча и ги сравни с кадри от 1 и 2 април, на които се виждат трупове по улицата. Така стигна до заключението, че много от тях са там от поне от три седмици, когато руските войски контролираха града.
За да потвърди анализа на New York Times , AFP сравни сателитните изображения със снимките, направени на място на 2 април от екипа на агенцията:
Много от телата, видими на сателитно изображение, предоставено от Maxar и датирано от 19 март, са в същата поза на земята и на същото местоположение като на снимките на AFP, направени две седмици по-късно. Под номер 5 е тялото, за което се твърди, че си мърда ръката. Още към 19 март 2022 г., когато е направена сателитната снимка, тялото е било там.
Международно възмущение
Няколко западни държави и ООН изразиха възмущението си след откриването на телата. Върховният комисар по правата на човека Мишел Бачелет заяви на 4 април, че е "ужасена" от снимките от Буча, които "повдигат сериозни и тревожни въпроси за възможни военни престъпления".
Европейският съюз, след публикуването на тези снимки, обсъди в "спешен порядък" на 4 април нови санкции срещу Москва.
Украинският президент Володимир Зеленски посети Буча на 4 април и призова света да признае "геноцида".
6 април 2022 г. Във вторият параграф, след второто подзаглавие, е променено името на фотографа.
Видели сте съдържание, което искате AFP да провери?
Свържи се с нас
Translation:
No, the corpses in Bucha are not a staging with live extras
- This post is over a year old.
- Posted on April 05, 2022 at 6:19 pm
- Updated: April 06, 2022 at 4:18 p.m
- Reading time: 10 minutes
- By: François D'ASTIER, AFP France
Copyright © AFP 2017-2024. Any commercial use of this content requires a subscription. Click here to learn more.
On April 3, 2022, the Telegram channel of the Russian Ministry of Defense, followed by 200,000 users, shared a post with a short video with the following comment: "Fake: Russian military withdraws from Bucha, leaving huge casualties among the civilian population". "The video of the bodies is puzzling: here at 12 seconds the 'corpse' on the right moves its arm."
Very quickly, accusations of manipulation gained momentum in social networks, where they spread in different languages ​​(French, Romanian, German), as well as in Bulgarian.
Bulgarian users are sharing both the short video and a longer one from the Russian news channel Pervyj Kanal, which aired on April 3, 2022, showing the same footage, with the anchor referring to it as an "obvious fake". "Scenario on the streets of Bucha," wrote a user sharing the video. "More on the Ukrainian fakes," another post reads. "Suspicious details in video of civilians killed," reads the title of this post.
Where is the video from?
The video, taken by a car following a Ukrainian military convoy, shows several bodies lying on a battle-torn street in the city, which is located northwest of Kiev. The exact location is "Yablonska" street. The video was published on April 2 on the YouTube channel of the Ukrainian television Espreso.TV. The journalist described the footage as proof of "atrocities committed by the Russian occupiers of Bucha".
A longer version with better quality footage was posted the same day on the Ukrainian Defense Ministry's Twitter feed. It says that "Local civilians were executed arbitrarily".
New Srebrenica. The Ukrainian city of Bucha was in the hands of animals for several weeks. *Local civilians were being executed arbitrarily*, some with hands tied behind their backs, their bodies scattered in the streets of the city. #RussianWarCrimespic.twitter.com/outzejdidO
— Defense of Ukraine (@DefenceU) April 2, 2022
Bodies that move?
In the misleading posts, the video is slow and of poor quality. But, as many internet users (1,2,3) have noticed, if we look closely at the better quality video, we can see that these bodies are not moving. The first man on the right of the video does not raise his hand - it is actually a drop on the windshield of the car from which it is filmed:
Getting fed up of this "it's a moving arm" bullsh.... it's a raindrop on the windscreen, alongside an inverted channel version for more clarity. The whole arm moving thing is just ridiculous. pic.twitter.com/ZiuEX4rFWc
— Aurora Intel (@AuroraIntel) April 3, 2022
The AFP team on the ground is confirming the sighting
AFP journalists were in Bucha on 2 April and confirmed seeing around 20 bodies in civilian clothes. One of the bodies has his hands tied.
The team, which includes journalist Danny Kemp, photographer Ronaldo Schmidt and videojournalist Nicolas Garcia, arrived at the scene on April 2 around 3:30 p.m. local time, Kemp told AFP Factuel.
"As soon as we arrived, we saw that the street was littered with bodies. At first we saw a group of three people, then we noticed that there were more in both directions. They were located along the street at irregular intervals about 400 meters apart, some alone, and others in small groups of two or three. We walked the entire length of the scene at least twice, noting that there were 20 of them, taking pictures and videotaping them at no point of them to move," Kemp says in an email.
"During this time, we noticed that all the bodies were dressed in civilian clothes. They had waxy, gray skin, they had stiff-looking fingers, and some of them had discolored nails. Some of them had their limbs in unusual positions. Some were with their eyes open, and others with their mouths open. They must have been dead for several days, if not longer."
We compared the images shared in the misleading posts with the photos taken by AFP at the scene of the accident. There are several indications that they show the same scene. Here we have surrounded the victim's body in red, and the damaged car, pole and part of the curb in green:
Content warning
Danny Kemp sent two photos he took on April 2, the day the bodies were found:
Content warning
Two other AFP photos taken a day later by a second team that arrived at the scene show a municipal official from Bucha preparing to place the same body in a body bag.
Content warning
Another body, which some publications claim is moving, appears twice in the April 2 video - first on the ground, and two seconds later in the rearview mirror of the car from which it was filmed:
Content warning
The corpse was also photographed by AFP on April 3, i.e. 24 hours after the video was taken, to lie in the same place and in the same position:
Content warning
"Witnesses from Bucha told us that they saw a column of about 70 Russian armored vehicles leaving the town on Tuesday, March 29, but that the Russian shelling continued on Wednesday, March 30, and that the last shelling was on Thursday, March 31 Kemp said.
"AFP journalists in the Irpin area, close to Bucha, heard shelling on Thursday. Until Friday, it was impossible to reach the area as Ukrainian authorities said it was unsafe to enter. AFP entered Irpin on Friday, April 1, and Bucha on Saturday, April 2."
In its own investigation, the BBC also found claims that the mass killings were staged to be unfounded. It explains that the apparent rise of the body seen in the rear-view mirror is likely an effect of reflection distortion.
What we know about the deaths in Bucha
The small town of Bucha was occupied by the Russian army on February 27 and remained closed for more than a month. The bombing stopped on March 31, and Ukrainian forces were only able to fully enter the city a few days ago.
Ukraine accused the Russians of being responsible for these deaths. That was denied by Moscow, which said it would investigate what it said was a "heinous provocation" aimed at blaming Russian forces.
According to the mayor of Bucha, Anatoly Fedoruk, the people were shot by Russian soldiers with a "bullet in the neck". The bodies of 57 people were found in a mass grave, the head of local rescue services, Sergei Kaplichny, said on Sunday, April 3, as he showed the site to an AFP team.
A dozen bodies can be seen behind a church in the city center, some of which are only partially buried. Several of them were placed in black body bags, and those that could be seen were in civilian clothes.
On April 2, Fedoruk said that "280 people" were buried "in mass graves" because they could not be buried in the Bucha cemetery. The exact number of victims is not yet known, Kyiv Mayor Vitaly Klitschko, who visited Bucha on April 3, told AFP. "We believe that more than 300 civilians have died."
Satellite footage
Satellite images released on April 4 also refuted Russian claims that the civilian-clothed bodies found in Bucha appeared there after Russian forces withdrew from the ravaged town.
Satellite images taken in mid-March appear to show several bodies of civilians lying dead on or next to the roadway. "High-resolution Maxar satellite imagery taken over Bucha, Ukraine (northwest of Kyiv) verifies and confirms recently released videos and photos on social media that show bodies lying on the streets and left in the open for weeks," it said on Monday, Maxar Technologies spokesman Stephen Wood.
The New York Times published an analysis of satellite images from Yablonska Street in Bucha and compared them with images from April 1 and 2, which showed corpses on the street. So he concluded that many of them had been there for at least three weeks when Russian troops controlled the city.
To confirm the New York Times analysis, AFP compared the satellite images with the photos taken on the ground on April 2 by the agency's team:
Many of the bodies visible in a satellite image provided by Maxar and dated March 19 are in the same position on the ground and in the same location as in AFP photos taken two weeks later. Under number 5 is the body that is said to be moving its arm. As late as March 19, 2022, when the satellite image was taken, the body was there.
International outrage
Several Western countries and the United Nations expressed their outrage after the bodies were discovered. High Commissioner for Human Rights Michelle Bachelet said on April 4 that she was "appalled" by the Boucha photos, which "raise serious and troubling questions about possible war crimes".
The European Union, after the publication of these photos, discussed in an "urgent order" on April 4 new sanctions against Moscow.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky visited Bucha on April 4 and called on the world to recognize the "genocide".
April 6, 2022 In the second paragraph, after the second subheading, the photographer's name has been changed.
Seen content you want AFP to review?
Contact us
false_claim: Victims in the Ukraine war are actually actors.

content:
Questo video non è stato girato da un drone ucraino a Mosca
Il 24 aprile è stato pubblicato su Twitter un video di quella che sembra una ripresa effettuata da un drone sulla piazza Rossa di Mosca, in Russia. Nel video compaiono in sovraimpressione alcune scritte e un simbolo in basso a sinistra che ricorda il tridente presente nello stemma dell’Ucraina.
L’autore del tweet ha commentato così il video: «Il drone ucraino sorvola silenziosamente Mosca. Sembra che il Cremlino abbia tutte le possibilità di essere molto presto nell’area colpita».
Questo contenuto è fuorviante e diffonde una notizia falsa: il video in questione, infatti, non è stato registrato ad aprile 2023 e non ha alcun legame con la guerra in Ucraina.
Il video originale è stato pubblicato per la prima volta su YouTube il 12 ottobre 2015 (oltre sette anni prima dell’invasione militare russa dell’Ucraina) dall’account AirPano Vr, una società specializzata in fotografie aeree e video ad alta risoluzione. Nella versione originale del video non c’è nessuna scritta né il simbolo del tridente ucraino. Questi elementi sono stati quindi aggiunti in un secondo momento.
La descrizione su YouTube spiega che il video è stato realizzato dal team di AirPano Vr con il supporto della Russian Geographical Society per mostrare il complesso storico-architettonico del Cremlino a Mosca.
Contattato dai fact-checker di LeadStories, Sergey Semenov di AirPano Vr ha confermato che il video è stato girato più di otto anni fa come parte di un progetto per mostrare i «luoghi più belli del nostro pianeta».
Translation:
This video was not shot by a Ukrainian drone in Moscow
On April 24, a video of what appears to be drone footage of Red Square in Moscow, Russia, was posted on Twitter. In the video, some writings and a symbol appear in the bottom left which recalls the trident present in the coat of arms of Ukraine.
The author of the tweet commented on the video as follows: «The Ukrainian drone flies silently over Moscow. It seems that the Kremlin has every chance of being in the affected area very soon."
This content is misleading and spreads false news: the video in question, in fact, was not recorded in April 2023 and has no connection to the war in Ukraine.
The original video was first posted to YouTube on October 12, 2015 (over seven years before the Russian military invasion of Ukraine) by the AirPano Vr account, a company specializing in high-resolution aerial photography and video. In the original version of the video there is no writing or symbol of the Ukrainian trident. These elements were then added later.
The description on YouTube explains that the video was created by the AirPano VR team with the support of the Russian Geographical Society to show the historical-architectural complex of the Kremlin in Moscow.
Contacted by LeadStories fact-checkers, Sergey Semenov of AirPano VR confirmed that the video was shot more than eight years ago as part of a project to show the "most beautiful places on our planet".
false_claim: Video was recorded by a Ukrainian drone over Red Square in Moscow.

content:
Правдивы ли эти видео затопления британского судна Rubymar после атаки хуситов?
В феврале 2024 года в СМИ и соцсетях распространили две записи, на которых якобы показано, как под воду уходит корабль, повреждённый йеменскими боевиками. Мы проверили достоверность обеих записей.
В ноябре 2023 года лидеры поддерживаемых Ираном хуситов объявили, что их силы будут атаковать все проходящие рядом с побережьем Йемена суда, связанные с Израилем. Спустя несколько месяцев, 20 февраля 2024 года, в Сети стали массово распространять две короткие видеозаписи, где якобы запечатлён уходящий под воду британский корабль Rubymar, который, как сообщается, был подбит хуситами в Красном море накануне, то есть 19 февраля. В некоторых публикациях встречаются дополнительные подробности: например, что по судну были выпущены две противокорабельные ракеты, в результате чего возник пожар, что экипаж был эвакуирован и что это первый зафиксированный случай уничтожения западного судна йеменскими боевиками.
В некоторых публикациях встречается сразу пара кадров предполагаемого затопления Rubymar. Например, так поступили авторы Telegram-каналов «Дмитрий Василец» (233 000 просмотров на момент написания этого разбора), «Военкор Котенок» (137 000), «Мисливец Егор» (89 000 и 76 000), «Злой журналист» (58 000) и «Рыбарь» (52 000, пост удалён), а также паблик «Военная хроника» (103 000) во «ВКонтакте». Однако на большинстве других ресурсов приведена лишь одна из двух записей — так было в Telegram-каналах «Россия сейчас» (249 000 просмотров), «Оперативные сводки» (183 000), «Милитарист» (165 000), Zergulio (140 000), Yo'l-yo'lakay (114 000, пост на узбекском языке), «Осташко! Важное» (113 000), «Такер Карлсон на русском» (87 000), «Пономарь» (57 000), TarikNezalejko️️ (54 000) и «Свежести» (62 000). Кроме того, об этих роликах рассказали газеты «Аргументы и факты» и «Бизнес Online».
Утром 19 февраля официальный представитель Вооружённых сил Йемена сообщил, что в ходе операции в Аденском заливе йеменские Военно-морские силы поразили британский корабль Rubymar. По словам спикера, судно получило катастрофические повреждения и полностью остановилось. «В результате серьёзного ущерба, нанесённого кораблю, теперь он может затонуть в Аденском заливе. В ходе операции мы позаботились о том, чтобы экипаж благополучно покинул судно», — добавил представитель.
Вечером того же дня в своей сводке Центральное командование Вооружённых сил США подтвердило, что за день до этого хуситы подбили британский грузовой корабль:
18 февраля между 21:30 и 22:45 [по местному времени] по балкеру MV Rubymar, плавающему под флагом Белиза и принадлежащему Великобритании, были запущены две противокорабельные баллистические ракеты с территории Йемена, контролируемой поддерживаемыми Ираном хуситами. Одна из ракет попала по борту, нанеся повреждения. Судно подало сигнал бедствия, и военный корабль коалиции вместе с другим торговым судном отреагировал на вызов, чтобы помочь экипажу Rubymar. Команда была доставлена в близлежащий порт на торговом корабле.
Спустя 10 минут в X–аккаунте официального представителя ВС Йемена вышел новый отчёт, согласно которому за прошедшие сутки ВМС страны провели четыре операции. «Первая была направлена против британского корабля, в результате чего он, слава Аллаху, был полностью потоплен», — говорилось в сводке. Однако британские государственные ведомства затопление не подтвердили.
Более того, 21 февраля на BBC опубликовали свежие снимки, согласно которым балкер Rubymar не ушёл под воду, несмотря на повреждения. То, что корабль находился над водой, подтверждали и спутниковые снимки. По данным издания, полученным от оператора судна, на тот момент корабль буксировали в Джибути, но он всё ещё мог затонуть. Также оператор Blue Fleet Group сообщил, что одна ракета хуситов попала в борт судна возле его машинного отделения и оно накренилось, а второй снаряд поразил палубу. Кроме того, 21 февраля журналисты из проекта Les Observateurs телеканала France 24 связались с одним из менеджеров Rubymar, и тот подтвердил, что «корабль устойчив и всё ещё на плаву». 24 февраля Центральное командование ВС США уточнило, что судно стоит на якоре, но медленно набирает воду,\ и что в результате атаки образовалось нефтяное пятно длиной 18 миль (около 29 км).
Однако на обеих вирусных записях показано, как запечатлённый корабль полностью уходит под воду. На самом деле эти ролики старые и не имеют никакого отношения к атаке на Rubymar 18 февраля, да и показаны на них затопления разных судов.
Преднамеренное затопление у берегов Бразилии
Выполнив обратный поиск по скриншоту первого ролика, фактчекеры Les Observateurs нашли статью, датированную июнем 2020 года, в которой описывается затопление грузового корабля Stellar Banner у берегов Бразилии. Двухминутное видео, фрагмент которого завирусился в феврале 2024-го, было опубликовано на YouTube ещё 12 июня 2020 года. На нём показано, как Stellar Banner, плававший под флагом Маршалловых островов и принадлежавший южнокорейской компании Polaris Shipping, был намеренно потоплен после того, как в феврале 2020 года получил повреждения и сел на мель с грузом руды.
Кораблекрушение у берегов Омана
Что касается второго происшествия, то „Проверено“ обнаружило 12-минутное видео со вторым вирусным отрывком под названием „Судно тонет на глазах“, опубликованное на YouTube ещё в 2015 году. В описании говорится, что на кадрах показано затопление турецкого балкера Atlantik Confidence, плававшего под флагом Либерии. Инцидент произошёл в начале апреля 2013 года после того, как 30 марта в машинном отделении судна вспыхнул пожар.
Таким образом, оба видео, распространяемые в соцсетях и СМИ, не иллюстрируют затопление британского балкера Rubymar в Красном море. В действительности на них запечатлены старые инциденты: один произошёл в 2020 году у побережья Бразилии, а другой — в 2013 году у побережья Омана.
Итог: Неправда
Translation:
Are these videos of the British ship Rubymar sinking after a Houthi attack true?
In February 2024, two videos circulated in media and on social media that allegedly showed a ship sinking after being damaged by Yemeni militants. We have verified the veracity of both videos.
In November 2023, Iran-backed Houthi leaders announced that their forces would attack all Israeli-linked vessels passing near the coast of Yemen. A few months later, on February 20, 2024, two short videos began to circulate online that allegedly showed the British ship Rubymar sinking after it was reportedly hit by the Houthis in the Red Sea the day before, on February 19. Some publications contain additional details: for example, that two anti-ship missiles were fired at the vessel, causing a fire, that the crew was evacuated, and that this is the first recorded case of the destruction of a Western vessel by Yemeni militants. Some publications contain two frames of the alleged sinking of the Rubymar. For example, this was done by the authors of the Telegram channels "Dmitry Vasilets" (233,000 views at the time of writing this analysis), "Voyenkor Kotenok" (137,000), "Myslivets Yegor" (89,000 and 76,000), "Zloy Zhurnalist" (58,000) and "Rybar" (52,000, post deleted), as well as the public page "Voennaya Khronika" (103,000) on VKontakte. However, most other resources only show one of the two posts — this was the case in the Telegram channels “Russia Now” (249,000 views), “Operational Summaries” (183,000), “Militarist” (165,000), Zergulio (140,000), Yo'l-yo'lakay (114,000, post in Uzbek), “Ostashko! Important” (113,000), “Tucker Carlson in Russian” (87,000), “Ponomar” (57,000), TarikNezalejko️️ (54,000) and “Freshness” (62,000). In addition, the newspapers “Arguments and Facts” and “Business Online” reported on these videos. On the morning of February 19, a Yemeni military spokesman said that the Yemeni Navy had hit the British ship Rubymar during an operation in the Gulf of Aden. According to the spokesman, the vessel had suffered catastrophic damage and had come to a complete stop. “As a result of the severe damage to the vessel, it is now at risk of sinking in the Gulf of Aden. During the operation, we ensured that the crew safely abandoned the vessel,” the spokesman added.
That evening, US Central Command confirmed in a statement that the Houthis had hit a British cargo ship the day before:
On February 18, between 21:30 and 22:45 [local time], two anti-ship ballistic missiles were launched from Houthi-controlled Yemeni territory at the Belize-flagged bulk carrier MV Rubymar. One of the missiles hit the side, causing damage. The vessel sent out a distress signal, and a coalition warship, along with another merchant vessel, responded to the call to assist the Rubymar crew. The crew was transported to a nearby port on a merchant ship.
Ten minutes later, a new report was posted on the X-account of the official representative of the Yemeni Armed Forces, according to which the country's navy carried out four operations over the past 24 hours. "The first was directed against a British ship, as a result of which, thank God, it was completely sunk," the report said. However, British government agencies did not confirm the sinking.
Moreover, on February 21, the BBC published fresh images according to which the Rubymar bulk carrier did not sink, despite the damage. The fact that the ship was above water was also confirmed by satellite images. According to the publication, received from the ship's operator, at that time the ship was being towed to Djibouti, but it could still sink. The Blue Fleet Group operator also reported that one Houthi missile hit the vessel near its engine room, causing it to list, while a second shell hit the deck. In addition, on February 21, journalists from the France 24 project Les Observateurs contacted one of the Rubymar managers, who confirmed that "the ship is stable and still afloat." On February 24, the US Central Command clarified that the ship was at anchor but slowly taking on water, and that the attack had created an 18-mile (about 29 km) oil slick. However, both viral videos show the ship in question sinking completely underwater. In fact, these videos are old and have nothing to do with the February 18 attack on the Rubymar, and they show the sinking of different ships.Intentional sinking off the coast of Brazil
By performing a reverse search on a screenshot of the first video, Les Observateurs fact-checkers found an article dated June 2020 that describes the sinking of the cargo ship Stellar Banner off the coast of Brazil. The two-minute video, a portion of which went viral in February 2024, was published on YouTube on June 12, 2020. It shows how the Stellar Banner, which was sailing under the flag of the Marshall Islands and belonged to the South Korean company Polaris Shipping, was intentionally sunk after being damaged and running aground with a cargo of ore in February 2020.
Shipwreck off the coast of Oman
As for the second incident, “Verified” found a 12-minute video with a second viral fragment, titled “The ship is sinking before our eyes,” published on YouTube back in 2015. The description states that the footage shows the sinking of the Turkish bulk carrier Atlantik Confidence, which was sailing under the Liberian flag. The incident occurred in early April 2013 after a fire broke out in the vessel's engine room on March 30.
So both videos circulating on social media and in the media do not illustrate the sinking of the British bulk carrier Rubymar in the Red Sea. In fact, they show older incidents: one in 2020 off the coast of Brazil, and the other in 2013 off the coast of Oman.
Bottom Line: False
false_claim: Video was showing rockets fired by Houthi forces against US navy ships.

content:
Des théories infondées attribuent le séisme en Turquie au programme américain HAARP
- Cet article date de plus d'un an
- Publié le 16 février 2023 à 16:41
- Lecture : 11 min
- Par : Paula CABESCU, Saladin SALEM, AFP Allemagne, AFP Roumanie
- Traduction et adaptation : Bénédicte REY
Copyright AFP 2017-2024. Toute réutilisation commerciale du contenu est sujet à un abonnement. Cliquez ici pour en savoir plus.
A l'aube du 6 février, un séisme de magnitude 7,8, suivi de plus d'une centaine de secousses, a frappé la Turquie et la Syrie, faisant plus de 39.000 morts, selon les bilans officiels au 15 février. Ce séisme, l'une des pires catastrophes survenues dans la région depuis un siècle, a ravagé des régions entières et fait des dizaines de milliers de blessés et de sans-abri, auxquels s'ajoutent de multiples dégâts matériels.
Peu après la catastrophe, des publications ont circulé sur les réseaux sociaux, prétendant montrer le tremblement de terre en Turquie au cours de la nuit. Le ciel est traversé d'éclairs lumineux. Les auteurs des messages s'interrogeaient sur ces phénomènes lumineux. Certains internautes prétendaient que ces éclairs étaient une preuve que le séisme avait été provoqué "artificiellement" et mettaient en cause le programme de recherche américain HAARP.
"Vous avez vu des #tremblements de terre avec des éclairs ? Tout le monde se demande si le tremblement de terre en #Turquie ne serait pas #HAARP", peut-on lire sur ce message Twitter du 7 février, partagé plus de 1.000 fois depuis.
Des affirmations similaires ont été partagées dans d'autres langues comme l'espagnol, le néerlandais, le hongrois et le tchèque. Certaines s'appuient sur une autre vidéo, montrant également des éclairs lumineux, comme ce message publié sur Twitter le 6 février et partagé plus de 1.600 fois. "Le tremblement de terre en Turquie ressemble à une opération punitive (HAARP) de l'OTAN ou des Etats-Unis envers la Turquie. La vidéo montre des éclairs, ce qui n'est pas normal lors de séismes, mais arrive toujours lors des opérations harp (sic)".
Cette dernière vidéo a en outre été tournée avant le séisme, comme le montre dans le coin supérieur gauche de l'image une date indiquant l'année 2022. Une recherche par mots-clés sur la base des termes utilisés dans la vidéo a finalement permis à l'AFP de trouver le clip original sur Youtube. La vidéo y a été téléchargée le 23 novembre 2022, soit plus de deux mois avant le violent séisme de février 2023.
L'AFP a interrogé plusieurs experts en astronomie, en géophysique et en sciences de la terre, qui ont estimé que ces affirmations étaient des théories du complot sans fondement. La technologie HAARP n'a pas la capacité de déclencher un tel événement, et les lumières visibles dans ces vidéos sont un phénomène souvent observé lors des tremblements de terre, ont-ils expliqué.
Qu'est-ce que HAARP ?
Le programme de recherche sur les aurores actives à haute fréquence, ou HAARP, se concentre sur l'étude des propriétés et du comportement de l'ionosphère, qui, comme l'explique la NASA ici, est la couche supérieure de l'atmosphère terrestre qui rencontre le début de l'espace.
Sur son site, HAARP affirme être l'émetteur haute puissance et haute fréquence le plus performant au monde pour étudier l'ionosphère, qui commence à environ 60-80 km d'altitude et s'étend jusqu'à plus de 500 km d'altitude.
"L'objectif des recherches d'HAARP est de mener une étude fondamentale des processus physiques à l'œuvre dans les parties les plus élevées de notre atmosphère", indique le site.
Le programme utilise les ondes radio pour chauffer les électrons dans l'ionosphère, créant ainsi "de petites perturbations qui sont similaires aux types d'interactions qui se produisent dans la nature" mais qui sont plus faciles à étudier pour les scientifiques, y explique-t-on.
Créé en 1990 à l'initiative du Congrès américain, et alors géré conjointement par l'armée de l'air et la marine américaines, le centre avait pour objectif de recherche "de comprendre et d'utiliser le phénomène pour améliorer les systèmes de communication et de surveillance à des fins civiles et de défense". "Son objectif était d'étudier les propriétés physiques et électriques de l'ionosphère terrestre qui peuvent affecter nos systèmes de communication et de navigation militaires et civils", précise le site d'HAARP.
Le centre a été cédé en 2015 à l'université d'Alaska-Fairbanks et aucun personnel militaire n'est actuellement affecté à la station de recherche, selon les informations fournies par le programme sur son site.
HAARP répond également sur son site à un certain nombre de questions sur son travail et aborde également diverses théories infondées qui entourent la station de recherche depuis des années. L'AFP a déjà démenti l'affirmation selon laquelle le programme pouvait modifier le climat (ici).
Aucun mécanisme plausible pour déclencher un séisme avec HAARP
Interrogée par l'AFP le 11 février sur les affirmations selon lesquelles HAARP serait à l'origine des tremblements de terre du 6 février, Jessica Matthews, responsable du programme, a déclaré que ce n'était pas possible.
"Le récent tremblement de terre et les pertes tragiques de vies humaines en Turquie mettent en évidence la destruction que peuvent causer les catastrophes naturelles. Les équipements de recherche du site HAARP ne peuvent pas créer ou amplifier les catastrophes naturelles", a-t-elle déclaré à l'AFP.
Plusieurs experts indépendants interrogés par l'AFP ont abondé dans ce sens.
Les ondes radio d'HAARP chauffent l'ionosphère sur une surface limitée d'environ 100 kilomètres, a ainsi expliqué Jeffrey Hughes, professeur d'astronomie à l'Université de Boston le 8 février. "Il n'est pas possible qu'il puisse être utilisé pour créer un effet au sol à l'autre bout du monde", a-t-il dit.
"Les ondes radio peuvent perturber artificiellement la haute atmosphère, mais c'est comparable aux perturbations causées par le soleil. Je n'ai connaissance d'aucune preuve scientifique qu'une onde artificielle puisse provoquer des perturbations plus importantes et avoir un impact sur des conditions sismiques locales", a déclaré à l'AFP le 8 février Toshi Nishimura, géophysicien et enseignant-chercheur au Boston University College of Engineering.
"Il n'existe actuellement pas de technologies permettant de lancer des ondes radio depuis le sol et de toucher une ville précise sur un autre continent. Il ne semble pas possible que des ondes radios puissent avoir un impact sur des conditions sismiques lointaines", a-t-il ajouté.
"Il n'y a aucun mécanisme plausible par lequel un tremblement de terre pourrait être déclenché par un tel dispositif/arme", a renchéri auprès de l'AFP le 8 février Susan Hough, géophysicienne au sein du service géologique du gouvernement américain (USGS), a qualifié ces affirmations de "science-fiction".
"Il n'existe tout simplement aucun mécanisme connu permettant à quelque chose ressemblant de près ou de loin à HAARP d'avoir un quelconque impact sur les tremblements de terre", a également estimé le 8 février David Keith, professeur de physique appliquée à la Harvard School of Engineering and Applied Sciences.
"HAARP n'est pas une arme sous quelque forme que ce soit, ne l'a jamais été et ne peut pas être utilisé comme une arme", a affirmé le 8 février Michael Lockwood, spécialiste de la physique de l'espace à l'université de Reading au Royaume-Uni, qui a travaillé avec des instruments scientifiques similaires.
L'intérêt militaire pour cette technologie a concerné "les communications, et non une quelconque forme d'armement", a-t-il expliqué, estimant que les théories complotistes sur l'utilisation d'HAARP en tant qu'arme pouvaient provenir du fait que le programme a initialement étudié l'utilisation des ondes radio pour communiquer avec les sous-marins nucléaires.
Cela s'est "transformé en l'idée absurde que HAARP est une forme d'armement : une forme de contrôle mental social est (la thèse, ndlr) habituelle favorite, mais générer des tremblements de terre est une idée que nous n'avions jamais entendue auparavant", a déclaré Michael Lockwood.
D'où viennent les séismes ?
L'ionosphère, au coeur du projet de recherche d'HAARP, est a des kilomètres du phénomène à l'origine des tremblements de terre, provoqués par les mouvements des plaques tectoniques.
Assemblées à la manière d'un puzzle à la surface de la terre, les plaques tectoniques sont en mouvement constant, se déplaçant de quelques centimètres par an dans des directions différentes. "La croûte, la partie supérieure des plaques, se déforme de façon élastique jusqu’à un point de rupture. Elle casse alors brutalement le long d’une ou plusieurs failles, créant des secousses plus ou moins violentes", provoquant un séisme, explique le musée de sismologie de l'Université de Strabourg sur son site. Ceux-ci se concentrent pour la plupart sur les bordures de plaques.
La Turquie est située sur une des principales zones sismiques du globe. Elle avait enregistré en 1999 un tremblement de terre sur la faille d'Anatolie du Nord, dans la région septentrionale de Düzce, qui avait causé la mort de plus de 17.000 personnes.
Le 6 février, la terre a tremblé de l'autre côté du pays, près de la frontière syrienne, le long de la faille d'Anatolie de l'Est, provoquant le "pire désastre naturel en un siècle" à toucher un pays de la zone européenne de l'Organisation mondiale de la santé (OMS).
Les séismes peuvent provoquer des éclairs lumineux
Plusieurs experts interrogés par l'AFP ont expliqué que les éclairs lumineux visibles sur les vidéos étaient des phénomènes relativement courants lors de tremblements de terre, bien que leur origine fasse l'objet de débats.
Un phénomène similaire avait ainsi été observé lors d'un tremblement de terre de magnitude 7,0 qui avait frappé le Mexique près de la ville d'Acapulco en septembre 2021.
Les phénomènes tels que les éclairs, les boules lumineuses, les serpentins et les flashs réguliers signalés en association avec des tremblements de terre sont appelés lumières sismiques (EQL), explique l'USGS ici.
"La plupart des experts s'accordent sur l'existence des lumières sismiques : des flashs lumineux observés lors de forts séismes. Parfois, les lumières sont générées par des explosions de transformateurs, mais il y a des preuves que les lumières proviennent du sol lui-même", a expliqué Susan Hough de l'USGS à l'AFP.
"Il y a des idées sur la raison de leur apparition, mais je ne pense pas qu'il existe une théorie largement acceptée pour les expliquer, en partie parce qu'il s'agit d'une observation tellement éphémère qu'elle est difficile à documenter", a-t-elle ajouté. "Plus controversée est l'affirmation selon laquelle les lumières sismiques précèdent en fait certains grands tremblements de terre - ceci, à mon avis, est beaucoup moins bien établi que les lumières qui apparaissent pendant les tremblements de terre."
Pour John Vidale, doyen et professeur de sciences de la Terre à l'université de Californie du Sud (USC) interrogé le 8 février par l'AFP, "les vidéos de ce type proviennent généralement de transformateurs électriques qui ont été court-circuités lors de fortes secousses. Parfois, de fortes secousses peuvent entraîner une bioluminescence dans l'eau le long de la côte, qui est une lueur et non un flash. Des flashs peuvent parfois être vus depuis des transformateurs au loin avant que les ondulations n'atteignent l'endroit où se trouvent les observateurs."
Bien qu'il ne sache pas "ce qui a causé les flashs" dans la vidéo tournée lors du séisme en Turquie, le professeur Hughes, de l'Université de Boston estime qu'"ils ne ressemblent en rien aux aurores, qui ne clignotent pas, mais sont continues et se déplacent lentement". "Ils me semblent, du moins certains d'entre eux, être le genre de flashs que l'on obtient lorsque les systèmes d'alimentation électrique se mettent en court-circuit, ce qui, j'en suis sûr, s'est produit lors de la destruction du tremblement de terre", a-t-il ajouté.
L'aurore, mentionnée par certains internautes, fait référence à un phénomène lumineux caractérisé par des voiles changeant de forme et extrêmement colorés dans le ciel nocturne. Elle n'apparaît généralement que dans les régions polaires.
Bien que de faibles émissions optiques aient été formées à l'aide d'HAARP, le site du programme indique que l'énergie qu'il génère est "tellement plus faible que ces processus naturels qu'il est incapable de produire le type d'effet optique observé pendant une aurore".
"La vidéo suggère que le temps était nuageux cette nuit-là. La lumière ne vient pas de l'espace, mais vient du sol et est réfléchie par les nuages", a estimé Toshi Nishimura. "Il semble peu probable que ces lumières aient un rapport avec les ondes radio d'un autre continent", a-t-il ajouté.
Le tremblement de terre du 6 février, qui a dévasté le sud de la Turquie et la Syrie a donné lieu à la publication de nombreuses informations erronées et d'images et de vidéos détournées. L'AFP a vérifié d'autres rumeurs, notamment sur la supposée prédictibilité des séismes.
Translation:
Unfounded theories attribute Turkey earthquake to US HAARP program
- This article is over a year old
- Published on February 16, 2023 at 4:41 p.m.
- Reading: 11 min
- By: Paula CABESCU, Saladin SALEM, AFP Germany, AFP Romania
- Translation and adaptation: Bénédicte REY
Copyright AFP 2017-2024. Any commercial reuse of the content is subject to a subscription. Click here to learn more.
At dawn on February 6, a 7.8 magnitude earthquake, followed by more than a hundred tremors, struck Turkey and Syria, killing more than 39,000 people, according to official reports as of February 15. This earthquake, one of the worst disasters to occur in the region in a century, devastated entire regions and left tens of thousands injured and homeless, in addition to widespread material damage.
Shortly after the disaster, posts circulated on social media purporting to show the earthquake in Turkey overnight. The sky is shot through with flashes of light. The authors of the messages wondered about these light phenomena. Some Internet users claimed that these flashes were proof that the earthquake had been caused "artificially" and called into question the American research program HAARP.
"Have you seen #earthquakes with lightning? Everyone is wondering if the earthquake in #Turkey wouldn't be #HAARP", we can read on this Twitter message from February 7, shared more than 1,000 times Since.
Similar claims have been shared in other languages ​​such as Spanish, Dutch, Hungarian and Czech. Some are based on another video, also showing flashes of light, like this message published on Twitter on February 6 and shared more than 1,600 times. "The earthquake in Turkey looks like a punitive operation (HAARP) by NATO or the United States against Turkey. The video shows lightning, which is not normal during earthquakes, but always happens during harp operations (sic)".
This latest video was also filmed before the earthquake, as shown in the upper left corner of the image by a date indicating the year 2022. A keyword search based on the terms used in the video ultimately allowed for AFP to find the original clip on YouTube. The video was uploaded there on November 23, 2022, more than two months before the violent earthquake of February 2023.
AFP interviewed several experts in astronomy, geophysics and earth sciences, who said the claims were baseless conspiracy theories. HAARP technology does not have the capacity to trigger such an event, and the lights visible in these videos are a phenomenon often seen during earthquakes, they explained.
What is HAARP?
The High-Frequency Active Auroral Research Program, or HAARP, focuses on studying the properties and behavior of the ionosphere, which, as NASA explains here, is the upper layer of Earth's atmosphere which meets the beginning of space.
On its website, HAARP claims to be the world's most capable high-power, high-frequency transmitter for studying the ionosphere, which begins at around 60-80 km altitude and extends to more than 500 km above sea level. altitude.
“The goal of HAARP research is to conduct a fundamental study of the physical processes at work in the highest parts of our atmosphere,” the site says.
The program uses radio waves to heat electrons in the ionosphere, creating "small disturbances that are similar to the types of interactions that occur in nature" but are easier for scientists to study, it explains. your.
Created in 1990 at the initiative of the American Congress, and then jointly managed by the American Air Force and Navy, the center's research objective was "to understand and use the phenomenon to improve communication systems and surveillance for civil and defense purposes. “Its objective was to study the physical and electrical properties of the Earth's ionosphere which can affect our military and civilian communication and navigation systems,” specifies the HAARP website.
The center was turned over in 2015 to the University of Alaska-Fairbanks and no military personnel are currently assigned to the research station, according to information provided by the program on its website.
HAARP also answers a number of questions about its work on its site and also addresses various unfounded theories that have surrounded the research station for years. The AFP has already denied the claim that the program could change the climate (here).
No plausible mechanism for triggering an earthquake with HAARP
Asked by AFP on February 11 about claims that HAARP was behind the February 6 earthquakes, Jessica Matthews, head of the program, said that was not possible.
"The recent earthquake and tragic loss of life in Turkey highlight the destruction that natural disasters can cause. The research equipment at the HAARP site cannot create or amplify natural disasters," she said. declared to AFP.
Several independent experts interviewed by AFP agreed with this.
HAARP's radio waves heat the ionosphere over a limited area of ​​around 100 kilometers, explained Jeffrey Hughes, professor of astronomy at Boston University on February 8. “There is no way it could be used to create a ground effect on the other side of the world,” he said.
"Radio waves can artificially disrupt the upper atmosphere, but this is comparable to disturbances caused by the sun. I am not aware of any scientific evidence that an artificial wave can cause greater disturbances and impact local seismic conditions,” Toshi Nishimura, geophysicist and teacher-researcher at Boston University College of Engineering, told AFP on February 8.
"There are currently no technologies available to launch radio waves from the ground and hit a specific city on another continent. It does not seem possible that radio waves could impact distant seismic conditions," he said. he added.
“There is no plausible mechanism by which an earthquake could be triggered by such a device/weapon,” Susan Hough, a geophysicist with the US Government Geological Survey (USGS), told AFP on February 8. ), called these claims "science fiction".
“There is simply no known mechanism for anything remotely resembling HAARP to have any impact on earthquakes,” David Keith, professor of applied physics at the Harvard School of Engineering and Applied Sciences.
“HAARP is not a weapon in any form, never has been, and cannot be used as a weapon,” Michael Lockwood, a space physics specialist at the University of Reading in the United Kingdom, which has worked with similar scientific instruments.
Military interest in this technology has been "communications, not any form of weaponry", he explained, believing that conspiracy theories about the use of HAARP as a weapon could come from fact that the program initially studied the use of radio waves to communicate with nuclear submarines.
This "transformed into the absurd idea that HAARP is a form of weaponry: a form of social mind control is the usual favorite, but generating earthquakes is an idea we never had." never heard before,” said Michael Lockwood.
Where do earthquakes come from?
The ionosphere, at the heart of the HAARP research project, is miles away from the phenomenon at the origin of earthquakes, caused by the movements of tectonic plates.
Assembled like a puzzle on the earth's surface, the tectonic plates are in constant motion, moving a few centimeters per year in different directions. “The crust, the upper part of the plates, deforms elastically to a breaking point. It then breaks suddenly along one or more faults, creating more or less violent tremors”, causing an earthquake, explains the seismology museum of the University of Strabourg on its site. These mostly focus on the plate edges.
Turkey is located in one of the main seismic zones in the world. In 1999, it recorded an earthquake on the North Anatolian fault, in the northern region of Düzce, which caused the death of more than 17,000 people.
On February 6, the earth shook on the other side of the country, near the Syrian border, along the East Anatolian Fault, causing the "worst natural disaster in a century" to hit a country of the European zone of the World Health Organization (WHO).
Earthquakes can cause flashes of light
Several experts interviewed by AFP explained that the flashes of light visible in the videos were relatively common phenomena during earthquakes, although their origin is the subject of debate.
A similar phenomenon was observed during a 7.0 magnitude earthquake which struck Mexico near the city of Acapulco in September 2021.
Phenomena such as lightning, light balls, streamers and regular flashes reported in association with earthquakes are called earthquake lights (EQL), the USGS explains here.
"Most experts agree on the existence of seismic lights: flashes of light seen during strong earthquakes. Sometimes the lights are generated by transformer explosions, but there is evidence that the lights come from the ground itself. "even," Susan Hough of the USGS told AFP.
"There are ideas about why they appear, but I don't think there is a widely accepted theory to explain them, partly because it is such a fleeting observation that it is difficult to document,” she added. “More controversial is the claim that seismic lights actually precede some large earthquakes – this, in my opinion, is much less well established than lights that appear during earthquakes.”
For John Vidale, dean and professor of Earth sciences at the University of Southern California (USC) interviewed on February 8 by AFP, "videos of this type generally come from electrical transformers that have been short-circuited during sometimes strong shaking can cause bioluminescence in the water along the coast, which is a glow and not a flash. Flashes can sometimes be seen from transformers in the distance before the ripples reach. where the observers are."
Although he does not know "what caused the flashes" in the video shot during the earthquake in Turkey, Professor Hughes of Boston University believes that "they are nothing like auroras, which do not flash not, but are continuous and move slowly. "They appear to me, at least some of them, to be the kind of flashes you get when electrical power systems short circuit, which I'm sure has happened during the destruction of the earthquake,” he added.
The aurora, mentioned by some Internet users, refers to a light phenomenon characterized by shape-changing and extremely colorful sails in the night sky. It generally only appears in polar regions.
Although weak optical emissions have been formed using HAARP, the program's site states that the energy it generates is "so much weaker than these natural processes that it is incapable of producing the type of optical effect observed during an aurora".
"The video suggests that the weather was cloudy that night. The light does not come from space, but comes from the ground and is reflected by the clouds," said Toshi Nishimura. “It seems unlikely that these lights have anything to do with radio waves from another continent,” he added.
The earthquake of February 6, which devastated southern Turkey and Syria, gave rise to the publication of numerous erroneous information and distorted images and videos. AFP verified other rumors, notably on the supposed predictability of earthquakes.
false_claim: The February earthquake in Turkey was caused by HAARP technology.

content:
Falske beviser for at Zelenskyj er narkoman
Flere videoer prøver å få deg til å tro at Ukrainas president, Volodomyr Zelenskyj, bruker narkotika. Påstanden er en del av Russlands propaganda.
Helt siden Majdan-revolusjonen i 2014, har Russlands president, Vladimir Putin, forsøkt å sverte ukrainske styresmakter. I opptakten til krigen som startet 24. februar, haglet det med beskyldninger fra øst, blant annet at Ukraina styres av nynazister.
Et annen annen sentral beskyldning som rettes mot de ukrainske statslederne, er at de er narkomane.
– Narkomane og nynazister som styrer fra Kyiv, og holder det ukrainske folket fanget som gisler, sa Putin i en tale på krigens andre dag.
Hvitt pulver manipulert inn
Nå deles det flere videoer i sosiale medier, også her hjemme, som angivelig skal bevise at Ukrainas president er narkoman.
I en video, der Zelenskyj har et møte med blant annet den amerikanske entreprenøren Elon Musk, ligger det tilsynelatende kokain på pulten hans.
Videoen er ekte, men det hvite pulveret er manipulert inn. Det har blant annet Bellingcat, som jobber med å verifisere fakta i krigen i Ukraina, konkludert med.
Klippet og redigert narko-hyllest
I en annen video framstår det som at Zelenskyj anbefaler folk å bruke narkotika for å komme seg gjennom dagen.
Denne videoen er redigert og klippet, for å få det til å virke som at Zelenskyj hyller narkotika. I virkeligheten hyller han kaffe og trening, som du kan se i videoen øverst i denne artikkelen.
I tillegg spres det to ekte videoer som skal «bevise» at Zelenskyj er ruset. Også disse kan du se i videoen øverst i denne artikkelen.
Translation:
False evidence that Zelenskyj is a drug addict
Several videos try to make you believe that the President of Ukraine, Volodymyr Zelenskyj, uses drugs. The claim is part of Russia's propaganda.
Ever since the Maidan revolution in 2014, the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, has tried to smear the Ukrainian authorities. In the run-up to the war that started on 24 February, there was a hail of accusations from the East, including that Ukraine is ruled by neo-Nazis.
Another central accusation leveled at the Ukrainian leaders is that they are drug addicts.
- Drug addicts and neo-Nazis who rule from Kyiv, and hold the Ukrainian people captive as hostages, Putin said in a speech on the second day of the war.
White powder manipulated in
Several videos are now being shared on social media, including here at home, which allegedly prove that the president of Ukraine is a drug addict.
In a video, in which Zelenskyj has a meeting with, among others, the American entrepreneur Elon Musk, there is apparently cocaine on his desk.
The video is real, but the white powder has been manipulated. That is what Bellingcat, which works to verify the facts of the war in Ukraine, has concluded.
Cut and edited drug tribute
In another video, it appears that Zelenskyy recommends people use drugs to get through the day.
This video has been edited and cropped to make it appear that Zelenskyj is praising drugs. In reality, he praises coffee and exercise, as you can see in the video at the top of this article.
In addition, two real videos are being circulated that are supposed to "prove" that Zelenskyj is intoxicated. You can also see these in the video at the top of this article.
false_claim: Zelensky is using cocaine.

content:
Falošné titulky zavádzajú používateľov sociálnych sietí prokremeľskou propagandou
- Tento článok je viac ako rok starý.
- Uverejnené 3. mája 2022 o 15:31
- Článok prečítate za 4 min
- Autor: Rossen BOSSEV, AFP Bulharsko
- Článok preložil/-a Robert BARCA
Copyright © AFP 2017-2024. Pre akékoľvek komerčné použitie tohto obsahu je nutné predplatenie našich služieb. Viac informácií zistíte tu.
Viac ako 4,9-tisíc používateľov Facebooku zdieľalo len 12-sekundové video súkromného používateľa Facebooku z 25. apríla 2022, v ktorom vidíme prezidenta Ukrajiny Volodymyra Zelenského rozprávať sa s okolostojacimi vojakmi.
Vo videu vidíme nepravdivé titulky v češtine a pod nimi aj v bulharčine. Podľa nich mal Zelenskyj vojakom údajne povedať: „Pokiaľ strieľate, strieľajte v noci. Tak nikto nebude mať podozrenie, ako tomu bolo v Buči.“ Podľa titulkov mal teda ukrajinský prezident odkazovať na predmestie Kyjeva, ktoré sa stalo dejiskom masakru civilistov. Mŕtvoly na uliciach boli v Buči objavené po tom, ako sa ruské jednotky stiahli z mesačnej okupácie.
Jeden z vojakov sa ho následne podľa nepravdivých titulkov spýta: „A čo ak nás uvidia? Čo je v pláne?“
„Je nám to jedno,“ odpovedá vraj Zelenskyj.
Ďalších viac 7,5-tisíc používateľov zdieľalo rovnaké video, ktoré o deň neskôr publikoval na svojom facebookovom profile Fedor Flašík, majiteľ internetového portálu eReport a jeden zo zakladajúcich členov strany Smer-SD.
Komentáre pod virálnym videom naznačujú, že mnohí používatelia uverili tomu, že video je autentické. „To je h*jzel fasista,“ píše sa v jednom z komentárov. „Takže sa vlastne priznal,“ píše sa v druhom.
Video zapadá do naratívu Kremľa, podľa ktorého boli obete v Buči fingované. Rusko odmietlo zodpovednosť za zločiny a obvinilo Ukrajinu, že mŕtvoly naaranžovala po tom, ako sa jej jednotky stiahli z mesta - hoci satelitné snímky ukazujú, že telá tam boli už niekoľko týždňov.
Agentúra AFP už v minulosti vyvrátila tvrdenia, že telá civilistov v Buči boli zinscenované s pomocou hercov.
Predmetné video v súčasnosti zdieľané na Facebooku v skutočnosti nemá nič spoločné s prebiehajúcou vojnou na Ukrajine. Bolo natočené v roku 2019 a zobrazuje návštevu Volodomyra Zelenského na frontovej línii na Donbase. Titulky v češtine a bulharčine, ktoré sú súčasťou videa, nemajú nič spoločné so skutočným rozhovorom. Ba čo viac, video bolo zhotovené ako experiment bulharskej online relácie „Majstri éteru“, aby tak ukázali, ako ľahko sa dá manipulovať s verejnou mienkou používateľov na internete.
Krátky film z roku 2019
Agentúra AFP vykonala reverzné vyhľadávanie obrázkov pomocou záberov z videa a zistila, že virálne zábery boli vystrihnuté z 20-minútového videa, ktoré Zelensky zverejnil na Facebooku 27. októbra 2019. Toto video s názvom „2 dni v Zolotom“ je možné nájsť aj na YouTube.
Film je o Zelenského návšteve frontu v Donbase v roku 2019 pri dedine Zolote v Luhansku. Na tomto mieste sa stretáva aj s ukrajinskými vojakmi blízko frontovej línie. Scény použité v zmanipulovanom videu, ktoré šírili aj slovenskí používatelia, boli vystrihnuté z času 02:40 až 03:17 pôvodnej nahrávky.
V spomínanom čase Zelenskij diskutuje s vojakmi v ukrajinčine o tom, kedy je najlepší čas na návštevu frontových pozícií, na ktoré sa chce pozrieť. „Takže povedzme, že teraz sa môžeme presunúť na pozíciu,“ hovorí Zelenskyj. „Navrhoval by som zajtra ráno,“ odpovedá vojak.
„Ak strieľajú, strieľajú v noci, takže by bolo zaujímavé ísť v noci,“ hovorí však Zelensky. Následne diskutujú o tom, ako budú na front cestovať, či pôjdu „Toyotou alebo obrneným vozom“.
Pri segmente v originálnom videu, ktorý bol zostrihaný do virálneho FB videa, vidíme, že titulky v skutočnosti vôbec nekorešpondujú s tým, čo sa píše v titulkoch: „Keď strieľate, strieľajte v noci, takže nikto nebude mať podozrenie, ako tomu bolo v Buči.“
Experiment bulharskej šou
Predmetné video s nepravdivými bulharskými titulkami bolo pôvodne zverejnené na Facebooku 18. apríla 2022.
O niekoľko dní neskôr, 21. apríla 2022, zverejnila populárna online relácia s názvom „Majstri éteru“ (Originálny názov Господари на ефира, pozn. red.) 9-minútovú videoreportáž s názvom „Pozor! Boli ste vytrollení!“.
Redaktorka vo videu podrobne vysvetľuje, ako vytvorili video s falošnými titulkami na základe populárnych fám kremeľskej propagandy. Vytvorili tiež falošný profil na Facebooku s menom „Ники Ласкин“, prostredníctvom ktorého sa video šírilo - najmä na krajne pravicových a proputinovských stránkach. Za tri dni zdieľalo video v bulharčine viac ako 19 000 používateľov Facebooku a dokonca ho prebrali aj bulharské televízne kanály, ako napríklad Eurocom či krajne pravicová televízia Alfa.
21. apríla 2022 bol pôvodný príspevok upravený - falošné video bolo nahradené odkazom na príbeh o celom experimente. Tieto zmeny bolo možné dosledovať v histórii úprav v príspevku na Facebooku:
Aj po vymazaní pôvodného videa sa však toto ďalej šírilo sociálnymi sieťami a o niekoľko dní neskôr sa objavila aj verzia s doplnenými českými titulkami.
Máte tip na správu, ktorú by sme v AFP mohli overiť?
Kontaktujte nás
Translation:
Fake headlines mislead social media users with pro-Kremlin propaganda
- This article is over a year old.
- Posted May 3, 2022 at 3:31 pm
- You can read the article in 4 minutes
- Author: Rossen BOSSEV, AFP Bulgaria
- The article was translated by Robert BARCA
Copyright © AFP 2017-2024. Any commercial use of this content requires subscription to our services. You can find more information here.
More than 4.9 thousand Facebook users have shared just a 12-second video of a private Facebook user from April 25, 2022, in which we see the President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky talking to the soldiers standing by.
In the video we see false subtitles in Czech and below them also in Bulgarian. According to them, Zelenskyi should have told the soldiers: "If you shoot, shoot at night." That way, no one will be suspicious, as was the case in Bucha." According to the headlines, the Ukrainian president was supposed to be referring to the suburb of Kyiv, which became the scene of a massacre of civilians. Dead bodies on the streets were discovered in Buča after Russian troops withdrew from the month-long occupation.
According to the false captions, one of the soldiers then asks him: "And what if they see us? What's the plan?'
"We don't care," Zelenskyi allegedly replies.
Another 7.5 thousand users shared the same video, which was published a day later on his Facebook profile by Fedor Flašík, the owner of the Internet portal eReport and one of the founding members of the Smer-SD party.
The comments below the viral video suggest that many users believed the video to be authentic. "He's a fucking fascist," reads one of the comments. "So he actually confessed," reads the second.
The video fits into the Kremlin's narrative, according to which the victims in Buča were faked. Russia has denied responsibility for the crimes and accused Ukraine of arranging the corpses after its troops withdrew from the city - although satellite images show the bodies had been there for weeks.
The AFP agency has already refuted claims that the bodies of civilians in Buča were staged with the help of actors.
The video in question currently being shared on Facebook actually has nothing to do with the ongoing war in Ukraine. It was filmed in 2019 and depicts Volodymyr Zelensky's visit to the front line in Donbass. The subtitles in Czech and Bulgarian, which are part of the video, have nothing to do with the actual interview. What's more, the video was made as an experiment by the Bulgarian online show "Masters of the Air", to show how easy it is to manipulate the public opinion of users on the Internet.
Short film from 2019
AFP conducted a reverse image search using footage from the video and found that the viral footage was cut from a 20-minute video that Zelensky posted on Facebook on October 27, 2019. The video, titled "2 days in Zolot", can also be found on YouTube .
The film is about Zelensky's visit to the front in Donbas in 2019 near the village of Zolote in Luhansk. In this place, he also meets Ukrainian soldiers near the front line. The scenes used in the manipulated video, which was also shared by Slovak users, were cut from 02:40 to 03:17 of the original recording.
At the mentioned time, Zelenskiy is discussing with the soldiers in Ukrainian when is the best time to visit the front positions that he wants to look at. "So let's say we can move into position now," says Zelensky. "I would suggest tomorrow morning," replies the soldier.
"If they shoot, they shoot at night, so it would be interesting to go at night," says Zelensky. They then discuss how they will travel to the front, whether they will go by "Toyota or an armored car".
In the segment in the original video that was edited into the viral FB video, we see that the captions do not actually correspond at all to what the captions say: "When you shoot, shoot at night, so no one will be suspicious, as was the case in Buča .”
Bulgarian show experiment
The video in question, with false Bulgarian subtitles, was originally posted on Facebook on April 18, 2022.
A few days later, on April 21, 2022, the popular online show "Masters of the Ether" (Original title Господари на ефира, editor's note) published a 9-minute video report entitled "Attention! You have been trolled!".
In the video, the editor explains in detail how they created a video with fake headlines based on popular Kremlin propaganda rumors. They also created a fake Facebook profile with the name "Ники Ласкин", through which the video was distributed - mainly on far-right and pro-Putin sites. In three days, the video in Bulgarian was shared by more than 19,000 Facebook users and was even picked up by Bulgarian TV channels, such as Eurocom and the far-right Alfa TV.
On April 21, 2022, the original post was edited - the fake video was replaced with a link to the story of the entire experiment. These changes could be seen in the edit history of the Facebook post:
However, even after the original video was deleted, it continued to spread on social networks, and a few days later a version with added Czech subtitles appeared.
Do you have a tip for a report that we at AFP could verify?
Contact us
false_claim: Volodymyr Zelensky is Nazi and drug addict.

content:
Правда ли, что Франция отправила в Украину солдат Иностранного легиона?
В начале мая 2024 года российские СМИ сообщили, что 100 военнослужащих французского подразделения переброшены в Донецкую область Украины. Мы решили проверить, насколько эта информация достоверна.
5 мая „Российская газета“, „Комсомольская правда“, Lenta.ru, „Газета.ру“ и другие издания написали, что 100 солдат французского Иностранного легиона были отправлены воевать в Украину. Утверждалось, что они были развернуты в поддержку 54-й отдельной механизированной бригады ВСУ в Славянске, а сами военнослужащие относятся к одному из основных подразделений Иностранного легиона — 3-му пехотному полку. Большинство СМИ ссылались на Стивена Брайена, бывшего помощника замминистра обороны США, и его статью в издании Asia Times
Российская пропаганда в последние два месяца стала активнее обычного атаковать Францию и президента страны Эмманюэля Макрона. Это связано с заявлениями политика о возможной отправке французских военных в Украину. После этого французский президент стал излюбленным героем создателей фейковых новостей: именно ему, например, было посвящено большинство поддельных обложек в первые месяцы 2024 года.
Статья в Asia Times, на которую ссылаются российские СМИ, действительно существует, она была опубликована 4 мая. Её автор, Стивен Брайен, пишет в первом же абзаце: „Франция впервые официально отправила свои войска в Украину“. Далее он отмечает, что пока речь идёт о 100 военнослужащих, но в будущем их число дойдёт до 1500. Брайен, как и указано в пересказах его текста, раньше занимал пост помощника заместителя министра обороны США — правда, это было ещё в 1987-1989 годах, при президентах Рональде Рейгане и Джордже Буше-старшем.
Через два дня Asia Times внесла правки в статью, снабдив её уведомлением о том, что сам автор засомневался в своих источниках (которые, впрочем, в оригинальном тексте не привёл).
