For example, the silhouette of a person appears distorted, a bale of straw appears to crush the cabin of a tractor, and wheels are seen without vehicles. On the other hand, there is no record that the protests of French farmers have reached the center of Paris, specifically the vicinity of the Eiffel Tower.
Therefore, as we have explained, the image showing the Eiffel Tower surrounded by tractors and straw is not real, but was created with artificial intelligence. At Newtral.es we have debunked other hoaxes related to the demonstrations, such as a video that supposedly corresponded to French farmers pushing an armored vehicle with a tractor. The sequence was recorded in Brussels in 2015.
Sources
reverse search on google
Vincent Smadja's LinkedIn profile
AFP Factual Verification
false_claim: Images shows haystacks and tractors in front of the Eiffel Tower in Paris.

content:
I bus elettrici in Norvegia non sono «tutti paralizzati dal gelo»
Il 6 gennaio 2024 la redazione di Facta ha ricevuto una segnalazione via WhatsApp che chiedeva di verificare una notizia, pubblicata su alcune testate e agenzie e diffusa anche sui social media, secondo cui in Norvegia i bus elettrici sarebbero stati «paralizzati dal gelo».
Secondo un post pubblicato sulla pagina Facebook di Gianluigi Paragone, la Norvegia avrebbe lanciato un allarme per i bus elettrici, che sarebbero «tutti bloccati» dal freddo, mentre sul sito del giornalista Nicola Porro si legge che l’introduzione della nuova flotta di bus elettrici a Oslo, capitale della Norvegia, ha «paralizzato completamente» la città». «Bocciata la transizione green», ha scritto il sito Byoblu nel commentare la notizia. Un contenuto simile circola anche su TikTok.
Si tratta di una notizia imprecisa.
Innanzitutto, è necessario sottolineare che in questi giorni la Scandinavia è colpita da forti nevicate e da un’ondata di gelo eccezionale. Nel nord della Svezia e della Finlandia si sono registrate temperature minime inferiori ai -40 °C. Come riporta il quotidiano norvegese Aftenposten, una stazione meteorologica di Oslo ha toccato i 30 °C sottozero. Si tratta perciò di condizioni estreme – anche per il clima dei Paesi nordici – che spesso causano disagi e problemi, anche nei trasporti.
Tuttavia, non è vero che l’intera flotta di autobus elettrici a Oslo, recentemente introdotti nella capitale, sia rimasta bloccata a causa del freddo. Un portavoce di Ruter, l’azienda che gestisce i bus elettrici della città, ha comunicato a Euronews che le notizie sul blocco dei mezzi a causa del gelo rappresentano «un’estrema esagerazione» dal momento che sono state «cancellate, in media, tra le 50 e le 100 partenze, su più di 4000 partenze giornaliere, per pochi giorni». L’azienda ha però sperimentato alcuni problemi a causa dell’autonomia ridotta dei bus, come riportato da diverse testate norvegesi. Ruter ha comunque dichiarato sempre a Euronews di aver «risolto il problema modificando i turni di ricarica e anche sistemando l’infrastruttura di ricarica».
La riduzione dell’autonomia delle batterie, in condizioni di freddo intenso, è un problema noto. Il gelo rallenta le reazioni chimiche che avvengono nelle batterie, diminuendo la loro carica. Come ha spiegato a Euronews Anna Stefanopoulou, professoressa di ingegneria meccanica all’Università del Michigan, a -12 °C un veicolo elettrico può perdere fino al 30-40 per cento della sua autonomia. Ma, ha aggiunto l’esperta, temperature ben al di sotto dello zero possono creare problemi anche ai motori a combustione interna.
Non si tratta di un problema di tecnologia, afferma Stefanopoulou, ma di organizzazione e pianificazione. «Gli autobus dovrebbero rimanere in carica tutta la notte e fino prima dell’inizio dell’attività», ha spiegato l’esperta, così da consentire alle batterie di raggiungere la massima autonomia. Inoltre, si potrebbero cambiare i loro percorsi o dotare i mezzi di riscaldatori diesel da utilizzare, in caso di necessità, nei mesi freddi per compensare la perdita di autonomia del 30 per cento.
L’amministrazione di Oslo si è data l’obiettivo di raggiungere le emissioni zero entro il 2024 nel settore dei trasporti pubblici. La Norvegia è uno dei Paesi in cui il mercato dei veicoli elettrici è in maggiore espansione. Nel 2022 l’88 per cento delle nuove auto vendute erano a batteria o ibride plug-in.
Su Facta ci siamo già occupati di notizie fuorvianti sui veicoli elettrici fermi a causa del freddo.
Photo Credits: miledile81 via TikTok
Translation:
Electric buses in Norway are not "all paralyzed by frost"
On 6 January 2024, the Facta editorial team received a report via WhatsApp asking them to verify a news story, published in some newspapers and agencies and also spread on social media, according to which electric buses in Norway had been "paralysed by the frost".
According to a post published on Gianluigi Paragone's Facebook page, Norway would have raised an alarm for electric buses, which would be "all blocked" by the cold, while on the website of journalist Nicola Porro we read that the introduction of the new fleet of electric buses in Oslo, the capital of Norway, it "completely paralyzed" the city." «The green transition rejected», wrote the Byoblu website in commenting on the news. Similar content is also circulating on TikTok.
This is inaccurate news.
First of all, it is necessary to underline that these days Scandinavia is hit by heavy snowfalls and an exceptional wave of frost. In northern Sweden and Finland, minimum temperatures below -40 °C were recorded. As reported by the Norwegian newspaper Aftenposten, a weather station in Oslo reached 30°C below zero. These are therefore extreme conditions - also for the climate of the Nordic countries - which often cause inconvenience and problems, even in transport.
However, it is not true that the entire fleet of electric buses in Oslo, recently introduced in the capital, were stranded due to the cold. A spokesperson for Ruter, the company that manages the city's electric buses, told Euronews that the reports of the vehicles being blocked due to the frost represent "an extreme exaggeration" since they were "cancelled, on average, between the 50 and 100 departures, out of more than 4000 daily departures, for a few days". However, the company has experienced some problems due to the reduced autonomy of the buses, as reported by several Norwegian newspapers. However, Ruter always declared to Euronews that he had "solved the problem by modifying the charging shifts and also by fixing the charging infrastructure".
The reduction of battery autonomy, in intense cold conditions, is a known problem. Frost slows down the chemical reactions that take place in batteries, decreasing their charge. As Anna Stefanopoulou, professor of mechanical engineering at the University of Michigan, explained to Euronews, at -12°C an electric vehicle can lose up to 30-40 percent of its autonomy. But, the expert added, temperatures well below zero can also create problems for internal combustion engines.
This is not a problem of technology, says Stefanopoulou, but of organization and planning. «The buses should remain charged all night and until before the start of the activity», explained the expert, so as to allow the batteries to reach maximum autonomy. Furthermore, their routes could be changed or the vehicles equipped with diesel heaters to be used, if necessary, in the cold months to compensate for the 30 percent loss of autonomy.
The Oslo administration has set itself the goal of achieving zero emissions in the public transport sector by 2024. Norway is one of the countries where the electric vehicle market is expanding the most. In 2022, 88 percent of new cars sold were battery-powered or plug-in hybrids.
On Facta we have already dealt with misleading news about electric vehicles stopped due to the cold.
Photo Credits: miledile81 via TikTok
false_claim: The majority of electric buses in Norway were blocked by cold weather, leading to traffic paralysis in Oslo.

content:
L’Hémicycle non ha raffigurato in copertina Macron come un gallo spennato
Il 18 marzo 2024 è stata pubblicata su X un’immagine che mostra la presunta copertina del numero 514 de L’Hémicycle, rivista trimestrale francese, in cui il presidente francese Emmanuel Macron è raffigurato come un gallo senza penne. Nella parte in basso a destra dell’immagine in analisi è presente anche il logo dell’emittente televisiva d’informazione francese France 24. Secondo chi l’ha condivisa, «il canale France 24» avrebbe mandato in onda e discusso la «copertina “tanto attesa” della rivista, in cui Macron è raffigurato come un gallo arrabbiato spennato».
Si tratta di una notizia falsa.
L’Hémicycle non ha mai pubblicato una simile copertina. Il numero 514 del trimestrale ha in copertina un disegno di un gallo gallico, simbolo della nazione francese, posizionato di profilo, ma non c’è alcun riferimento al presidente Macron. Come spiegato dalla stessa rivista, il numero è dedicato all’analisi della «narrazione nazionale, che si trova in uno stato di disordine. Ricostruire la nazione è il presupposto per ricostruire la società».
Sul proprio sito web, L’Hémicycle ha spiegato di aver sporto denuncia per contraffazione, furto di identità, diffamazione e diffusione di informazioni false contro pravda-fr.com. Si tratta di un sito russo che ha pubblicato per primo una presunta clip della trasmissione Face à face di France24 in cui viene presentata la falsa copertina in questione.
In realtà France24 non ha mai mandato in onda la falsa copertina di L’Hémicycle. Come spiegato dalla stessa emittente televisiva, il 13 marzo 2024 il caporedattore de L’Hémicycle, David Revault d’Allonnes, è stato ospite della trasmissione Face à face e ha presentato la rivista numero 514 del trimestrale. Questo video è stato però successivamente modificato digitalmente per diffondere disinformazione. Nella clip manipolata, infatti, la copertina originale in cui è disegnato il gallo gallico è stata sostituita con la falsa copertina in cui Emmanuel Macron è raffigurato nel corpo di un gallo spennato.
Su Facta abbiamo analizzato diverse false copertine attribuite a varie riviste francesi contro Emmanuel Macron.
Translation:
L'Hémicycle did not depict Macron as a plucked rooster on its cover
On March 18, 2024, an image was published on In the lower right part of the image under analysis there is also the logo of the French news television station France 24. According to those who shared it, "the France 24 channel" would have broadcast and discussed the "cover" long-awaited" of the magazine, in which Macron is depicted as an angry plucked rooster."
This is fake news.
L'Hémicycle has never published such a cover. Issue 514 of the quarterly has on the cover a drawing of a Gallic rooster, symbol of the French nation, positioned in profile, but there is no reference to President Macron. As explained by the magazine itself, the issue is dedicated to the analysis of the «national narrative, which is in a state of disorder. Rebuilding the nation is the prerequisite for rebuilding society."
On its website, Lémicycle explained that it had filed a complaint for counterfeiting, identity theft, defamation and dissemination of false information against pravda-fr.com. It is a Russian site that first published an alleged clip from France24's Face à face program in which the fake cover in question is presented.
In reality, France24 never broadcast the fake cover of L'Hémicycle. As explained by the television station itself, on 13 March 2024 the editor-in-chief of L'Hémicycle, David Revault d'Allonnes, was a guest on the Face à face program and presented magazine number 514 of the quarterly. However, this video was later digitally edited to spread misinformation. In the manipulated clip, in fact, the original cover in which the Gallic rooster is drawn has been replaced with the false cover in which Emmanuel Macron is depicted in the body of a plucked rooster.
On Facta we analyzed several false covers attributed to various French magazines against Emmanuel Macron.
false_claim: The cover depicts Macron as a plucked rooster.

content:
No, i Simpson non hanno previsto l’incidente del sommergibile Titan
Il 26 giugno 2023 la redazione di Facta.news ha ricevuto una segnalazione via WhatsApp che chiedeva di verificare un’immagine pubblicata su Facebook in cui compaiono quattro presunte scene della serie animata statunitense I Simpson. Nella prima si vede il relitto di un vascello in fondo al mare. Nella seconda scena ci sono due piccoli sommergibili guidati dal protagonista della serie, Homer Simpson, e da un altro personaggio. La terza immagine mostra una scritta in inglese nera su sfondo giallo dove si legge «Oxygen low» (in italiano, «Ossigeno basso»). Nella quarta scena si vedono altri due personaggi della serie con una radiotrasmittente. Nell’immagine si legge anche un testo che recita: «I Simpson avevano previsto anche questo».
Il riferimento è alla vicenda del Titan, il sommergibile scomparso il 18 giugno 2023 con cui cinque persone erano scese nelle profondità dell’oceano Atlantico per esplorare il relitto del transatlantico Titanic, affondato nel 1912. L’immersione a pagamento era stata organizzata dalla società statunitense OceanGate Expeditions. Dopo diversi giorni di ricerca, la guardia costiera statunitense ha riferito che il sommergibile sarebbe imploso, uccidendo tutti e cinque i passeggeri, e che alcuni suoi rottami sono stati trovati vicino al relitto del Titanic.
Secondo il post analizzato, quindi, i Simpson, in una delle loro puntate, avrebbero previsto quanto accaduto al sommergibile Titan.
Si tratta di un contenuto fuorviante, che veicola una notizia infondata. Questo tipo di contenuto fa parte di una narrazione disinformativa più ampia su presunte previsione dei Simpson di cui siamo occupati in un approfondimento.
Le quattro scene riprese nel tweet segnalato provengono dalla puntata della serie andata in onda nel 2006 e intitolata “Homer’s Paternity Coot”. Nella puntata in questione, Homer e colui che crede essere il suo vero padre biologico scendono con due sommergibili nell’oceano alla ricerca di un tesoro perduto, contenuto in un galeone spagnolo affondato secoli prima a causa di una tempesta. Durante l’impresa, Homer segue una luce pensando sia il tesoro, ma in realtà è un pesce luminoso, e rimane incastrato in un corallo. A questo punto la spia del sommergibile segnala che l’ossigeno sta per esaurirsi. Poco prima di svenire, Homer vede il sommergibile dell’altro personaggio arrivare in suo aiuto. Quando si risveglia, dopo un coma di tre giorni, Homer è in ospedale.
Esistono, quindi, differenze sostanziali tra l’episodio dei Simpson andato in onda nel 2006 e la vicenda del sommergibile Titan di giugno 2023. Ad esempio, Homer va alla ricerca di un tesoro perduto presente nel relitto di un galeone spagnolo, non va ad esplorare i resti del Titanic. Inoltre, nella puntata ci sono due sommergibili e non uno solo contenente cinque persone. Nella serie animata, poi, nessun personaggio muore, al contrario di quanto accaduto con l’implosione del Titan.
Dopo l’incidente del sommergibile Titan, Mike Reiss, uno dei produttori e sceneggiatori dei Simpson, ha dichiarato di aver partecipato l’estate scorsa a un’immersione a pagamento organizzata sempre dalla OceanGate Expeditions per vedere i resti del Titanic. È quindi improbabile che l’esperienza del 2022 di Reiss abbia un qualche legame con un episodio dei Simpson del 2006. Reiss inoltre non era lo sceneggiatore dell’episodio “Homer’s Paternity Coot”.
In un’intervista del 2020, Bill Oakley, ex sceneggiatore dei Simpson, aveva dichiarato alla rivista statunitense The Hollywood Reporter, che quelle che alcuni credono essere delle previsioni fatte dalla serie erano in realtà solo coincidenze «perché gli episodi sono così vecchi che la storia si ripete. La maggior parte di questi episodi si basa su fatti accaduti negli anni ’60, ’70 o ’80 di cui eravamo a conoscenza».
Translation:
No, The Simpsons did not predict the Titan submarine accident
On June 26, 2023, the editorial staff of Facta.news received a report via WhatsApp asking to verify an image published on Facebook in which four alleged scenes from the American animated series The Simpsons appear. In the first you see the wreck of a vessel at the bottom of the sea. In the second scene there are two small submarines driven by the protagonist of the series, Homer Simpson, and another character. The third image shows black English writing on a yellow background where it reads "Oxygen low". In the fourth scene we see two other characters from the series with a radio transmitter. In the image you can also read a text that reads: «The Simpsons predicted this too».
The reference is to the story of the Titan, the submarine that disappeared on 18 June 2023 in which five people had descended into the depths of the Atlantic Ocean to explore the wreck of the transatlantic Titanic, which sank in 1912. The paid dive was organized by the US company OceanGate Expeditions. After several days of searching, the U.S. Coast Guard reported that the submarine imploded, killing all five passengers, and that some of its wreckage was found near the wreck of the Titanic.
According to the post analyzed, therefore, the Simpsons, in one of their episodes, would have predicted what happened to the Titan submarine.
This is misleading content, which conveys unfounded news. This type of content is part of a larger disinformative narrative on alleged Simpsons predictions that we are dealing with in an in-depth article.
The four scenes filmed in the reported tweet come from the episode of the series aired in 2006 and entitled "Homer's Paternity Coot". In the episode in question, Homer and the one he believes to be his real biological father go down into the ocean with two submarines in search of a lost treasure, contained in a Spanish galleon that sank centuries earlier due to a storm. During the quest, Homer follows a light thinking it is the treasure, but in reality it is a luminous fish, and gets stuck in a coral. At this point the submarine's light signals that the oxygen is running out. Just before passing out, Homer sees the other character's submarine coming to his aid. When he wakes up after a three-day coma, Homer is in the hospital.
There are, therefore, substantial differences between the Simpsons episode aired in 2006 and the story of the Titan submarine in June 2023. For example, Homer goes in search of a lost treasure present in the wreck of a Spanish galleon, he does not go to explore the remains of the Titanic. Furthermore, in the episode there are two submarines and not just one containing five people. In the animated series, then, no character dies, unlike what happened with the implosion of the Titan.
After the accident of the Titan submarine, Mike Reiss, one of the producers and screenwriters of the Simpsons, declared that last summer he took part in a paid dive organized by OceanGate Expeditions to see the remains of the Titanic. It is therefore unlikely that Reiss' 2022 experience has any connection to a 2006 Simpsons episode. Reiss was also not the writer of the "Homer's Paternity Coot" episode.
In a 2020 interview, Bill Oakley, former Simpsons screenwriter, told the US magazine The Hollywood Reporter that what some believe to be predictions made by the series were actually just coincidences «because the episodes are so old that the story repeats itself. Most of these episodes are based on events that happened in the 60s, 70s or 80s that we knew about."
false_claim: The Simpsons predicted the Titan submarine crash.

content:
Non, le sol n'était pas jonché de déchets au festival de Glastonbury après le discours de Greta Thunberg
- Cet article date de plus d'un an
- Publié le 05 juillet 2022 à 15:50
- Mis à jour le 05 juillet 2022 à 16:41
- Lecture : 4 min
- Par : Rossen BOSSEV, AFP Mexique
- Traduction et adaptation : Chloé RABS
Copyright AFP 2017-2024. Toute réutilisation commerciale du contenu est sujet à un abonnement. Cliquez ici pour en savoir plus.
Des milliers de sacs et de bouteilles en plastique devant la scène du festival de musique Glastonbury, au sud de l'Angleterre. "Ils ont applaudi Greta Thunberg puis sont partis", affirment plusieurs publications partagées des milliers de fois sur Facebook, Twitter et Telegram (ici, ici ou ici), accusant les spectateurs et sympathisants de la militante écologiste d'être à l'origine de cette dégradation.
Dans les commentaires, de nombreux internautes s'insurgent contre son "fan club de wokistes-écolos-bobos" qui ne respecteraient pas la planète, appelant la conférence de Greta Thunberg, "le plus grand rassemblement d'hypocrites".
Des affirmations similaires ont été diffusées en anglais, espagnol, allemand, portugais et bulgare.
Le 25 juin dernier, Greta Thunberg a bien prononcé un discours depuis la Pyramid Stage de Glastonbury, dans lequel elle a évoqué la responsabilité des hommes politiques dans la lutte contre le réchauffement climatique. Dans sa déclaration, elle a appelé à ne pas abandonner les efforts et a mis en garde contre le "gouffre" dont "nous" nous rapprochons.
Cependant, la photographie accusant les spectateurs d'incivilité date en réalité du 29 juin 2015 et a notamment été publiée dans un article du Daily Mail, qui relate l'opération de nettoyage ayant eu lieu à la fin du festival de Glastonbury cette année-là. Il est également précisé que le cliché a été pris par David Hedges de l'agence SWNS.
Contacté par l'AFP via son compte Instagram, David Hedges a affirmé : "La photo en question a été prise par moi en 2015. Je n'étais pas à Glastonbury cette année et je ne travaille plus pour SWNS".
L'AFP était également sur place et le photographe Oli Scarff a pris des images similaires le même jour.
Selon le journal britannique The Independant, le 29 juin 2015, "une équipe de recyclage dédiée de 800 personnes a commencé à ramasser les déchets à 6 heures du matin alors que plus de 150 000 festivaliers rejoignaient leur domicile". "Glastonbury offre des billets gratuits aux volontaires qui ramassent les déchets sur le site après le départ des festivaliers."
Ces dernières années, les organisateurs du festival ont d'ailleurs pris des mesures pour réduire l'impact environnemental de l'évènement. En 2019, la vente de bouteilles en plastique a par exemple été interdite. Des bouteilles réutilisables ont été proposées à la place.
Le 27 juin 2022, à la fin du festival de cette année, de nombreux détritus ont été signalés devant la scène principale. Le compte twitter officiel du festival a posté une photo de la Pyramid Stage, montrant un terrain sans déchets, notant : "Les ramasseurs de déchets ont déjà fait un travail incroyable."
The litter pickers have already been doing an amazing job. pic.twitter.com/wbrejrqnPq
— Glastonbury Live (@GlastoLive) June 27, 2022
Les spectateurs et sympathisants de Greta Thunberg ne sont donc pas à l'origine de l'état déplorable de la pelouse devant la scène sur la photographie. Figure de la lutte contre le réchauffement climatique, la Suédoise est régulièrement la cible de nombreuses fausses informations dans le monde.
Déjà, en septembre 2019, une photo d'un parc couvert d'ordures avait été partagée plusieurs milliers de fois sur Facebook, dans des publications assurant qu'il s'agissait de détritus abandonnés après une manifestation de Greta Thunberg, à New-York. En réalité, la photo avait été prise à Londres, en avril 2019.
5 juillet 2022 Corrige coquille dans le chapô
Translation:
No, the ground wasn't littered with trash at the Glastonbury festival after Greta Thunberg's speech
- This article is over a year old
- Published on July 5, 2022 at 3:50 p.m.
- Updated July 5, 2022 at 4:41 p.m.
- Reading: 4 min
- By: Rossen BOSSEV, AFP Mexico
- Translation and adaptation: Chloé RABS
Copyright AFP 2017-2024. Any commercial reuse of the content is subject to a subscription. Click here to learn more.
Thousands of plastic bags and bottles in front of the stage at the Glastonbury music festival in the south of England. “They applauded Greta Thunberg then left,” claim several publications shared thousands of times on Facebook, Twitter and Telegram (here, here or here), accusing the spectators and supporters of the environmental activist of being at the origin of this degradation.
In the comments, many Internet users protest against his "fan club of wokists-ecologists-bobos" who do not respect the planet, calling Greta Thunberg's conference, "the largest gathering of hypocrites".
Similar claims have been broadcast in English, Spanish, German, Portuguese and Bulgarian.
On June 25, Greta Thunberg gave a speech from the Pyramid Stage at Glastonbury, in which she discussed the responsibility of politicians in the fight against global warming. In her statement, she called for efforts not to be abandoned and warned of the "chasm" that "we" are getting closer to.
However, the photograph accusing the spectators of incivility actually dates from June 29, 2015 and was notably published in an article in the Daily Mail, which relates the clean-up operation which took place at the end of the Glastonbury festival that year . It is also specified that the photo was taken by David Hedges of the SWNS agency.
Contacted by AFP via his Instagram account, David Hedges said: "The photo in question was taken by me in 2015. I was not at Glastonbury this year and I no longer work for SWNS."
AFP was also on site and photographer Oli Scarff took similar images the same day.
According to the British newspaper The Independent, on June 29, 2015, "a dedicated recycling team of 800 people began collecting waste at 6 a.m. as more than 150,000 festival-goers headed home." “Glastonbury is offering free tickets to volunteers who pick up litter on site after festival-goers have left.”
In recent years, the festival organizers have taken measures to reduce the environmental impact of the event. In 2019, for example, the sale of plastic bottles was banned. Reusable bottles were offered instead.
On June 27, 2022, at the end of this year's festival, widespread littering was reported in front of the main stage. The festival's official Twitter account posted a photo of the Pyramid Stage, showing a litter-free field, noting: "The litter pickers have already done an incredible job."
The litter pickers have already been doing an amazing job. pic.twitter.com/wbrejrqnPq
— Glastonbury Live (@GlastoLive) June 27, 2022
Greta Thunberg's spectators and supporters are therefore not the cause of the deplorable state of the lawn in front of the stage in the photograph. A figure in the fight against global warming, the Swede is regularly the target of much false information around the world.
Already, in September 2019, a photo of a park covered in garbage had been shared several thousand times on Facebook, in publications assuring that it was trash abandoned after a Greta Thunberg demonstration in New York. . In reality, the photo was taken in London in April 2019.
July 5, 2022 Correct typo in the chapter
false_claim: Out-of-context pictures of the festival field in Glastonbury after Greta Thunberg’s performance.

content:
CNN no ha difundido la imagen de una explosión de 2015 como si fuera de Ucrania en 2022, es un montaje
El bulo realiza un montaje a partir de un directo de la cadena estadounidense. También la foto de la explosión ha sido alterada
Diversos mensajes en las redes sociales acusan a la cadena de televisión estadounidense CNN de haber hecho pasar una imagen de 2015 como si fuera una explosión actual en la guerra de Rusia contra Ucrania. Sin embargo, esto es falso. El contenido viral, que circula también en español en redes como Facebook, se trata de un montaje en el que se han alterado varias imágenes.
“Ucrania. Exactamente la misma explosión con siete años de diferencia”, dice la publicación en español que estamos verificando. Este mensaje es acompañado por tres imágenes, una de ellas una supuesta captura de una reciente transmisión de CNN. En ella aparece un titular en inglés cuya traducción es “Explosión de fuego mayormente pacífica en Ucrania”. Además, se incluyen elementos gráficos similares a los directos de la cadena como el logo, rótulos y cintillos de última hora.
Dentro de esta supuesta captura del directo de CNN, podemos ver la imagen de una explosión y una gran nube de humo. A un costado, el montaje viral muestra otras dos fotos de esta misma explosión señalando que se trata de imágenes de 2015.
Sin embargo, la fotografía de la explosión sí corresponde a la invasión rusa de este año, pero en el mensaje que circula en redes fue editada. Te lo explicamos.
La imagen de la explosión en Ucrania que publicó CNN no es de 2015, sino de 2022
El montaje que contrapone las tres fotografías de una explosión en Ucrania se comparte con mensajes en los que los usuarios acusan a la cadena CNN de engañar a sus televidentes. Pero la captura de la supuesta transmisión es un fotomontaje que usa – con alteraciones – una imagen real de la reciente guerra en Ucrania, según los resultados de una búsqueda inversa en el buscador ruso Yandex.
La fotografía que supuestamente es de 2015 realmente fue difundida por la Presidencia de Ucrania el 24 de febrero de 2022 y publicada en una galería fotográfica en la edición web de CNN, el 4 de marzo de 2022 con el título Rusia invade Ucrania (imagen 130). “Una foto proporcionada por la oficina del presidente de Ucrania parece mostrar una explosión en Kiev a principios del 24 de febrero”, dice el pie de foto.
La fotografía de la explosión, situada en Kiev, fue publicada por otros medios internacionales como NBC y New York Post entre el 24 y 25 de febrero de 2022. NBC menciona que fue cedida por autoridades ucranianas a la agencia de fotografía Zuma Press, que de hecho la incluye en su colección de este 2022.
Las búsquedas inversas de la imagen real de la explosión en Ucrania, en Yandex y Google, no arrojan registros anteriores a febrero de 2022, por lo cual no hay pruebas de que sea de 2015 como aseguran los mensajes en las redes sociales.
El fotomontaje de una transmisión en vivo que usa el logo de CNN
La falsa transmisión de CNN es similar a un directo del 25 de agosto de 2020 en el que el canal de noticias, bajo el título de “protestas feroces, pero en su mayoría pacíficas”, informó sobre las protestas ciudadanas en Wisconsin, Estados Unidos, después de que la policía disparara a un hombre negro por la espalda. Esa transmisión fue criticada porque el periodista se refería a manifestaciones pacíficas cuando tenía de fondo a un coche en llamas.
Una comparación entre la imagen falsa viral y la transmisión real muestra las mismas previsiones meteorológicas de Boston, Nueva York y Philadelphia. Sin embargo, hay diferencias en el cartel que precisa el lugar de la imagen que aparece en televisión. En el caso del contenido falso, el formato es más grande.
El montaje de CNN sobre la explosión en Ucrania usa una fotografía de Joe Biden
En la falsa imagen de la transmisión de CNN aparecen las siluetas de dos personas y un perro. Esos elementos están sobrepuestos y corresponden a una imagen de Joe Biden y su esposa, Jill, jugando en la playa con su perro Commander, el 28 de diciembre de 2021 y publicada por la agencia AP.
“La primera dama Jill Biden lanza una pelota al presidente Joe Biden mientras sacan a pasear a su perro Commander en Rehoboth Beach (Delaware), el martes 28 de diciembre de 2021”, dice la descripción de la fotografía cuyo autor es Patrick Semansky.
Este fotomontaje atribuido a CNN se suma a otros que han usado el logo de la cadena para desinformar sobre la invasión rusa y que hemos verificado en Newtral.es. Por ejemplo, CNN no informó que la invasión de Rusia a Ucrania cause miocarditis y tampoco afirmó que el mandatario brasileño Jair Bolsonaro evitó la “Tercera Guerra Mundial” en Ucrania.
Fuentes
Búsqueda en el buscador Yandex y Google Lens
Sitio web oficial Gobierno de Ucrania
Sitio web oficial del presidente Volodímir Zelenski
Sitio web archivado en Wayback Machine
Fotografía de Joe Biden en AP
Artículo sobre la invasión rusa en NBC
Artículo sobre la invasión rusa en New York Post
Sitio web de CNN
Translation:
CNN has not broadcast the image of a 2015 explosion as if it were from Ukraine in 2022, it is a montage
The hoax is montaged from a live broadcast on the American network. Also the photo of the explosion has been altered
Various messages on social networks accuse the American television network CNN of having passed off an image from 2015 as if it were a current explosion in Russia's war against Ukraine. However, this is false. The viral content, which also circulates in Spanish on networks such as Facebook, is a montage in which several images have been altered.
"Ukraine. “Exactly the same explosion seven years apart,” says the Spanish publication that we are verifying. This message is accompanied by three images, one of them an alleged capture of a recent CNN broadcast. It has a headline in English whose translation is “Mostly peaceful fire explosion in Ukraine.” In addition, graphic elements similar to the chain's direct ones are included, such as the logo, labels and last-minute ribbons.
Within this supposed capture from the CNN live, we can see the image of an explosion and a large cloud of smoke. On one side, the viral montage shows two other photos of this same explosion, indicating that they are images from 2015.
However, the photograph of the explosion does correspond to this year's Russian invasion, but it was edited in the message circulating on networks. We explain it to you.
The image of the explosion in Ukraine that CNN published is not from 2015, but from 2022
The montage that contrasts the three photographs of an explosion in Ukraine is shared with messages in which users accuse the CNN network of deceiving its viewers. But the capture of the alleged transmission is a photomontage that uses – with alterations – a real image of the recent war in Ukraine, according to the results of a reverse search on the Russian search engine Yandex.
The photograph that is supposedly from 2015 was actually released by the Presidency of Ukraine on February 24, 2022 and published in a photo gallery on the web edition of CNN, on March 4, 2022 with the title Russia invades Ukraine (image 130) . “A photo provided by the Ukrainian president's office appears to show an explosion in kyiv early on February 24,” the caption reads.
The photograph of the explosion, located in kyiv, was published by other international media such as NBC and New York Post between February 24 and 25, 2022. NBC mentions that it was provided by Ukrainian authorities to the Zuma Press photography agency, which In fact, it is included in its 2022 collection.
Reverse searches for the real image of the explosion in Ukraine, in Yandex and Google, do not return records prior to February 2022, so there is no evidence that it is from 2015 as the messages on social networks claim.
The photomontage of a live broadcast that uses the CNN logo
The fake CNN broadcast is similar to a live broadcast from August 25, 2020 in which the news channel, under the title “fierce, but mostly peaceful protests,” reported on citizen protests in Wisconsin, United States, after police shot a black man in the back. That broadcast was criticized because the journalist was referring to peaceful demonstrations when he had a burning car in the background.
A comparison between the viral fake image and the real broadcast shows the same weather forecasts for Boston, New York and Philadelphia. However, there are differences in the poster that specifies the location of the image that appears on television. In the case of fake content, the format is larger.
CNN montage of Ukraine explosion uses photo of Joe Biden
In the false image of the CNN broadcast the silhouettes of two people and a dog appear. These elements are superimposed and correspond to an image of Joe Biden and his wife, Jill, playing on the beach with their dog Commander, on December 28, 2021 and published by the AP agency.
“First Lady Jill Biden throws a ball to President Joe Biden while they take her dog Commander for a walk in Rehoboth Beach, Delaware, on Tuesday, December 28, 2021,” says the description of the photograph whose author is Patrick Semansky. .
This photomontage attributed to CNN joins others that have used the network's logo to misinform about the Russian invasion and that we have verified at Newtral.es. For example, CNN did not report that Russia's invasion of Ukraine caused myocarditis, nor did it claim that Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro prevented “World War III” in Ukraine.
Sources
Search in the Yandex search engine and Google Lens
Official website Government of Ukraine
Official website of President Volodymyr Zelensky
Website archived at Wayback Machine
AP photo of Joe Biden
Article about the Russian invasion on NBC
Article about the Russian invasion in the New York Post
CNN website
false_claim: Evidence suggests electoral fraud in France.

content:
Zdvižená pravice Borise Johnsona je fotomontáž
Na facebooku se šíří fotka, na které bývalý britský politik Boris Johnson hajluje. Údajně měl Johnson typický nacistický pozdrav spolu s tamními akademiky předvést v ukrajinském Lvově. Fotka je nicméně upravená – z originální fotografie i dostupného videozáznamu je vidět, že nikdo z přítomných zdviženou pravici neměl.
Meta fact-check 18. září 2023
Autor facebookového příspěvku fotku komentuje slovy: „Boris Johnson ve Lvově.“ Upravená fotografie zobrazuje bývalého britského premiéra a předsedu Konzervativní strany Borise Johnsona spolu se třemi zjevně akademickými hodnostáři, přičemž Johnson a další dva muži na fotografii mají zdviženou pravici v nacistickém pozdravu.
Originální fotka
Sdílená fotografie hajlujícího Johnsona je ale zmanipulovaná. Původní, neupravená fotografie opravdu pochází z ukrajinského Lvova, kde Boris Johnson 9. září 2023 převzal čestný doktorát na Národní univerzitě Ivana Franka. Fotku zveřejnilo ukrajinské médium 24 Kanal (24 Канал) v článku ze stejného dne, nikdo z přítomných ale na fotce nehajluje. Jako autora fotografie médium uvádí telegramový kanál ZAHIDWTF 24/7.
Průběh celé ceremonie předání čestného doktorátu Johnsonovi je zaznamenaný také na videu. Fotografie byla pravděpodobně pořízená ve chvíli, kdy sbor přítomný v sále zpíval ukrajinskou hymnu a následně hymnu Spojeného království (video, čas 3:20 – 6:27).
Na neoficiální návštěvě Ukrajiny Johnson kromě převzetí čestného titulu navštívil konferenci Yalta European Strategy a rehabilitační centrum Nezlamni pro zraněné vojáky.
Srovnání fotografií
Při podrobném porovnání původní a upravené fotografie je možné vidět detaily, které prozrazují, že fotka hajlujícího Borise Johnsona není pravá. V případě, že by osoby na fotkách opravdu měly ruce vztyčené vpřed, jejich slavnostní taláry by byly v oblasti ramen nadzvednuty. Ostatně při pohledu na jejich levou ruku je jasné, že jsou pod vrchní vrstvou taláru. Také místo, kde na původní fotce měl muž po pravici Borise Johnsona svou ruku, je po úpravě fotky nepřirozeně rozostřené.
Závěrečné hodnocení
Fotka Borise Johnsona a ukrajinských akademických hodnostářů tedy byla zjevně zmanipulována a Johnson ani ostatní ve skutečnosti nehajlovali. V rámci naší spolupráce se sociální sítí Facebook jsme proto fotku označili jako pozměněnou.
Translation:
Boris Johnson's raised right hand is a photomontage
A photo of former British politician Boris Johnson shouting is spreading on Facebook. Allegedly, Johnson was supposed to perform a typical Nazi salute together with local academics in Lviv, Ukraine. However, the photo has been edited - from the original photo and the available video, it can be seen that none of those present had their right hand raised.
Meta fact-checked on September 18, 2023
The author of the Facebook post captioned the photo: "Boris Johnson in Lviv." The edited photo shows former British Prime Minister and Conservative Party leader Boris Johnson alongside three apparently academic dignitaries, with Johnson and two other men in the photo holding their right hands up in a Nazi salute.
Original photo
But the shared photo of a screaming Johnson is manipulated. The original, unedited photo is indeed from Lviv, Ukraine, where Boris Johnson received an honorary doctorate from Ivan Franko National University on September 9, 2023. The photo was published by the Ukrainian media 24 Kanal (24 Канал) in an article from the same day, but none of those present are shouting at the photo. The medium credits ZAHIDWTF 24/7 Telegram channel as the author of the photo.
The course of the entire ceremony of conferring an honorary doctorate on Johnson is also recorded on video. The photo was probably taken when the choir present in the hall sang the Ukrainian national anthem and then the United Kingdom national anthem (video, time 3:20 – 6:27).
On an unofficial visit to Ukraine, in addition to receiving an honorary degree, Johnson visited the Yalta European Strategy conference and the Nezlamni rehabilitation center for wounded soldiers.
Photo comparison
When comparing the original and the edited photo in detail, it is possible to see details that reveal that the photo of a screaming Boris Johnson is not real. If the people in the photos really had their arms extended forward, their ceremonial robes would be raised in the shoulder area. After all, looking at their left hand, it is clear that they are under the top layer of the robe. Also, the place where the man on Boris Johnson's right had his hand in the original photo is unnaturally out of focus after editing the photo.
Final assessment
So the photo of Boris Johnson and Ukrainian academic dignitaries was obviously doctored and Johnson and the others weren't really kidding. As part of our cooperation with the social network Facebook, we have therefore marked the photo as altered.
false_claim: Boris Johnson is depicted making a Nazi salute during a public ceremony in Ukraine.

content:
Tämä mies ei ole Kiovan apulaispoliisipäällikkö
- Artikkeli on yli vuoden vanha.
- Julkaistu 19. huhtikuuta 2022 16:02
- Lukuaika: 8 minuuttia
- Teksti: Maja CZARNECKA, Marion DAUTRY, AFP Puola, AFP Belgrad
- Kääntänyt ja sovittanut suomeksi: Elias HUUHTANEN
Tekijänoikeus © AFP 2017-2024. Sisältöjen kaupallinen käyttö vaatii tilauksen. Lue lisää täältä.
“Kiovan apulaispoliisipäällikkö,” lukee 22. maaliskuuta 2022 julkaistussa Facebook-päivityksessä. Päivityksessä on kuva hakaristein tatuoidusta kaljusta miehestä ilman paitaa.
Samaa väitettä, jonka mukaan kyseinen natsitatuoinnein varustettu mies olisi Kiovan apulaispoliisipäällikkö, on jaettu satoja kertoja suomeksi eri sosiaalisissa medioissa (esim. täällä ja täällä). Väite on myös levinnyt esimerkiksi unkariksi ja serbiaksi.
Käänteinen kuvahaku Facebook-päivityksestä johtaa sosiaalisen median julkaisuihin, joissa kuvan miehen kerrotaan olevan Artem Bonov (esim. täällä, täällä ja täällä). Kuvissa Bonovilla on täsmälleen samat korut ja tatuoinnit kuin Facebook-päivityksen kuvassa. AFP oli yhteydessä Ukrainan äärioikeistoon perehtyneeseen toimittajaan ja tutkijaan Michael Colborneen Bonovin henkilöllisyyden selvittämiseksi.
"Tunnistan kasvot ja tatuoinnit", Colborne kertoi AFP:lle 25. maaliskuuta 2022.
Colbornen linkkasi 15. huhtikuuta 2020 YouTube-videon, jonka otsikko oli "Artem Bonov kielletyllä alueella". Facebookissa jaettu kuva näyttää olevan kuvakaappaus tästä videosta.
"Hän ei tietääkseni ole koskaan ollut Kiovan poliisin apulaispäällikkönä tai missään muussakaan vastaavassa asemassa", Colborne kertoi AFP:lle.
Bonov ei ole Kiovan apulaispäällikkö
Väitteen tarkistamiseksi AFP oli yhteydessä Ukrainan sisäministeriöön.
Ministeriön tiedottaja kertoi 23. maaliskuuta 2022, että Kiovan poliisin neljä apulaispäällikköä luetellaan aluepoliisin virallisilla verkkosivuilla. Kukaan heistä ei ole nimeltään Artem Bonov.
AFP tutustui verkkosivujen arkistoihin, jotka ovat nähtävillä 27. marraskuuta 2019 ja 10. lokakuuta 2021 välisenä aikana. Lokakuussa 2021 johtoporras oli sama kuin nykyään. Bonovia ei mainita verkkosivuilla.
Alla näkyvät Kiovan aluepoliisin nykyinen päällikkö ja apulaispäälliköt:
AFP tarkisti myös Kiovan poliisin Youtube-kanavan ja Facebook-sivut, mutta Facebook-päivityksen miestä ei löytynyt sieltäkään.
Bonovia ei myöskään löydy Kiovan kaupungin poliisin verkkosivuilta vuoden 2019 ja 28. lokakuuta 2021 välisenä aikana eikä hän esiinny Youtube-kanavalla tai Facebook-sivuilla julkaistuissa videoissa.
Alla olevissa kuvissa näkyy Kiovan kaupungin poliisin johto 19. huhtikuuta 2022:
Myöskään kansallisen poliisin verkkosivuilla Bonovia ei mainita.
Miliisin univormu
Verkossa on levinnyt myös toinen kuva Bonovista, jossa hänellä vaikuttaa olevan poliisin univormu päällä. Tineye-hakukoneen käänteisen kuvahaun perusteella kuva alkoi levitä verkossa vuonna 2015.
Univormu on vanha miliisien käyttämä univormu. Kyseiset univormut olivat Ukrainassa käytössä marraskuuhun 2015 asti. Ne korvattiin, kun Ukrainan poliisi perustettiin Neuvostoliiton aikakaudelta periytyneen miliisin tilalle.
Olosuhteet, joissa kuva otettiin, ovat kuitenkin epäselvät. Tämän vuoksi kuvan perusteella on mahdotonta päätellä, oliko Bonov tuolloin miliisin jäsen.
Natsitervehdys poliisitalolla
Vanhin AFP:n löytämä kuva Bonovista on vuodelta 2014.
Kyseessä on Ukrainan äärioikeistoon perehtyneen tutkijan Anton Shekhovtsovin Facebook-tilillä julkaistu kuva Bonovista tekemässä natsitervehdystä muiden nuorten miesten kanssa. Seinällä miesten takana on Kiovan poliisin tunnus. Kuvatekstissä todetaan, että kuva on otettu Kiovan poliisin tiloissa.
"Nyt kun uusnatsi Vadim Troyan on nimitetty Kiovan aluepoliisin johtajaksi, en olisi yllättynyt, jos nämä kaverit olisivat vastikään palkattuja lainvalvojia", päivityksessä lukee.
Päivityksen mukaan kuva on "todennäköisesti otettu heinäkuussa 2014, eli ennen Troyanin nimitystä."
Kuva aiheutti kohun ja sitä käsiteltiin paikallisessa mediassa. Joulukuussa 2014 julkaistun uutisen mukaan Ukrainan sisäministeriö ilmoitti, että “skandaalikuvissa ja -videoissa esiintyvät henkilöt eivät ole poliiseja."
"Poliisi arveli, että skandaalimainen video on kuvattu aikana, jolloin monet kansalaiset halusivat työskentelemään lainvalvontaan, jota varten heitä haastateltiin ja testattiin. Sisäministeriön mukaan videolla näkyy joukko nuoria, jotka olivat poliisiksi haluavien joukossa, ja tulivat pitämään hauskaa Kiovan aluepoliisin rakennukseen", artikkelissa sanotaan.
Kuva toisesta tatuoidusta miehestä
Hakukoneen perusteella virheellinen väite Bonovista "Kiovan poliisin apulaispäällikkönä" levisi verkossa jo vuonna 2015 eri sivustoilla ja blogikirjoituksissa. Tuolloin Bonov oli yhdistetty kuvaan toiseen tatuoidusta miehestä.
Kuvan mies ei kuitenkaan ole Bonov, sillä hänen tatuointinsa ovat erilaiset.
Ukrainalainen faktantarkistussivusto Stop Fake selvitti kuvan alkuperää vuonna 2020 ja totesi, että kyseessä on Pietarissa asuva Aleksei Maksimov. Maksimov nähdään esimerkiksi venäläismedian uutisessa, kun hänen asuntoonsa tehtiin kotietsintä vuonna 2015 (täällä, täällä).
"Aleksei Maksimov, lempinimeltään Mukha, niin sanotun 'oikeistolaisten poliittisten vankien avustusrahaston' johtaja," uutisissa kuvataan miestä.
Sosiaalisen median päivitykset vuosilta 2014 ja 2015 viittaavat siihen, että väite Kiovan poliisin johdon natsilinkeistä on saattanut olla vitsi tai satiirinen kritiikki Vadim Trojanin virkanimitystä kohtaan. Trojan, joka on Azov-pataljoonan entinen johtaja, nimitettiin Kiovan alueen sisäministeriön aluejohtajaksi vuonna 2014.
Tähän viittaa esimerkiksi tämä kreikkalaisen Ellinika Hoax-faktantarkistussivuston uutisoima päivitys.
Trojan nimitettiin lisäksi Kiovan alueen poliisin päälliköksi sekä kansallisen poliisin apulaispäälliköksi vuonna 2019, ukrainalaiset tiedotusvälineet kertoivat.
Kreikkalaisen faktantarkistussivuston mainitsemassa päivityksessä viitataan myös Bonovin Vkontakte-profiiliin. Tilin on jäädytetty, mutta arkistojen perusteella se vaikuttaa kuuluneen Bonoville. Bonov vaikuttaaa olevan tietoinen "vitsistä" tai tunteneen Maksimovin henkilökohtaisesti, sillä hän julkaisi marraskuussa 2014 tilillään saman kuvan paidattomasta miehestä ja kertoi siinä olevan "legendaarinen Mukha."
Bonov, Azov ja venäläiset natsit
Vahvistamattomat lähteet verkossa kertovat Bonovin kuuluneen niin sanottuun Azovin pataljoonaan vuonna 2014, mutta hänen osallisuudestaan on hyvin vähän tietoa.
Bonovin Vkontakte-sivunsa vanhoissa arkistoissa on mainintoja sekä Azovista että uusnatsiryhmästä nimeltä Misanthropic Division. Ryhmä nousi pinnalle Ukrainassa vuonna 2014, kun äärioikeistolaiset aktivistit liittyivät EU:ta kannattaviin mielenosoittajiin Kiovan Maidanin mielenosoitusten aikana. Länsimielistä maidanin vallankumousta Kiovassa seurasi vuonna 2014 pääosin venäjänkielisen Krimin niemimaan liittäminen Venäjään. Kansainvälinen yhteisö ei ole tunnustanut Krimiä osaksi Venäjää.
Venäjä on myös tukenut venäläismielisiä separatistiliikkeitä Itä-Ukrainan Donetskissa ja Luganskissa. Ukrainan armeija on sotinut näitä itsenäisiksi julistautuneita tasavaltoja vastaan konfliktissa, joka on vaatinut yli 14 000 kuolonuhria, mukaan lukien siviilejä sekä ukrainalaisia ja venäläismielisiä taistelijoita.
Keväällä 2014 äärinationalistinen puolisotilaallinen Azov-ryhmä osallistui Mariupolin vapauttamiseen, kun tämä Donbasissa sijaitseva strategisesti tärkeä kaupunki oli venäläismielisten separatistien hallussa.
"Syyskuussa 2014 allekirjoitettiin ensimmäiset Minskin sopimukset, joissa säädetään sotatoimien lopettamisesta, mutta myös näiden puolisotilaallisten rakenteiden integroimisesta sekä Ukrainan että separatistien joukkoihin. Tämä on valtioiden tarjoama takuu siitä, että ne elementit, jotka voivat aiheuttaa uhkaa tai estää jännitteiden lieventämisen, asetetaan käskyjen alaisiksi. Suurin osa näistä ryhmistä, kuten Azovin pataljoona, liittyi Ukrainan kansalliskaartiin ja siitä tuli rykmentti, joka on suoraan sisäministerin alaisuudessa," Ukrainan ja Neuvostoliiton jälkeisen äärioikeiston asiantuntija Adrien Nonjon kertoi AFP:lle 11. maaliskuuta.
Bonovin tarina on kuitenkin epäselvä.
"Hänen sanotaan olevan ukrainalainen, mutta hänellä on taipumus kommunikoida verkossa yksinomaan venäjäksi - mikä ei välttämättä ole epätavallista ukrainalaiselle äärioikeistolaiselle henkilölle - mutta se, että hänen väitetään verkossa olevan kotoisin Lvivistä, on outoa, sillä harva Lvivistä kotoisin oleva ihminen, varsinkaan kansallismielinen, kommunikoisi lähes yksinomaan venäjäksi", Colborne kertoo.
Colbournen lähteiden mukaan Bonovin aksentti videolla ei kuulosta Lvivin aksentilta, vaan "kuin sen olisi puhunut venäjänkielinen puhuja, joka on oppinut sen". Joidenkin lähteiden mukaan Bonov olisi syntynyt Venäjällä.
Bonov ei ole myöskään vieras Venäjän äärioikeistolle. Youtube-kanavallaan 5. maaliskuuta 2022 julkaistulla videolla Bonov esiintyy ihmisten kanssa, jotka Colborne on tunnistanut sekä Azovin että venäläisten uusnatsien palkkasotilaiden jäseniksi.
"Ensimmäinen videolla puhuva mies on Nikita Makeev, joka sai Ukrainan kansalaisuuden vuonna 2019 ja palveli Azovissa. Sängyllä makaava mies on Artem Krasnolutsky, venäläinen uusnatsi, jonka väitetään palvelleen Wagnerissa. Ja ovella on Bonov", Colborne kuvaili.
Wagner on venäläinen yksityinen palkkasotilasjärjestö, jonka johtajan uskotaan olevan Putinin läheinen liittolainen.
Venäjän fasismipropaganda Ukrainassa
Venäjän presidentti Vladimir Putin ilmoitti 24. helmikuuta 2022 “sotilasoperaatiosta” Ukrainassa maan itäosan separatistien puolustamiseksi. Operaation tavoitteena oli Ukrainan "demilitarisointi” ja “denatsifikaatio”, eli natsien poistaminen maasta. Hyökkäyksen oikeuttamiseksi Venäjä on levittänyt väitteitä, joiden mukaan Ukraina olisi uusnatsien miehittämä.
Tässä yhteydessä "näen [Bonovin] melkeinpä uusnatsin karikatyyrinä ja näin ollen jonkun, joka valitettavasti sopii täydellisesti Venäjän propagandaan tällä hetkellä", Michael Colborne kertoo.
AFP uutisoi ranskaksi, kuinka Venäjä on käyttänyt hyväkseen osia Ukrainan historiasta, kuten Ukrainan osittaista yhteistyötä Hitlerin hallinnon kanssa toisen maailmansodan aikana. Twitterissä Venäjän Etelä-Afrikan suurlähetystö esimerkiksi väitti, että Venäjä, “kuten 80 vuotta sitten, taistelee natsismia vastaan Ukrainassa."
Muut Ukrainan historian osat, jotka eivät sovi narratiiviin, jätetään huomiotta.
"Suuri osa ukrainalaisista sotilaista taisteli natseja vastaan puna-armeijan rinnalla, mitä ei nykyään mainita", toteaa puolestaan Alexandra Goujon, Burgundin yliopiston valtiotieteen lehtori.
Vuonna 2017 Israelin Ukrainan suurlähettiläs vahvisti, että yli 2500 ukrainalaista oli saanut arvonimen, joka myönnetään juutalaisia toisen maailmansodan aikana pelastaneille ihmisille.
Narratiivi Ukrainan natsilinkeistä voimistui vuoden 2004 oranssin vallankumouksen ja Maidanin vallankumouksen jälkeen, joka myötä venäjämielinen presidentti Viktor Janukovitsh syrjäytettiin vallasta. Molemmissa vallankumouksissa Moskovan liittolaisten sijasta virkaan astuivat länsimieliset johtajat.
Ukrainan äärioikeiston ja Venäjän äärioikeiston väliset ilmeiset yhteydet, kuten Bonovin tapauksessa, ohitetaan myös Venäjän narratiivissa. Ukrainan valtiota vastaan Donbasissa vuodesta 2014 saakka taistelleiden venäläisten joukkojen joukossa on myös ollut uusnatsistisia ryhmiä, kuten Venäjän imperialistisen liikkeen valkoisen ylivallan kannattajia.
Vaikka kansallismielinen äärioikeisto on saanut Ukrainalla jälleen näkyvyyttä Maidanin jälkeen ja Itä-Ukrainan taisteluiden tiimoilta, tämä näkyvyys ei ole johtanut äärioikeiston suosioon Ukrainan vaaleissa. Vuoden 2012 vahvojen tulosten jälkeen äärioikeistolaisella Svoboda-puolueella on nyt vain yksi paikka Ukrainan parlamentissa. Puolue ei myöskään ole saanut yli kahta prosenttia äänistä kolmessa viimeisessä presidentinvaalissa. Azov-pataljoonan poliittinen haara asettui ehdolle Svobodan kanssa vuoden 2019 parlamenttivaaleissa, mutta ei saanut yhtään paikkaa.
"Vaikka on totta, että äärioikeistolaisilla ryhmillä on näkyvyyttä, varsinkin mielenosoitusten myötä, äärioikeiston poliittinen rooli on kuitenkin erittäin vähäistä koko maan näkökulmasta", Goujon kertoi AFP:lle.
Ehdota meille faktantarkistusta.
Ota yhteyttä
Translation:
This man is not the deputy police chief of Kyiv
- The article is over a year old.
- Published April 19, 2022 4:02 p.m
- Reading time: 8 minutes
- Text: Maja CZARNECKA, Marion DAUTRY, AFP Poland, AFP Belgrade
- Translated and adapted into Finnish: Elias HUUHTANEN
Copyright © AFP 2017-2024. Commercial use of the contents requires a subscription. Read more here.
"Kiev deputy police chief," reads a Facebook update posted on March 22, 2022. The update has a picture of a bald man with a swastika tattoo and no shirt.
The same claim, according to which the man with Nazi tattoos is the deputy police chief of Kyiv, has been shared hundreds of times in Finnish on different social media (e.g. here and here). The claim has also spread to, for example, Hungary and Serbia.
A reverse image search of the Facebook update leads to social media posts where the man in the photo is said to be Artem Bonov (e.g. here, here and here). In the photos, Bonovi has exactly the same jewelry and tattoos as in the photo in the Facebook update. AFP was in contact with Michael Colborne, a journalist and researcher familiar with the extreme right in Ukraine, to find out Bonov's identity.
"I recognize the face and the tattoos," Colborne told AFP on March 25, 2022.
On April 15, 2020, Colbornen linked a YouTube video titled "Artem Bonov in the Forbidden Zone". The image shared on Facebook appears to be a screenshot of this video.
"As far as I know, he has never been a deputy chief of the Kyiv police or in any other similar position," Colborne told AFP.
Bonov is not the deputy head of Kyiv
To verify the claim, AFP contacted the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine.
On March 23, 2022, the ministry's spokesperson said that the four deputy chiefs of the Kyiv police are listed on the regional police's official website. None of them are named Artem Bonov.
AFP reviewed the website's archives, which are available for viewing between November 27, 2019 and October 10, 2021. In October 2021, the management ladder was the same as today. Bonov is not mentioned on the website.
The current Chief and Deputy Chiefs of the Kyiv Regional Police are shown below:
AFP also checked the YouTube channel and Facebook pages of the Kyiv police, but the man in the Facebook update was not found there either.
Bonov is also not found on the Kyiv City Police website between 2019 and October 28, 2021, nor does he appear in videos published on the YouTube channel or Facebook pages.
The images below show the leadership of the Kyiv City Police on April 19, 2022:
The website of the national police does not mention Bonov either.
Militia uniform
Another photo of Bonov has also spread online, where he appears to be wearing a police uniform. Based on a reverse image search by the Tineye search engine, the image began to spread online in 2015.
The uniform is an old uniform used by militias. The uniforms in question were in use in Ukraine until November 2015. They were replaced when the Ukrainian police were established to replace the militia inherited from the Soviet era.
However, the circumstances under which the picture was taken are unclear. Therefore, based on the picture, it is impossible to conclude whether Bonov was a member of the militia at the time.
Nazi salute at the police station
The oldest photo of Bonov found by AFP is from 2014.
It is a photo of Bonov doing the Nazi salute with other young men published on the Facebook account of Anton Shekhovtsov, a researcher familiar with the extreme right in Ukraine. On the wall behind the men is the logo of the Kyiv police. The caption states that the photo was taken at the premises of the Kyiv police.
"Now that neo-Nazi Vadim Troyan has been appointed head of the Kyiv Regional Police, I wouldn't be surprised if these guys were newly hired law enforcement officers," the update reads.
According to the update, the photo was "probably taken in July 2014, before Troyan's appointment."
The picture caused an uproar and was discussed in the local media. According to a news release in December 2014, the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine announced that "the persons appearing in the scandalous photos and videos are not police officers."
"The police thought that the scandalous video was filmed at a time when many citizens wanted to work in law enforcement, for which they were interviewed and tested. According to the Ministry of the Interior, the video shows a group of young people who were among those who wanted to become police officers and came to have fun at the Kyiv Regional Police building," the article says.
Picture of another tattooed man
Based on the search engine, the incorrect claim about Bonov as the "Deputy Chief of the Kyiv Police" spread online already in 2015 on various websites and blog posts. At the time, Bonov was linked to another image of a tattooed man.
However, the man in the picture is not Bonov, as his tattoos are different.
The Ukrainian fact-checking website Stop Fake found out the origin of the photo in 2020 and stated that it is Alexei Maksimov, who lives in St. Petersburg. Maksimov is seen, for example, in the news of the Russian media when his apartment was searched in 2015 (here, here).
"Aleksei Maksimov, nicknamed Mukha, the head of the so-called 'right-wing political prisoners' relief fund,'" the news describes the man.
Social media updates from 2014 and 2015 suggest that the allegation of Nazi links among Kyiv police leadership may have been a joke or satirical criticism of Vadim Trojan's appointment. Trojan, a former leader of the Azov Battalion, was appointed regional director of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Kyiv region in 2014.
For example, this update reported by the Greek fact-checking website Ellinika Hoax refers to this.
Trojan was also appointed chief of the Kyiv region police and deputy chief of the national police in 2019, Ukrainian media reported.
The update cited by the Greek fact-checking website also refers to Bonov's Vkontakte profile. The account has been frozen, but based on the archives it seems to have belonged to Bonov. Bonov seems to be aware of the "joke" or to have known Maksimov personally, as he posted the same photo of a shirtless man on his account in November 2014 and said it featured the "legendary Mukha."
Bonov, Azov and the Russian Nazis
Unconfirmed sources online say that Bonov was part of the so-called Azov Battalion in 2014, but there is very little information about his involvement.
In the old archives of Bonov's Vkontakte page, there are mentions of both Azov and a neo-Nazi group called the Misanthropic Division. The group emerged in Ukraine in 2014 when far-right activists joined pro-EU protesters during the Kyiv Maidan protests. The pro-Western Maidan revolution in Kyiv was followed in 2014 by the annexation of the mainly Russian-speaking Crimean peninsula to Russia. The international community has not recognized Crimea as part of Russia.
Russia has also supported pro-Russian separatist movements in eastern Ukraine's Donetsk and Lugansk. The Ukrainian military has been at war with these self-proclaimed republics in a conflict that has claimed more than 14,000 lives, including civilians and pro-Ukrainian and pro-Russian fighters.
In the spring of 2014, the ultra-nationalist paramilitary Azov group took part in the liberation of Mariupol, when this strategically important city in Donbas was held by pro-Russian separatists.
"In September 2014, the first Minsk agreements were signed, which provide for the cessation of hostilities, but also for the integration of these paramilitary structures into both Ukrainian and separatist forces. This is a guarantee provided by the states that those elements that can pose a threat or prevent the easing of tensions will be brought under orders. The biggest some of these groups, like the Azov Battalion, joined the Ukrainian National Guard and became a regiment under the direct authority of the interior minister," Adrien Nonjon, an expert on Ukraine and the post-Soviet far-right, told AFP on March 11.
However, Bonov's story is unclear.
"He is said to be Ukrainian, but he tends to communicate online exclusively in Russian - which is not necessarily unusual for a Ukrainian far-right person - but the fact that he is claimed online to be from Lviv is strange, as few people from Lviv, especially nationalists, would communicate almost exclusively in Russian," says Colborne.
According to Colbourne's sources, Bonov's accent in the video does not sound like a Lviv accent, but "like it was spoken by a Russian speaker who has learned it". According to some sources, Bonov was born in Russia.
Bonov is also no stranger to the Russian extreme right. In a video posted on his YouTube channel on March 5, 2022, Bonov appears with people identified by Colborne as members of both Azov and Russian neo-Nazi mercenaries.
"The first man speaking in the video is Nikita Makeev, who received Ukrainian citizenship in 2019 and served in Azov. The man lying on the bed is Artem Krasnolutsky, a Russian neo-Nazi who allegedly served in Wagner. And at the door is Bonov," Colborne described.
Wagner is a Russian private mercenary organization whose leader is believed to be a close ally of Putin.
Russian fascism propaganda in Ukraine
On February 24, 2022, Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a "military operation" in Ukraine to defend separatists in the eastern part of the country. The goal of the operation was the "demilitarization" and "denazification" of Ukraine, i.e. the removal of Nazis from the country. To justify the attack, Russia has spread claims that Ukraine is occupied by neo-Nazis.
In this context, "I see [Bonov] almost as a caricature of a neo-Nazi, and therefore someone who, unfortunately, fits perfectly with Russian propaganda at the moment," says Michael Colborne.
AFP reports in French how Russia has taken advantage of parts of Ukraine's history, such as Ukraine's partial collaboration with Hitler's regime during World War II. On Twitter, the Russian Embassy in South Africa, for example, claimed that Russia, "like 80 years ago, is fighting Nazism in Ukraine."
Other parts of Ukrainian history that don't fit the narrative are ignored.
"A large number of Ukrainian soldiers fought against the Nazis alongside the Red Army, which is not mentioned today," says Alexandra Goujon, political science lecturer at the University of Burgundy.
In 2017, Israel's ambassador to Ukraine confirmed that more than 2,500 Ukrainians had received the title, which is awarded to people who saved Jews during World War II.
The narrative of Ukraine's Nazi links intensified after the 2004 Orange Revolution and the Maidan Revolution, which ousted pro-Russian President Viktor Yanukovych from power. In both revolutions, pro-Western leaders took office instead of Moscow's allies.
The obvious connections between the Ukrainian far-right and the Russian far-right, as in the case of Bonov, are also ignored in the Russian narrative. Among the Russian forces fighting against the Ukrainian state in Donbas since 2014 have also been neo-Nazi groups, such as the white supremacists of the Russian imperialist movement.
Although the nationalist far-right has regained visibility in Ukraine after the Maidan and the battles in eastern Ukraine, this visibility has not led to the popularity of the far-right in the Ukrainian elections. After strong results in 2012, the far-right Svoboda party now has only one seat in the Ukrainian parliament. The party has also not received more than two percent of the vote in the last three presidential elections. The political branch of the Azov Battalion ran with Svoboda in the 2019 parliamentary elections, but did not win any seats.
"Although it's true that far-right groups have visibility, especially with the demonstrations, the political role of the far-right is very small from the point of view of the country as a whole," Goujon told AFP.
Suggest us a fact check.
Contact us
false_claim: Ukrainians and Ukrainian forces are characterized as largely Nazi.

content:
Her er konspirasjonsteoriene om apekopper
Hørt at utbruddet av apekopper var planlagt? Eller at det er Bill Gates som står bak? Konspirasjonsteorier om sykdommen sprer seg langt raskere enn selve viruset.
Apekoppene hadde knapt nådd Europa før konspirasjonsteoriene om dem begynte å spre seg i sosiale medier. Flere av dem er resirkulert fra koronapandemien.
Selv om utbredelsen av sykdommen foreløpig er beskjeden, florerer det av feilinformasjon i kommentarfeltene. Ved utgangen av mai hadde det blitt påvist 321 tilfeller i 12 ulike EU-land, ifølge det europeiske smittevernbyrået ECDC.
I tillegg hadde det blitt rapportert om 236 smittetilfeller i sju forskjellige land utenfor EU. Antall påviste tilfeller totalt var dermed oppe i 557 per 31. mai. Samme dag opplyste Folkehelseinstituttet (FHI) at det første tilfellet av apekopper hadde blitt påvist i Norge.
Vi har plukket ut noen av de mest spredte konspirasjonsteoriene om sykdommen, basert på det vi har sett i sosiale medier den siste tiden.
«Apekopp-utbruddet var planlagt»
Påstand
Utbruddet av apekopper var planlagt.
Konklusjon
Det er ingenting som tyder på at utbruddet av apekopper i Europa var planlagt. Det stemmer at det var en simuleringsøvelse med apekopper i 2021, men det var tilfeldig at nettopp denne sykdommen ble valgt. At en vaksine mot apekopper ble godkjent i 2019, dokumenterer heller ikke at utbruddet var planlagt.
En av de mest spredte konspirasjonsteoriene under koronapandemien var at den var planlagt – at den var en «plandemi». Teorien går ut på at en verdensomspennende elite har sluppet løs viruset med vilje. Slik kan eliten få kontroll på befolkningen, og samtidig tjene penger på vaksiner.
Hvem denne eliten er, varierer. Det kan både være internasjonale organisasjoner som Verdens helseorganisasjon (WHO), FN og EU, eller politikere og andre ledere. Ofte involveres også Microsoft-grunnlegger og vaksineforkjemper Bill Gates.
Påstander om at utbruddet av apekopper er en ny «plandemi», kan nå leses i norske kommentarfelt. Det er gjerne to ting som brukes som «bevis» for at utbruddet av apekopper var planlagt: En simuleringsøvelse i 2021, og at en vaksine mot apekopper ble godkjent i 2019.
Ja, det var en øvelse med apekopper i 2021
I mars 2021 gjennomførte organisasjonen Nuclear Threat Initiative (NTI) en øvelse hvor de simulerte et globalt utbrudd av nettopp apekopper. Dette ble gjort i samarbeid med Sikkerhetskonferansen i München, og 19 ledere og eksperter fra hele verden deltok.
NTI er en organisasjon som jobber for å redusere kjernefysiske og biologiske trusler som setter menneskeheten i fare. Organisasjonen har sett seg nødt til å legge ut en redegjørelse for å imøtegå alle spekulasjonene om at øvelsen var et frampek om hva som skulle komme ganske nøyaktig ett år etterpå.
«Noe av aktiviteten på sosiale medier har inkludert desinformasjon om øvelsen vår, og vi vil gjerne imøtegå dette med fakta», står det i redegjørelsen.
NTI hadde lignende øvelser både i 2019 og 2020. Dette gjorde de for å skape forståelse for biologiske trusler hos ledere og eksperter, og for å avdekke hull i beredskapen. Organisasjonen hadde ingen baktanker da den valgte å simulere et utbrudd av apekopper i 2021.
«Det faktum at flere land nå opplever et utbrudd av apekopper, er helt tilfeldig», står det i redegjørelsen.
«Risikoen rundt apekopper har blitt grundig dokumentert i årevis av en rekke offentlige helsemyndigheter. Informasjonen i vårt fiktive scenario er ikke ny».
Hele rapporten fra øvelsen kan leses her.
Også faktasjekkerne i Health Feedback avviser at øvelsen i 2021 underbygger at apekopp-utbruddet i 2022 var planlagt. «Viruset ble valgt på grunn av sin kjente pandemirisiko», konkluderer faktasjekkerne.
Riktig at vaksine ble godkjent i 2019
Et annet «bevis» som brukes for å underbygge at utbruddet av apekopper var planlagt, er godkjenningen av en vaksine mot sykdommen i 2019. Det stemmer at det ble godkjent en vaksine da, men det betyr ikke at apekopp-utbruddet i 2022 var «planlagt».
Det amerikanske legemiddelverket FDA godkjente i september 2019 Jynneos-vaksinen mot kopper og apekopper. Vaksinen ble godkjent for personer over 18 år som hadde økt risiko hvis de ble smittet av en av de to sykdommene. Dette er den eneste vaksinen mot apekopper som er godkjent i USA, ifølge pressemeldingen fra FDA.
Denne vaksinen er så langt ikke godkjent brukt mot apekopper i Europa, men den er godkjent for bruk mot kopper. Produsenten Bavarian Nordic har til Reuters opplyst at de «sannsynligvis» vil søke om godkjenning for bruk mot apekopper også i Europa.
EU har besluttet å kjøpe inn vaksiner mot apekopper, noe som også vil gi Norge tilgang på vaksiner. Bavarian Nordic opplyser i en pressemelding at de har inngått «en rekke kontrakter av varierende størrelse» med ulike lands myndigheter.
Som følge av de nye kontraktene, har selskapet oppjustert sine forventede inntekter for 2022 fra 1,3–1,5 milliarder danske kroner, til mellom 1,4 og 1,6 milliarder.
Bavarian Nordic forventer likevel et negativt brutto driftsresultat (EBITDA) på mellom 900 millioner og 1,1 milliard danske kroner. Dette skyldes store investeringer i forskning og utvikling av en vaksine mot RS-virus og en booster-vaksine mot covid-19.
Bavarian Nordic er et dansk selskap, og per september 2021 hadde 68 prosent av aksjene dansk eierskap. 13 prosent av aksjene hadde eiere fra EU-land, mens 12 prosent hadde amerikanske eiere.
«Det er Bill Gates som står bak»
Påstand
Det er Bill Gates som står bak utbruddet av apekopper i Europa.
Konklusjon
Det er bare en konspirasjonsteori at Bill Gates står bak apekopp-utbruddet. Han ble også beskyldt for å stå bak koronapandemien. Det er riktig at Gates snakket offentlig om en pandemi høsten 2021, men da nevnte han kopper (smallpox) og ikke apekopper.
Bill Gates sa høsten 2021 at verdens ledere måtte være forberedt på at smallpox kunne bli brukt som biologisk våpen og være neste pandemi. I 2019 kom det ny vaksine. Så beleilig.
Dette skrev en norsk kvinne i et kommentarfelt på Facebook like etter at det ble kjent at apekopper hadde blitt påvist i flere land i Europa. Hun er langt fra den eneste som har antydet at Bill Gates spiller en rolle i den pågående epidemien.
Flere memes hvor noen har montert Gates' hode på en apekropp, spres også her til lands. På den ene memen er budskapet at «kilden til utbruddet av apekopper har blitt identifisert».
Det er ikke noe nytt at det spres konspirasjonsteorier om den amerikanske forretningsmannen og filantropen. Under koronapandemien ble han blant annet beskyldt for å ville spore folk med mikrobrikker gjennom vaksiner, og at flere tusen indiske barn ble lamme etter at Gates-stiftelsen hadde testet vaksiner på dem. Begge deler var bare oppspinn.
Ikke tro på disse korona-konspirasjonene om Bill Gates
Gates har donert store summer til utvikling av vaksiner, og han har hatt en ledende rolle i arbeidet med å få flest mulig til å vaksinere seg mot covid-19. Dette har fått mange til å beskylde han for å tjene seg søkkrik på vaksineproduksjon, noe han også blir beskyldt for i forbindelse med apekopp-utbruddet.
Ikke en ny sykdom
Flere av dem som sprer konspirasjonsteorier om apekopper, virker å ikke ha fått med seg at det ikke er en ny sykdom. Den ble – som navnet antyder – først oppdaget hos aper i et laboratorium i 1959. De første tilfellene hos mennesker ble påvist i 1970, og siden har det bare vært noen få påviste tilfeller av apekopper i Europa, ifølge FHI.
Sykdommen er utbredt i Sentral- og Vest-Afrika, særlig i Den demokratiske republikken Kongo og Nigeria. Tidligere smittetilfeller i Europa har vært knyttet til reiser i disse områdene eller til andre smittede personer.
Det nye er at de smittede personene verken har reist i land i Vest-Europa, eller vært i kontakt med smittede personer. FHI har opplyst at smitten først og fremst er oppdaget hos unge menn som har sex med menn.
At Bill Gates står bak smitteutbruddet, er bare en konspirasjonsteori. Den amerikanske faktasjekk-organisasjonen PolitiFact har tatt fram sin sterkeste konklusjon «pants on fire» for å tilbakevise påstanden. Denne konklusjonen er forbeholdt de aller mest løgnaktige påstandene som faktasjekkes.
Heller ikke faktasjekkerne i Lead Stories har funnet dokumentasjon for at Gates står bak. De omtaler uttalelser han kom med i november 2021. Da snakket Gates om muligheten for å simulere et koppeutbrudd for å bygge en global beredskap. Her er det verdt å merke seg at sykdommen Gates snakket om var kopper (smallpox), og ikke apekopper.
«Koronavaksinen inneholder apekopp-virus»
Påstand
Koronavaksinen til AstraZeneca inneholder apekoppvirus.
Konklusjon
Nei, AstraZenecas koronavaksine inneholder ikke apekopp-virus. Vaksinen inneholder imidlertid et endret adenovirus fra sjimpanser, men det tilhører ikke samme virusfamilie som apekopper.
I kommentarfeltene mener enkelte at apekopp-utbruddet skyldes koronavaksinen. Et bilde av et pakningsvedlegg til AstraZenecas koronavaksine deles som «bevis».
På pakningsvedlegget står det at vaksinen inneholder «recombinant, replication-deficient chimpanzee adenovirus». I det norske pakningsvedlegget står det at virkestoffet er «sjimpanseadenovirus koder for SARS CoV-2-spike glykoprotein, rekombinant».
Dette er ikke et apekoppvirus, ifølge vaksineforsker ved Avdeling for Immunologi og Transfusjonsmedisin ved Rikshospitalet, Even Fossum.
– Nei. Vaksinen fra AstraZeneca inneholder et endret adenovirus fra sjimpanser som brukes for å levere en DNA-oppskrift på overflatetaggen (spike) fra SARS CoV-2-viruset, skriver han i en e-post til Faktisk.no.
– Apekopper tilhører en helt annen virusfamilie, og har ingenting med adenoviruset som er beskrevet på bildet å gjøre.
Hvorfor har Norge vaksiner mot apekopper på lager?
Heller ikke noen av de andre koronavaksinene inneholder apekopp-virus, ifølge Fossum:
– Nei, ingen av vaksinene som er godkjent mot covid-19 inneholder apekoppvirus, sier han.
Også Full Fact, Health Feedback og AFP har faktasjekket denne påstanden og funnet at den er feil.
«Apekopper er en bivirkning av koronavaksinen»
Påstand
Apekopper er en bivirkning av koronavaksinen.
Konklusjon
Det er ikke riktig at apekopper er en bivirkning av koronavaksinen. Ingen koronavaksiner inneholder apekopp-virus, og apekopper ble påvist hos mennesker allerede i 1970. Altså 50 år før den første covid-19-vaksinen ble utviklet.
En annen påstand som verserer på sosiale medier, er at apekopper er en bivirkning av koronavaksinen. Noen mener det spesifikt er Pfizer-vaksinen som utløser apekopper.
Heller ikke dét er riktig, ifølge Fossum:
– Nei. Dagens utbrudd av apekopper ser ut til å stamme fra Nigeria, der det har vært jevnlig forekomst av smitte siden 2017, sier han.
– Smittetilfeller etter reise er tidligere oppdaget i Storbritannia i eksempelvis 2018 og 2019, altså før covid-19-vaksinene ble tatt i bruk.
Faktasjekkerne i Full Fact har kommet fram til samme konklusjon: Det finnes ikke dokumentasjon for at koronavaksinen fører til apekopper.
Translation:
Here are the monkeypox conspiracy theories
Heard the monkeypox outbreak was planned? Or that Bill Gates is behind it? Conspiracy theories about the disease spread far faster than the virus itself.
The monkeypox had barely reached Europe before conspiracy theories about it began to spread on social media. Several of them have been recycled from the corona pandemic.
Although the spread of the disease is currently modest, there is a lot of misinformation in the comment fields. By the end of May, 321 cases had been detected in 12 different EU countries, according to the European infection control agency ECDC.
In addition, 236 cases of infection had been reported in seven different countries outside the EU. The total number of confirmed cases was thus up to 557 as of 31 May. On the same day, the Norwegian Institute of Public Health (FHI) announced that the first case of monkeypox had been detected in Norway.
We have selected some of the most widespread conspiracy theories about the disease, based on what we have seen on social media recently.
"The monkeypox outbreak was planned"
Assertion
The outbreak of monkeypox was planned.
Conclusion
There is no indication that the outbreak of monkeypox in Europe was planned. It is true that there was a simulation exercise with monkeypox in 2021, but it was by chance that this particular disease was chosen. The fact that a vaccine against monkeypox was approved in 2019 also does not document that the outbreak was planned.
One of the most widespread conspiracy theories during the corona pandemic was that it was planned - that it was a "planned pandemic". The theory is that a worldwide elite has unleashed the virus on purpose. This way the elite can gain control over the population, and at the same time make money from vaccines.
Who this elite is varies. It can be both international organizations such as the World Health Organization (WHO), the UN and the EU, or politicians and other leaders. Microsoft founder and vaccine campaigner Bill Gates is also often involved.
Claims that the outbreak of monkeypox is a new "plan epidemic" can now be read in Norwegian comment fields. There are usually two things that are used as "proof" that the outbreak of monkeypox was planned: A simulation exercise in 2021, and that a vaccine against monkeypox was approved in 2019.
Yes, there was a monkeypox exercise in 2021
