Eugen Schwab during Nazi GermanyThe Facebook posts claim that Eugen Schwab was a high-ranking Nazi and that he was even a confidant of Adolf Hitler. However, this statement also turns out to be false.
AFP obtained access to Eugen Schwab's denazification files from the Landesarchiv Baden-Württemberg. Denazification was a program by the Allied Powers in Germany and Austria to eradicate Nazism after World War II. Many people, including industrialists, had to be interrogated to find out if they were part of a Nazi organization or not.
AFP has also contacted the Institute for Modern History (IfZ) in Munich for comment on Eugen Schwab's denazification files. In a June 13 email, Dr. Nils Weise, a research associate at the IfZ, explained that the dossier does not show that the German industrialist was a Nazi. "According to the file, he was not even a member of the Nazi Party (NSDAP)".
"The online search system of the German Federal Archives, in NSDAP member files, returns no result for Eugen Wilhelm Schwab, born 04/27/1899, but five other 'Eugen Schwabs' with different birth dates," according to Weise . "Eugen Schwab did not hold any position in the NSDAP and was clearly not a high-ranking Nazi," the expert added.
Peter Faisler, professor of modern history at the University of Paderborn, agrees. He also reviewed the files at the request of AFP and wrote on June 20: "The denazification files do not show that Eugen Schwab was a high-ranking National Socialist."
According to Dr. Nils Weise, however, these documents do not allow for comprehensive conclusions to be drawn about Schwab's beliefs. "On the one hand, he embellished, minimized and even lied a lot in the denazification procedures. On the other hand, the formal affiliation on which the procedures were focused allows only partial conclusions to be drawn about his beliefs." Feisler also wrote that no conclusions can be drawn from the files about Schwab's political views.
Eugen Schwab had to answer two "questionnaires", one on 7 February 1946 as "commercial director of the Escher Wies factory" and the other on 4 November 1946 as "counselor of the Ravensburg Chamber of Commerce". "In general, this is not unusual," adds Nils Weise.
According to the documents, Eugen Schwab was admitted to "group A". "This corresponds to an acquittal," explains the scientist. "You would have to look deeply into the sources to judge whether this assessment is justified from the current point of view. However, the information provided by Eugen Schwab appears plausible and does not reveal any substantial Nazi accusations."
However, Dr. Nils Weise specifies that "it is difficult to know whether the information in such files is reliable. Many people have had an obvious interest in withholding information, embellishing facts or knowingly making false statements, which is punishable by law."
According to the case file, Eugen Schwab announced that he was a member of three organizations active during Nazi Germany: the unifying organization for sports and physical education called the NSRL, the labor organization DAF, and the NSV, a social welfare organization during the Third Reich.
"According to Schwab's statement, he joined the NSRL when the then German Alpine Club (DAV) was transferred to the same Nazi organization," explains the expert. "Membership in the mentioned Nazi organizations should not be seen as a specific accusation related to Nazism."
"Membership in upstream organizations such as the NSV and NSFK, which were (wrongly) considered more apolitical, was often chosen to demonstrate, on the one hand, through opportunism or under pressure, closeness to the party, without that it is necessary to immediately join the NSDAP itself," he added. "It was difficult to avoid membership of the German Labor Front (DAF) when one held a leading position in the economy," commented the researcher.Furthermore, Eugen Schwab was not a close confidant of Hitler. "There is no indication whatsoever that Schwab had any particular or even any relationship with Hitler," according to Weise.
University professor Feissler is also unaware of such a close relationship: "I think it unlikely that Eugen Schwab was a 'close confidant of Adolf Hitler'. I am not aware of any such information from the relevant literature. A search of the Federal Archives also did not turn up relevant information."
The factory of Escher Wyss AG in Ravensburg
The Swiss industrial company Escher Wyss also had a site in the southern German city of Ravensburg. AFP requested more information from the local city archive. The head of the Ravensburg archive, Dr. Silke Schötle, responded on June 14, citing regional documents that Escher Wyss, like other companies, employed people from forced and foreign labor camps. In 1943, 336 of these foreign workers were employed at Escher Wyss, including 86 prisoners of war. By 1944, the number of foreign workers employed at Escher Wyss had grown to over 400, including many Russian women.
The camps during the Nazi period served a variety of functions. Extermination camps such as Auschwitz-Birkenau served planned genocide, and concentration camps were used to imprison, segregate, exploit, humiliate and intimidate people. In prisoner of war camps and so-called "civilian" labor camps, millions of forced laborers and prisoners of war from all over Europe had to work under terrible conditions.
Peter Faissler of the University of Paderborn writes: "According to the documents I have, Escher Wyss AG seems to have been a special technology company, quite interesting in terms of armaments and thus also active as a cooperation partner of the National Socialist economy. The use of forced labor seems to have been guaranteed. Everything shows that the company - and thus probably Eugen Schwab - contributed to the functioning of the regime." In this sense, one can talk about guilt and historical responsibility. "However, I can see no indication of an extraordinary, heightened degree of responsibility," Feisler wrote.
Niels Wysse of the IfZ confirmed: "As far as I know, Escher Wyss also used prisoners of war in Ravensburg and forced laborers in Lindau." Even if Escher Wyss was apparently "part of the inhumane use of forced labor by the Nazi war economy," it was "certainly not due to the trade manager's special relationship with Hitler." He concludes: "Eugene Schwab did not have his 'own concentration camp.'" Feissler also adds, "Running his own 'concentration camp' is not present in the research." However, it is true that Escher Wyss benefited from forced labor during the nazi period.
June 27, 2022 Article updated with additional information about Walter Dibilash obtained from the German Federal Archives
Seen content you want AFP to review?
Contact us
false_claim: Eugen Schwab, father of Klaus Schwab, was a close confidante of Hitler.

content:
Questi carri armati tedeschi non sono diretti in Ucraina
Il 26 gennaio 2023 su Facebook è stato pubblicato il video di un treno merci che trasporta carri armati fermo in una stazione ferroviaria innevata. Il filmato è accompagnato da questo commento, scritto da chi ha pubblicato il post: «Un treno con carri armati Leopard 2A5 della Bundeswehr si sta dirigendo verso est, 23/01/2023. Quindi era già tutto pronto…».
Il riferimento è all’annuncio del 25 gennaio 2023 da parte del cancelliere tedesco Olaf Scholz dell’invio di 14 carri armati Leopard 2 all’Ucraina per difendere il proprio territorio dall’invasione russa.
Secondo l’autore del post, quindi, il filmato – che sarebbe stato registrato il 23 gennaio 2023, cioè prima dell’annuncio ufficiale del governo tedesco – dimostrerebbe che la decisione di inviare i carri armati in Ucraina era già stata presa.
Si tratta di un contenuto fuorviante, che veicola una notizia infondata.
Il filmato è reale, ma non mostra dei carri armati Leopard diretti in Ucraina.
I colleghi tedeschi di Correctiv hanno ricostruito che il video in questione è stato registrato lungo un binario della stazione di Hosena, una frazione della città di Senftenberg nello Stato federato del Brandeburgo, in Germania. Non è stato possibile invece ricostruire la data esatta della registrazione del filmato.
Contattato dai fact-checker, un portavoce delle forze armate della Germania ha dichiarato che i carri armati che si vedono nel video sono effettivamente Leopard 2, ma ha smentito che si tratti di armi destinate all’Ucraina. Il portavoce ha spiegato invece che quelli ripresi nel video erano carri armati utilizzati a dicembre 2022 in un’esercitazione militare Nato in Lituania e di ritorno in Germania.
Precisiamo infine che il ministro della Difesa tedesco Boris Pistorius ha dichiarato il 25 gennaio 2023 che i carri armati Leopard «potranno essere in Ucraina nel giro di tre mesi».
Aiuta Facta.news a combattere la disinformazione, segnala i contenuti sospetti via WhatsApp al numero 3421829843 oppure clicca qui. Insieme renderemo Internet un posto più sicuro!
Translation:
These German tanks are not headed for Ukraine
On January 26, 2023, a video of a freight train carrying tanks stopped at a snowy train station was posted on Facebook. The video is accompanied by this comment, written by the person who published the post: «A train with Bundeswehr Leopard 2A5 tanks is heading east, 01/23/2023. So everything was already ready...".
The reference is to the announcement on January 25, 2023 by German Chancellor Olaf Scholz of the sending of 14 Leopard 2 tanks to Ukraine to defend its territory from the Russian invasion.
According to the author of the post, therefore, the video - which was recorded on January 23, 2023, i.e. before the official announcement by the German government - demonstrates that the decision to send the tanks to Ukraine had already been made.
This is misleading content, which conveys unfounded news.
The footage is real, but it doesn't show Leopard tanks heading into Ukraine.
Correctiv's German colleagues have reconstructed that the video in question was recorded along a platform at Hosena station, a hamlet of the city of Senftenberg in the federal state of Brandenburg, Germany. However, it was not possible to reconstruct the exact date of recording of the film.
Contacted by fact-checkers, a spokesperson for the German armed forces declared that the tanks seen in the video are indeed Leopard 2, but denied that they were weapons destined for Ukraine. The spokesperson explained instead that those filmed in the video were tanks used in December 2022 in a NATO military exercise in Lithuania and returning to Germany.
Finally, we would like to point out that German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius declared on 25 January 2023 that the Leopard tanks "could be in Ukraine within three months".
Help Facta.news fight misinformation, report suspicious content via WhatsApp on 3421829843 or click here. Together we will make the Internet a safer place!
false_claim: A video has surfaced showing a delivery of German Leopard tanks to Ukraine.

content:
El vídeo de un alto cargo ucraniano admitiendo la participación de Ucrania en el ataque a Moscú está manipulado
Se trata de un deepfake que mezcla entrevistas a altos cargos del Gobierno ucraniano con un audio generado con inteligencia artificial
Circula en redes sociales un vídeo en el que aparece el secretario del Consejo de Seguridad Nacional y Defensa de Ucrania, Oleksiy Danilov, siendo entrevistado en televisión. Según los mensajes virales basados en las palabras de Danilov, el político ucraniano habría admitido la participación de Ucrania en el ataque terrorista de Moscú del 22 de marzo, pero es falso.
“El secretario del Consejo de Seguridad Nacional y Defensa de Ucrania anunció indirectamente la participación de Ucrania en el ataque terrorista en Crocus”, dicen publicaciones compartidas en Facebook y X. Están acompañadas de un vídeo de 17 segundos en el que aparece Oleksiy Danilov siendo entrevistado por dos periodistas, que aparecen en dos recuadros a la izquierda mientras el político se encuentra en un cuadro más grande en el lado derecho.
Según sus palabras en ruso y los subtítulos en castellano que acompañan a las imágenes, Danilov dice lo siguiente: “¿Está divertido hoy Moscú? Creo que es muy divertido. Quiero creer que nos divertiremos así más a menudo, que nosotros los mantendremos felices. Al fin y al cabo, son nación hermana y los hermanos, la gente y los parientes necesitan alegrarse y verse más a menudo. Así que iremos”.
Sin embargo, no es cierto que Oleksiy Danilov haya admitido la participación de Ucrania en el ataque terrorista en Moscú. El vídeo viral es en realidad un deepfake que mezcla imágenes de entrevistas a dos miembros del Gobierno ucraniano que datan del 16 y 19 de marzo, días antes del atentado en Rusia. Además, el audio de Danilov también está manipulado y especialistas apuntan a que está generado con inteligencia artificial.
El vídeo de Oleksiy Danilov admitiendo la participación de Ucrania en el ataque en Moscú está manipulado
Las imágenes de la supuesta entrevista en la que el político ucraniano admite la involucración de Ucrania en el atentado en Rusia comenzaron a circular tan solo horas después de reportarse el ataque. Según afirma Danilov en el vídeo viral, el ataque en Moscú le parece algo “divertido” y espera que los ucranianos continúen divirtiéndose de esa manera “a menudo”. Es decir, que no solo se habría burlado del atentado, sino que además habría dejado caer que Ucrania tiene pensado llevar a cabo más ataques como el del Crocus City Hall en el futuro.
De acuerdo con el periodista de la BBC especializado en desinformación Shayan Sardarizadeh, la supuesta entrevista del político ucraniano fue publicada en la televisión rusa. Sin embargo, se trata de un vídeo manipulado que se sirve de dos entrevistas a distintos miembros del Gobierno ucraniano, cuyas imágenes se han superpuesto.
Por un lado, el vídeo viral utiliza imágenes de dos periodistas entrevistando al jefe de la Dirección Principal de Inteligencia del Ministerio de Defensa de Ucrania, Kyrylo Budánov. Esta entrevista se realizó el pasado 16 de marzo, seis días antes del atentado en Moscú y Budánov habló sobre las redadas de voluntarios rusos involucrados en la guerra en Ucrania y de las elecciones presidenciales en la Federación Rusa. Por otro lado, las imágenes de Danilov son de una entrevista que concedió el 19 de marzo y habló sobre el posible despliegue de tropas francesas en Ucrania y de las operaciones llevadas a cabo por voluntarios rusos.
En ninguna de las dos entrevistas se hace alusión a la participación ucraniana en un ataque contra Moscú ni se califica este acto como algo “divertido”. Asimismo, el audio de Danilov en el vídeo viral no coincide con el que se escucha en su entrevista del día 19. Según el periodista de la BBC Shayan Sardarizadeh, el audio del vídeo difundido en redes sociales habría sido generado con inteligencia artificial.
En cuanto a la autoría del atentado, la rama del Estado Islámico ISIS-K ha reivindicado el ataque. Por su parte, el Gobierno ucraniano ha negado “categóricamente” su involucración en el mismo.
Fuentes
Tuits de Shayan Sardarizadeh
Entrevista a Kyrylo Budánov el 16 de marzo de 2024
Entrevista a Oleksiy Danilov el 19 de marzo de 2024
Comunicado del Ministerio de Asuntos Exteriores de Ucrania
Translation:
Video of senior Ukrainian official admitting Ukraine's involvement in Moscow attack is doctored
It is a deepfake that mixes interviews with senior officials of the Ukrainian Government with audio generated with artificial intelligence
A video is circulating on social networks in which the secretary of the National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine, Oleksiy Danilov, appears being interviewed on television. According to viral messages based on Danilov's words, the Ukrainian politician would have admitted Ukraine's participation in the Moscow terrorist attack on March 22, but it is false.
“The secretary of the National Security and Defense Council of Ukraine indirectly announced Ukraine's participation in the terrorist attack in Crocus,” say posts shared on Facebook and X. They are accompanied by a 17-second video in which Oleksiy Danilov appears being interviewed by two journalists, who appear in two boxes on the left while the politician is in a larger box on the right side.
According to his words in Russian and the Spanish subtitles that accompany the images, Danilov says the following: “Is Moscow fun today? I think it's very funny. I want to believe that we will have fun like this more often, that we will keep them happy. After all, they are a sister nation and brothers, people and relatives need to rejoice and see each other more often. So we will go.”
However, it is not true that Oleksiy Danilov admitted Ukraine's involvement in the terrorist attack in Moscow. The viral video is actually a deepfake that mixes images of interviews with two members of the Ukrainian Government dating from March 16 and 19, days before the attack in Russia. In addition, Danilov's audio is also manipulated and specialists point out that it is generated with artificial intelligence.
Video of Oleksiy Danilov admitting Ukraine's involvement in Moscow attack is doctored
Images of the alleged interview in which the Ukrainian politician admits Ukraine's involvement in the attack in Russia began to circulate just hours after the attack was reported. According to Danilov in the viral video, he finds the attack in Moscow “fun” and he hopes that Ukrainians will continue to have fun that way “often.” That is to say, not only would he have mocked the attack, but he would have also let it be known that Ukraine plans to carry out more attacks like the one at Crocus City Hall in the future.
According to BBC disinformation journalist Shayan Sardarizadeh, the alleged interview with the Ukrainian politician was published on Russian television. However, it is a manipulated video that uses two interviews with different members of the Ukrainian Government, whose images have been superimposed.
On the one hand, the viral video uses images of two journalists interviewing the head of the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine, Kyrylo Budanov. This interview took place on March 16, six days before the attack in Moscow, and Budanov spoke about the raids of Russian volunteers involved in the war in Ukraine and the presidential elections in the Russian Federation. On the other hand, Danilov's images are from an interview he gave on March 19 and spoke about the possible deployment of French troops in Ukraine and the operations carried out by Russian volunteers.
In neither of the two interviews is there any reference to Ukrainian participation in an attack against Moscow nor is this act described as something “fun.” Likewise, Danilov's audio in the viral video does not match that heard in his interview on the 19th. According to BBC journalist Shayan Sardarizadeh, the audio of the video spread on social networks would have been generated with artificial intelligence.
Regarding responsibility for the attack, the Islamic State branch ISIS-K has claimed responsibility for the attack. For its part, the Ukrainian Government has “categorically” denied its involvement in it.
Sources
Tweets by Shayan Sardarizadeh
Interview with Kyrylo Budánov on March 16, 2024
Interview with Oleksiy Danilov on March 19, 2024
Statement from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine
false_claim: A Ukrainian official admits the country's responsibilities in a Moscow terror attack, which is actually a deep fake.

content:
Zasnežené lietadlo na letisku v Mníchove bolo odparkované a nemalo naplánované žiadne lety
- Uverejnené 14. decembra 2023 o 16:43
- Článok prečítate za 6 min
- Autor: Katharina ZWINS, AFP Nemecko, AFP Slovensko
- Článok preložil/-a Robert BARCA
Copyright © AFP 2017-2024. Pre akékoľvek komerčné použitie tohto obsahu je nutné predplatenie našich služieb. Viac informácií zistíte tu.
„Ten paradox keď lietadlo, ktoré malo letieť z Mníchova na summit ohľadom globálneho otepľovania v Dubaji zamrzlo na letisku,“ píše sa v telegramovom príspevku poslanca NR SR Rudolfa Huliaka z 3. decembra 2023, ktorého súčasťou bolo aj 26-sekundové video so zasneženým lietadlom, ktorého chvost sa pod váhou snehu skláňal k zemi. Vo videu vidieť aj niekoľko hasičských vozidiel s modrými výstražnými svetlami.
Huliak sa do parlamentu dostal na kandidátke SNS. Po voľbách ho predseda Smeru Robert Fico navrhol za ministra životného prostredia, avšak prezidentka Zuzana Čaputová ho odmietla vymenovať, pričom svoje rozhodnutie zdôvodnila ústavnoprávnymi dôvodmi a tvrdila, že jeho vymenovanie by nedávalo záruku riadneho chodu rezortu.
Predmetné video s obdobnými tvrdeniami bolo v rovnakom čase zdieľané aj na mnohých ďalších miestach, na Facebooku, Telegrame, či na ruskej sieti VKontakte. Video s týmito tvrdeniami zverejnil aj slovenský portál Topky.sk.
Video s rovnakými tvrdeniami kolovalo aj v iných jazykoch, napríklad v češtine, nemčine, angličtine a čínštine.
Svetová konferencia o klíme (COP28) v Dubaji sa konala od 30. novembra. Pôvodne mala trvať do 12. decembra, nakoniec bola ukončená 13. decembra uzavretím globálnej dohody o odklone od fosílnych palív. Podľa krajín, ktoré sú najviac ohrozené meniacou sa klímou sú však nutné oveľa širšie opatrenia.
Konferenciu však sprevádzala nielen vlna neprávd na sociálnych sieťach, ale aj kritika hostiteľskej krajiny, lobovania ropných spoločností či uhlíkovej stopy podujatia, najmä pokiaľ ide o dopravu a používanie súkromných lietadiel.
Ako preukázali naši nemeckí kolegovia v rámci agentúry AFP, Nemecko začiatkom decembra síce zasiahlo silné sneženie, v skutočnosti však neexistuje žiadny dôkaz, že lietadlo na videu malo niekedy letieť do Dubaja.
Napriek tomu, čo sa píše v niektorých príspevkoch na sociálnych sieťach, sneženie v decembri nedokazuje, že globálne otepľovanie neexistuje. O prebiehajúcej klimatickej zmene panuje jednoznačný vedecký konsenzus a výskumníci po celom svete sa zhodujú, že za tento problém je zodpovedný človek.
Časť Nemecka zasiahnutá decembrovou kalamitou
Ako uvádzali niektoré z príspevkov a mnohé médiá, zimné počasie spôsobilo začiatkom decembra 2023 v Nemecku - najmä na juhu a východe Bavorska - početné komplikácie v cestnej, železničnej či leteckej doprave, a tiež výpadky elektrického prúdu. Zasiahnutý bol najmä Mníchov, dokonca musel byť odložený aj futbalový zápas medzi Bayernom a klubom Union Berlín. O dopravnom chaose informovala aj agentúra AFP. Predmetné video zdieľané na sociálnych sieťach sa objavuje aj v nasledujúcej videoreportáži AFP (v nemčine):
Večer 1. decembra 2023 bola prevádzka na mníchovskom letisku najprv obmedzená a potom celkom zastavená až do rána 3. decembra, ako sa uvádza na účte letiska na soc. sieti X. Podľa miestnych správ bolo len v tento deň zrušených 560 z približne 880 plánovaných letov - vrátane letov do Dubaja. Prerušenie prevádzky potvrdil hovorca v telefonickom rozhovore s agentúrou AFP 4. decembra 2023. Prevádzka bola kvôli počasiu znovu pozastavená aj 5. decembra. Ráno 6. decembra 2023 letisko informovalo, že letová prevádzka opäť funguje, ale stále môžu nastať obmedzenia.
Predmetné video zdieľala rakúska webstránka „Exxpress“, o ktorej sme v AFP opakovane písali v súvislosti so zverejnením nepravdivých správ (tu, tu). Článok webstránky cituje vyjadrenie hovorcu letiska Hennera Eutinga pre bavorský denník Münchner Merkur. V článku v Münchner Merkur sa však výslovne uvádza, že špekulácie o súkromnom lietadle smerujúcom do Dubaja neboli potvrdené.
Agentúra AFP kontaktovala Eutinga a požiadala ho o dodatočné informácie o videu. Video je skutočné a bolo vyhotovené na letisku v Mníchove v noci z 1. na 2. decembra, uviedol Euting v telefonickom rozhovore 4. decembra. Lietadlo však nebolo primrznuté k zemi, ako uvádzali nepravdivé príspevky na sociálnych sieťach: „Lietadlo sa prevážilo v dôsledku množstva snehu v oblasti chvostu lietadla. Hasiči však lietadlo napravili a nebolo poškodené.“ V ďalšom telefonáte 7. decembra 2023 Florian Steuer z tlačového oddelenia letiska spresnil, že lietadlo na videu sa nenachádzalo pri termináli, ale na parkovacej ploche.
Lietadlo bolo odparkované, v letovom pláne neboli žiadne cesty
Vyhľadávaním pomocou kľúčových slov sme našli článok z 2. decembra 2023 na nemeckom portáli „Aerotelegraph“ zaoberajúcom sa témami súvisiacimi s letectvom. Podľa tohto článku malo lietadlo, ktorému sa pod váhou snehu zdvihla predná časť, registračný kód „OE-HUB“. Z neho vyplýva, že ide o lietadlo Cessna Citation X patriace salzburskej charterovej leteckej spoločnosti Bairline.
Na webstránke leteckej spoločnosti sú fotografie lietadla Citation X, ktoré sa zhodujú s lietadlom viditeľným na zdieľanom videu.
Agentúra AFP kontaktovala spoločnosť Bairline priamo. V telefonickom rozhovore 4. decembra 2023 Nico Just, pilot a manažér predaja spoločnosti Bairline, potvrdil, že lietadlo patrí leteckej spoločnosti a že „informácie o Svetovej konferencii o klíme nie sú správne“.
„Lietadlo sa v Mníchove nachádza od 15. novembra 2023, no je tam len odparkované. Nebolo v pláne, že by malo letieť na klimatickú konferenciu do Dubaja,“ povedal Just pre agentúru AFP. Uviedol tiež, že stroj nebol zamrznutý, ale jednoducho sa jedna časť zdvihla pod váhou snehu, no následne lietadlo opäť postavili na zem.
Vyhľadávaním registračného kódu lietadla sme na viacerých leteckých portáloch dohľadali, že lietadlo sa nachádza v Mníchove od 15. novembra 2023. V tento deň priletelo z belgických Antverp a pristálo na letisku Franza Josefa Straussa v Mníchove po siedmej hodine večer. Agentúre AFP sa nepodarilo nájsť žiadny dôkaz o plánovanom alebo dokonca zrušenom lete daného lietadla do Dubaja. Na túto skutočnosť poukázali aj používatelia siete X.
Z údajov prístupných platiacim používateľom na stránke FlightRadar24, ktorá agreguje dáta a históriu jednotlivých letov na celom svete v reálnom čase, vyplýva, že danému lietadlo bol zrušený plánovaný let z Mníchova do Lomé, hlavného mesta afrického Toga, 20. novembra. Agentúra AFP nenašla žiadne záznamy o tom, že by dané lietadlo letelo medzi 15. novembrom a 13. decembrom do inej destinácie.
Klimatická zmena je reálna a spôsobená ľudskou činnosťou
V čase, keď sa na Svetovej konferencii o klíme diskutovalo o jednotlivých opatreniach, ktoré by spomalili globálne otepľovanie (archívny odkaz), používatelia sociálnych sietí pod predmetným videom písali sarkastické komentáre ako „ukážka globálneho otepľovania v priamom prenose“ či „čo na to Gréta a všetci tí tárajovia“ (odkazujúc na švédsku klima aktivistku Gretu Thunberg).
Početné metaštúdie, ktoré systematicky sumarizujú medzinárodné výskumné štúdie, dospeli k záveru, že za globálne otepľovanie je zodpovedný človek. Jedna takáto štúdia z roku 2013 preskúmala 11 944 štúdií o globálnom otepľovaní uverejnených v rokoch 1991 až 2011. Až 97% preskúmaných štúdií sa zhodlo na tom, že zmenu klímy spôsobil človek (archívny odkaz).
Iná metaštúdia z roku 2016 (archívny odkaz) dokonca sumarizuje rôzne metaštúdie o konsenze vo vede a konštatuje, že v tejto otázke existuje "konsenzus o konsenze". Autori dospeli k záveru: "Úroveň vedeckého konsenzu v súvislosti s globálnym otepľovaním spôsobeným človekom je mimoriadne vysoká, pretože dôkazy o ňom sú mimoriadne silné." Vedecká komunita sa teda zhoduje: globálne otepľovanie existuje a je spôsobené človekom.
Pravidelné správy Medzivládneho panelu pre zmenu klímy (IPCC) sú vedeckou komunitou považované za spoľahlivý a uznávaný zdroj informácií o globálnom otepľovaní (archívny odkaz).
Služba pre klimatickú zmenu Copernicus, ktorá v rámci Európskej únie sleduje zmeny teploty prízemného vzduchu a morskej vody, minulý týždeň oznámila, že november a celý rok 2023 bol „najteplejší v histórii celého sveta“ (archívny odkaz).
Máte tip na správu, ktorú by sme v AFP mohli overiť?
Kontaktujte nás
Translation:
The snow-covered plane at the airport in Munich was parked and had no scheduled flights
- Posted on December 14, 2023 at 4:43 pm
- You can read the article in 6 minutes
- Author: Katharina ZWINS, AFP Germany, AFP Slovakia
- The article was translated by Robert BARCA
Copyright © AFP 2017-2024. Any commercial use of this content requires subscription to our services. You can find more information here.
"The paradox when the plane that was supposed to fly from Munich to the summit regarding global warming in Dubai froze at the airport," reads the telegram post of the deputy of the Slovak Republic, Rudolf Huliak, dated December 3, 2023, which also included a 26-second video of a snow-covered plane , whose tail was bending to the ground under the weight of the snow. Several fire trucks with blue warning lights can also be seen in the video.
Huliak entered the parliament on the SNS candidate. After the elections, Smer chairman Robert Fico proposed him as Minister of the Environment, but President Zuzana Čaputová refused to appoint him, justifying her decision on constitutional grounds and claiming that his appointment would not guarantee the smooth running of the department.
The video in question with similar claims was shared at the same time in many other places, on Facebook, Telegram, and the Russian VKontakte network. A video with these claims was also published by the Slovak portal Topky.sk.
A video with the same claims was also circulated in other languages, such as Czech, German, English and Chinese.
The World Climate Conference (COP28) in Dubai took place from November 30. Originally it was supposed to last until December 12, it was finally ended on December 13 with the conclusion of a global agreement on the transition from fossil fuels. However, according to the countries that are most threatened by the changing climate, much broader measures are necessary.
However, the conference was accompanied not only by a wave of falsehoods on social networks, but also by criticism of the host country, lobbying by oil companies, or the event's carbon footprint, especially when it comes to transportation and the use of private planes.
As our German colleagues at AFP have shown, while Germany was hit by heavy snowfall in early December, there is no actual evidence that the plane in the video was ever supposed to fly to Dubai.
Despite what some posts on social media say, snow in December does not prove that global warming does not exist. There is a clear scientific consensus on ongoing climate change, and researchers around the world agree that humans are responsible for the problem.
Part of Germany affected by the December disaster
As some of the posts and many media reported, the winter weather in early December 2023 in Germany - especially in the south and east of Bavaria - caused numerous complications in road, rail or air transport, as well as power outages. Munich was particularly affected, even the football match between Bayern and Union Berlin had to be postponed. The AFP agency also reported on the traffic chaos. The video in question shared on social networks also appears in the following AFP video report (in German):
On the evening of December 1, 2023, operations at Munich Airport were first limited and then completely stopped until the morning of December 3, according to the airport's social media account. of the X network. According to local reports, 560 of the approximately 880 scheduled flights were canceled on this day alone - including flights to Dubai. The suspension of operations was confirmed by a spokesperson in a telephone interview with the AFP agency on December 4, 2023. The operation was suspended again on December 5 due to the weather. On the morning of December 6, 2023, the airport reported that flight operations are operating again, but restrictions may still occur.
The video in question was shared by the Austrian website "Exxpress", which we in AFP have repeatedly written about in connection with the publication of false news (here, here). The website article quotes airport spokesman Henner Euting to the Bavarian daily Münchner Merkur. However, the Münchner Merkur article specifically states that speculation about a private jet heading to Dubai has not been confirmed.
AFP contacted Euting and asked him for additional information about the video. The video is real and was taken at Munich airport on the night of Dec. 1-2, Euting said in a Dec. 4 phone interview. However, the plane was not frozen to the ground as false social media posts claimed: “The plane was overweight due to the amount of snow in the tail area of ​​the plane. However, the firefighters repaired the plane and it was not damaged." In another call on December 7, 2023, Florian Steuer from the airport's press department clarified that the plane in the video was not near the terminal, but in the parking area.
The plane was parked, there were no routes in the flight plan
Searching using keywords, we found an article dated December 2, 2023 on the German portal "Aerotelegraph" dealing with topics related to aviation. According to this article, the plane whose nose lifted under the weight of the snow had the registration code "OE-HUB". It shows that it is a Cessna Citation X belonging to the Salzburg charter airline Bairline.
The airline's website has photos of the Citation X that match the plane seen in the shared video.
AFP contacted Bairline directly. In a telephone interview on 4 December 2023, Nico Just, a pilot and sales manager for Bairline, confirmed that the plane belonged to the airline and that "the information about the World Climate Conference is incorrect".
"The plane has been in Munich since November 15, 2023, but it is only parked there. It was not planned that he should fly to the climate conference in Dubai," Just told AFP. He also stated that the machine was not frozen, but simply that one part lifted under the weight of the snow, but then the plane was put back on the ground.
By searching for the plane's registration code, we found out on several aviation portals that the plane has been in Munich since November 15, 2023. On this day, it arrived from Antwerp, Belgium, and landed at Franz Josef Strauss Airport in Munich after seven o'clock in the evening. AFP has been unable to find any evidence of the plane's planned or even canceled flight to Dubai. Users of the X network also pointed out this fact.
Data accessible to paying users of FlightRadar24, which aggregates data and flight history worldwide in real time, shows that the plane was scheduled to fly from Munich to Lomé, the capital of Togo, Africa, on November 20. AFP found no records of the plane flying to another destination between November 15 and December 13.
Climate change is real and caused by human activity
At the time when individual measures that would slow down global warming were being discussed at the World Climate Conference (archive link), users of social networks wrote sarcastic comments under the video in question, such as "a demonstration of global warming in live broadcast" or "what about Greta and all those bastards" (referring to the Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg).
Numerous meta-studies that systematically summarize international research studies have concluded that humans are responsible for global warming. One such study from 2013 reviewed 11,944 studies on global warming published between 1991 and 2011. Up to 97% of the studies reviewed agreed that climate change was caused by humans (archive link).
Another meta-study from 2016 (archive link) even summarizes various meta-studies on consensus in science and states that there is a "consensus on consensus" on this issue. The authors concluded: "The level of scientific consensus on human-caused global warming is extremely high because the evidence for it is extremely strong." So the scientific community agrees: global warming exists and is man-made.
The regular reports of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) are considered by the scientific community to be a reliable and respected source of information on global warming (archive link).
The Copernicus climate change service, which monitors surface air and sea temperature changes within the European Union, announced last week that November and the entire year of 2023 was "the warmest in the history of the entire world" (archive link).
Do you have a tip for a report that we at AFP could verify?
Contact us
false_claim: A plane in wintry weather was frozen on the runway heading to the Dubai climate change conference.

content:
La nomina a «persona dell’anno» del Time di Zelensky e Hitler hanno motivazioni opposte
L’8 dicembre 2022 su Facebook è stata pubblicata un’immagine con due presunte copertine del magazine statunitense Time. Nella prima, a sinistra, compare un disegno del dittatore nazista Adolf Hitler. La seconda, a destra, mostra invece il volto del presidente ucraino Volodymyr Zelensky e la scritta in inglese «Person of the year Volodymyr Zelensky & the spirit of Ukraine» (in italiano, «Persona dell’anno Volodymyr Zelensky e lo spirito dell’Ucraina»).
L’immagine è accompagnata da questo commento, scritto da chi ha pubblicato il post su Facebook: «Il Time proclama Zelensky uomo dell’anno. Io non ho nulla da obiettare. Nel 1938 il Time aveva nominato Adolf Hitler. Mi sembra coerente».
Il contenuto oggetto di analisi è fuorviante, presentato senza il contesto necessario alla sua reale comprensione.
Innanzitutto, la nomina di «persona dell’anno» viene conferita a partire dal 1928 dal Time ogni anno alla persona o alle persone «che hanno maggiormente influenzato le notizie e le nostre vite, nel bene e nel male, e hanno incarnato ciò che è stato importante dell’anno, nel bene e nel male», come precisato dalla stessa rivista. Per questo motivo la nomina non ha esclusivamente un’accezione positiva e non è sempre un onore riceverla.
Per il 2022, Time ha deciso di conferirla al presidente ucraino. Il direttore della rivista statunitense, Edward Felsenthal, il 7 dicembre 2022 ha scritto che «la scelta di quest’anno è stata la più netta che ricordi». La motivazione è stata la seguente: «Per aver dimostrato che il coraggio può essere contagioso quanto la paura, per aver spinto persone e nazioni a unirsi in difesa della libertà, per aver ricordato al mondo la fragilità della democrazia – e della pace – Volodymyr Zelensky e lo spirito dell’Ucraina sono la Persona di riferimento del Time per il 2022 ». Si tratta, quindi, in questo caso di una nomina con un’accezione positiva.
Passiamo ora alla copertina con Hitler. Si tratta di un’immagine reale, ma non è stata pubblicata nel 1938, come erroneamente suggerito nel post e non c’entra con la nomina di «persona dell’anno». La copertina in questione è stata invece pubblicata il 13 marzo 1933, cioè poco più di un mese dopo che Hitler era stato nominato cancelliere tedesco dal presidente della Repubblica e dopo circa dieci giorni che il partito nazista aveva ottenuto il 44 per cento dei voti alle elezioni del 5 marzo. Nel numero si raccontava l’inizio dell’ascesa al potere di Hitler.
Chiarito questo aspetto, precisiamo che il Time nel 1938 ha effettivamente indicato Hitler. All’epoca la rivista aveva specificato di aver deciso questa nomina perché «Hitler divenne nel 1938 la più grande forza minacciosa che il mondo democratico e amante della libertà deve affrontare oggi». Anche la copertina scelta per l’occasione denotava l’accezione negativa di quella scelta. Come ha precisato lo stesso magazine nel 2019, il numero con cui si nominava Hitler non comprendeva il trattamento «del ritratto che i soggetti di copertina ricevevano tipicamente. Invece è stato raffigurato come una figura minuscola con le spalle allo spettatore, che suona un enorme organo con le sue vittime assassinate che girano su una ruota di Santa Caterina».
Dunque, come spiegato sempre dal Time, la persona indicata «non è necessariamente un eroe». «Adolf Hitler, ad esempio, era la Persona dell’anno nel 1938, con una copertina che lo mostrava mentre suonava un organo orribile e una testo che recitava: “Dall’empio organista, un inno di odio”. Stalin ottenne la nomina due volte, e nel 1979 fu decisa per lo ayatollah iraniano Khomeini, quando la rivista lo definì “il mistico che accese il fuoco dell’odio”», ha precisato sempre il magazine.
In conclusione, la nomina di Zelensky come «persona dell’anno» 2022 ha un’accezione positiva. Quella di Hitler nel 1938 ne ha invece una negativa, come spiegato in più occasioni dalla stessa rivista statunitense.
Clicca qui per iscriverti alla newsletter gratuita di Facta
Ogni sabato mattina riceverai il meglio del nostro lavoro
Translation:
Zelensky and Hitler's nomination as Time's "Person of the Year" have opposite motivations
On December 8, 2022, an image was published on Facebook with two alleged covers of the US magazine Time. In the first, on the left, a drawing of the Nazi dictator Adolf Hitler appears. The second, on the right, shows the face of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and the writing in English «Person of the year Volodymyr Zelensky & the spirit of Ukraine» »).
The image is accompanied by this comment, written by the person who published the post on Facebook: «Time proclaims Zelensky man of the year. I have nothing to object to. In 1938 Time magazine nominated Adolf Hitler. It seems coherent to me."
The content being analyzed is misleading, presented without the context necessary for its real understanding.
First of all, the nomination of "person of the year" has been awarded every year since 1928 by Time to the person or people "who have most influenced the news and our lives, for better or for worse, and have embodied what is important state of the year, for better or for worse", as specified by the same magazine. For this reason the nomination does not have an exclusively positive meaning and it is not always an honor to receive it.
For 2022, Time has decided to award it to the Ukrainian president. The director of the US magazine, Edward Felsenthal, wrote on 7 December 2022 that "this year's choice was the clearest I remember". The motivation was as follows: «For having demonstrated that courage can be as contagious as fear, for having pushed people and nations to unite in defense of freedom, for having reminded the world of the fragility of democracy – and of peace – Volodymyr Zelensky and the spirit of Ukraine are Time's Point Person for 2022." It is, therefore, in this case a nomination with a positive meaning.
Now let's move on to the cover with Hitler. It is a real image, but it was not published in 1938, as erroneously suggested in the post and has nothing to do with the nomination of "person of the year". The cover in question was instead published on 13 March 1933, that is, just over a month after Hitler had been appointed German Chancellor by the President of the Republic and approximately ten days after the Nazi Party had obtained 44 percent of the votes in the elections. of March 5th. The issue chronicled the beginning of Hitler's rise to power.
Having clarified this aspect, we point out that Time magazine actually indicated Hitler in 1938. At the time the magazine had specified that it had decided on this appointment because «Hitler became in 1938 the greatest threatening force that the democratic and freedom-loving world faces today». Even the cover chosen for the occasion denoted the negative meaning of that choice. As the same magazine clarified in 2019, the issue naming Hitler did not include the portrait treatment that cover subjects typically received. Instead he was depicted as a tiny figure with his back to the viewer, playing a huge organ with his murdered victims spinning on a St. Catherine's wheel."
Therefore, as Time always explained, the person indicated "is not necessarily a hero". «Adolf Hitler, for example, was Person of the Year in 1938, with a cover that showed him playing a hideous organ and lyrics that read: “From the wicked organist, a hymn of hate”. Stalin obtained the nomination twice, and in 1979 it was decided for the Iranian Ayatollah Khomeini, when the magazine defined him as "the mystic who lit the fire of hatred"", the magazine always specified.
In conclusion, Zelensky's nomination as "person of the year" 2022 has a positive meaning. Hitler's in 1938 instead had a negative one, as explained on several occasions by the same US magazine.
Click here to subscribe to Facta's free newsletter
Every Saturday morning you will receive the best of our work
false_claim: A TIME magazine cover juxtaposes Zelensky as 'person of the year' with a cover of Hitler from the 1930s, implying a parallel nomination.

content:
Manželka obvineného z atentátu na Fica je Slovenka, ruské kanály šíria dezinformácie o „ukrajinskej stope“
- Uverejnené 23. mája 2024 o 15:34
- Článok prečítate za 7 min
- Autor: Robert BARCA, AFP Slovensko
Copyright © AFP 2017-2024. Pre akékoľvek komerčné použitie tohto obsahu je nutné predplatenie našich služieb. Viac informácií zistíte tu.
Robert Fico je hospitalizovaný od stredy 15. mája 2024 po tom, ako ho v Handlovej štyrikrát zasiahol strelec pri pokuse o atentát. Špecializovaný trestný súd v sobotu poslal podozrivého 71-ročného básnika a obyvateľa Levíc identifikovaného ako Juraja Cintulu, do vyšetrovacej väzby.
Bezprostredne po útoku zaplavili sociálne siete v slovenčine aj v iných jazykoch mnohé nepravdivé príspevky týkajúce sa útoku. Agentúra AFP už vyvrátila falošné tvrdenie, ktoré streľbu spájalo s Martinom M. Šimečkom, spisovateľom, komentátorom a otcom opozičného lídra Michala Šimečku, a ktoré bolo založené na starej a z kontextu vytrhnutej fotografii.
Deň po útoku, 16. mája, sa na slovenskom Telegrame a Facebooku objavili nepodložené príspevky, podľa ktorých vraj mala byť Cintulova manželka Ukrajinka.
„Ukázalo sa, že je to utečenkyňa z Ukrajiny a podnecovala manžela, aby sa pomstil predsedovi vlády SR za jeho politický postoj – Fico sa postavil proti dodávkam zbraní na Ukrajinu,“ píše sa v príspevkoch.
Podľa príspevkov sa Cintula tiež zúčastňoval na „proukrajinských zhromaždeniach“. Je pravda, že bol zachytený na proteste proti vláde a jej politike voči Ukrajine počas výjazdového rokovania vlády v Dolnej Krupej, ktoré sa konalo tri týždne pred atentátom. Na videozázname z tohto miesta je vidieť, ako Cintula stojí v skupine protestujúcich a kričí niekoľko hesiel vrátane „Nech žije Ukrajina“ (archív) .
Tvrdenia týkajúce sa strelcovej manželky sú však podľa zistení AFP nepravdivé. Niektoré z týchto tvrdení vyvrátil aj portál Demagog.sk.
Ruské zdroje a „ukrajinská stopa“
Krátko po streľbe zverejnila Margarita Simonyan, šéfredaktorka prokremeľského média Russia Today, na svojom kanáli na Telegrame príspevok, v ktorom naznačila zodpovednosť Ukrajiny za útok: „Slovenský premiér je zranený. Ten, ktorý povedal, že vojna sa začala v dôsledku besnenia ukrajinských neonacistov a že Putin nemal inú možnosť. Takto oni fungujú.“
Podobné špekulácie o „ukrajinskej stope“ sa krátko po streľbe objavili aj na populárnom ruskom telegramovom účte „Rybar“.
V nasledujúcich dňoch sa z ruských kanálov začali šíriť ďalšie príspevky založené na tvrdení o Cintulovej manželke ako „ukrajinskej utečenkyni“, pričom niektoré myšlienku ďalej rozvíjali.
Viaceré zdroje alebo anonymné účty napríklad tvrdili, že slovenské orgány „oficiálne sledujú ukrajinskú stopu“ súvisiacu s Cintulovou manželkou, alebo že „slovenská polícia dostala screenshoty korešpondencie medzi Cintulovou a ukrajinskými tajnými službami. Podľa korešpondencie sa ukázalo, že je úzko prepojená s ukrajinskými spravodajskými službami“ (tu, tu).
Obdobné nepravdivé správy zverejnil aj portál „Pravda“ v angličtine aj slovenčine. Podľa francúzskej vládnej agentúry Viginum bojujúcej proti hybridným hrozbám sú tieto stránky súčasťou organizovanej viacjazyčnej siete šíriacej ruskú propagandu v Európe a Spojených štátoch (archív). O činnosti tejto dezinformačnej siete sme v minulosti informovali aj v súvislosti s ďalšími pro-kremeľskými hoaxmi (tu, tu).
Ruská webová stránka „novorosinform.org“, ktorá funguje v rámci prokremeľskej mediálnej skupiny Tsargrad založenej ruským oligarchom Konstantinom Malofejevom (tu, tu), uverejnila 19. mája 2024, teda štyri dni po tom, ako došlo k streľbe, článok s titulkom „Navádzačka a sprostredkovateľka? Ukrajinská manželka teroristu, ktorý postrelil Fica, sa pokúsila o útek“.
„Ukrajinská manželka strelca Juraja Cintulu, ktorý sa pokúsil zavraždiť šéfa slovenskej vlády Roberta Fica, sa pokúsila o útek, ale zadržali ju na bratislavskom letisku. Žena chcela odletieť do Varšavy, ale orgány činné v trestnom konaní jej v tom zabránili a zadržali ju na 72 hodín,“ pokračoval ruský článok.
Ten istý text bol následne preložený priamo do slovenčiny a uverejnený na webstránke cz24.news, ktorú AFP v minulosti opakovane hodnotila kvôli jej nepravdivému obsahu (tu, tu). Tento článok mal na Facebooku viac ako 170 zdieľaní, skopírovaný bol tiež na viacerých miestach na Facebooku priamo (tu, tu).
Rovnaké tvrdenia sa šírili aj na TikToku, kde ich videlo prostredníctvom tohto príspevku viac ako 45-tisíc používateľov.
To, ako sa ruské propagandistické kanály snažili spojiť útok na Fica s Ukrajinou, popísal aj magazín Wired alebo Denník N.
Manželku hneď po streľbe odviedla polícia
Podľa viacerých médií (tu, tu, tu, tu) sa policajní vyšetrovatelia krátko po streľbe v stredu vybrali do bytu útočníka v Leviciach a okolo deviatej hodiny večer odviedli na výsluch manželku páchateľa.
Pri odchode z bytového domu v Leviciach si strelcova manželka zakrývala tvár novinami.
V médiách sa neobjavili žiadne správy o úteku či o zatknutí Cintulovej na bratislavskom letisku či inde.
Orgány tvrdenia odmietajú: Cintulová má slovenské občianstvo
Hneď po tom, ako došlo k streľbe v Handlovej, informovali slovenské úrady médiá a verejnosť o stave Roberta Fica, ako aj o trestnom prípade podozrivého strelca.
Vo štvrtok, nasledujúci deň po útoku, FB stránka Hoaxy a podvody - Ministerstvo vnútra SR, ktorú prevádzkuje Centrum boja proti hybridným hrozbám, vyzvala občanov, aby „uvádzali len fakty“ a „nešírili neoverené informácie“.
„Naratív o tom, že manželka podozrivého má byť utečenkyňou z Ukrajiny, nie je pravdivý. Túto informáciu polícia vyvrátila,“ píše sa v príspevku.
Agentúra AFP tieto informácie overila na Generálnej prokuratúre SR. Hovorkyňa Zuzana Drobová 21. mája 2024 prostredníctvom e-mailu agentúre AFP uviedla, že Cintulova manželka „má slovenské občianstvo“. Ukrajinská ústava nepovoľuje dvojité občianstvo (tu, tu).
Drobová tiež odmietla tvrdenia o údajnom zadržaní Cintulovej na letisku. „Uvedená osoba nebola zadržaná na letisku v Bratislave pri pokuse o útek z krajiny,“ uviedla 22. mája s tým, že ďalšie okolnosti sú predmetom prípravného konania, ktoré je neverejné, takže viac informácií poskytnúť nevedela.
Hoci nie je jasné, kedy presne bola žena prepustená z výsluchu, ani kde sa v súčasnosti nachádza, v rozpore s tým, čo tvrdia ruské zdroje polícia, ministerstvo vnútra ani prokuratúra nezverejnili žiadne správy o tom, že by bola obvinená alebo že by bola v „domácom väzení“.
Slovenské orgány doteraz neinformovali o akejkoľvek „ukrajinskej stope“ v tomto prípade. Podobná zmienka nepadla ani na hodinovej tlačovej konferencii v nedeľu 19. mája za účasti podpredsedu vlády Roberta Kaliňáka, ministra vnútra Matúša Šutaja Eštoka či policajného prezidenta Ľubomíra Soláka, ani na spoločnej tlačovej konferencii s generálnym prokurátorom Marošom Žilinkom v stredu 22. mája (archív). Policajný prezident Solák v nedeľu uviedol, že polícia monitorovala byt podozrivého od chvíle, kedy bol zadržaný.
Manželia žili v Leviciach niekoľko desaťročí
Televízia Markíza zverejnila 15. mája večer videorozhovor so susedom a domovníkom domu, kde manželský pár býval, Ondrejom Szabom. Ten povedal, že Cintulu aj jeho manželku dobre pozná. Podľa neho bola dnes už dôchodkyňa Cintulová v minulosti učiteľkou na miestnom gymnáziu.
Agentúra AFP sa spojila so Szabom 20. mája prostredníctvom telefonátu. Uviedol, že nemá vedomosť o tom, že by bola Cintulová Ukrajinka. Podľa neho manželia žili vo svojom byte „približne 40 rokov“, čo je v rozpore s tvrdeniami z proruských zdrojov, podľa ktorých mala len prednedávnom utiecť z Ukrajiny.
Agentúra AFP sa spojila aj s Vieroslavou Potočárovou, zástupkyňou riaditeľa Gymnázia Andreja Vrábela v Leviciach, kde Cintulová učila geografiu. Potočárová nahliadla do školských záznamov a pre AFP uviedla, že Cintulová na škole pôsobila od roku 1979 až do roku 2005, keď odišla do dôchodku.
„Aj mňa ešte v 80. rokoch učila zemepis,“ uviedla Potočárová s tým, že si nepamätá, že by Cintulová rozprávala po ukrajinsky.
Chata ako dedičstvo
Agentúra AFP pozná krstné meno manželky obvineného strelca, ako aj priezvisko za slobodna, ale rozhodla sa ho nezverejniť z dôvodu ochrany súkromia.
Na základe medializovaných správ o tom, že polícia prehľadávala okrem bytu v Leviciach aj chatu v obci Jabloňovce (tu, tu), AFP dohľadala predmetnú parcelu aj list vlastníctva - čiastočne chatu vlastní práve Cintulová.
Okrem chaty má Cintulová v čiastočnom vlastníctve aj menšie pozemky s ornou pôdou taktiež v okrese Jabloňovce. Tvrdeniu o jej „nedávnej emigrácii z Ukrajiny“ odporuje aj fakt, že podľa listu vlastníctva svoj podiel nadobudla zdedením v roku 2004, resp. v roku 2011. Podľa listov vlastníctva má Cintulová 75 rokov.
Zoznam všetkých našich článkov týkajúcich sa nepravdivých tvrdení súvisiacich s ruskou vojnou na Ukrajine nájdete v slovenčine tu a v angličtine tu.
Máte tip na správu, ktorú by sme v AFP mohli overiť?
Kontaktujte nás
Translation:
The wife of the person accused of the assassination of Fico is Slovak, Russian channels are spreading misinformation about the "Ukrainian trail"
- Posted May 23, 2024 at 3:34 pm
- You can read the article in 7 minutes
- Author: Robert BARCA, AFP Slovakia
Copyright © AFP 2017-2024. Any commercial use of this content requires subscription to our services. You can find more information here.
Robert Fico has been hospitalized since Wednesday, May 15, 2024, after he was shot four times by a shooter during an assassination attempt in Handlova. On Saturday, the specialized criminal court sent the suspect, a 71-year-old poet and resident of Levice, identified as Juraj Cintula, into custody.
Immediately after the attack, social networks in Slovak and other languages ​​were flooded with many false posts related to the attack. The AFP agency has already refuted a false claim that linked the shooting to Martin M. Šimečka, writer, commentator and father of opposition leader Michal Šimečka, and which was based on an old and out-of-context photo.
The day after the attack, on May 16, unsubstantiated posts appeared on Slovak Telegram and Facebook, according to which Cintula's wife was supposed to be Ukrainian.
"It turned out that she is a refugee from Ukraine and she incited her husband to take revenge on the Prime Minister of the Slovak Republic for his political stance - Fico opposed the supply of weapons to Ukraine," the posts read.
According to the posts, Cintula also attended "pro-Ukraine rallies." It is true that he was caught at a protest against the government and its policy towards Ukraine during the exit meeting of the government in Dolna Krupa, which took place three weeks before the assassination. Video footage from the scene shows Cintula standing in a group of protesters shouting several slogans, including "Long live Ukraine" (archive) .
However, according to AFP findings, the claims regarding the shooter's wife are false. The portal Demagog.sk also refuted some of these claims.
Russian sources and the "Ukrainian footprint"
Shortly after the shooting, Margarita Simonyan, editor-in-chief of the pro-Kremlin media Russia Today, published a post on her Telegram channel in which she indicated Ukraine's responsibility for the attack: "The Slovak prime minister is wounded. The one who said that the war started due to the rampage of Ukrainian neo-Nazis and that Putin had no other choice. That's how they work."
Similar speculation about a "Ukrainian trail" also appeared on the popular Russian Telegram account "Rybar" shortly after the shooting.
In the following days, more posts began to circulate from Russian channels based on the claim of Cintula's wife as a "Ukrainian refugee", some developing the idea further.
For example, multiple sources or anonymous accounts claimed that Slovak authorities are "officially following a Ukrainian lead" related to Cintula's wife, or that "Slovak police received screenshots of correspondence between Cintula and the Ukrainian secret services. According to the correspondence, it turned out that she is closely connected with the Ukrainian intelligence services" (here, here).
Similar false news was also published by the "Pravda" portal in both English and Slovak. According to the French government's anti-hybrid threat agency Viginum, these sites are part of an organized multilingual network spreading Russian propaganda in Europe and the United States (archive). In the past, we also reported on the activities of this disinformation network in connection with other pro-Kremlin hoaxes (here, here).
On May 19, 2024, four days after the shooting, the Russian website "novorosinform.org," which operates as part of the pro-Kremlin media group Tsargrad founded by Russian oligarch Konstantin Malofeyev (here, here), published an article titled "The Guide and the intermediary? The Ukrainian wife of the terrorist who shot Fico tried to escape".
"The Ukrainian wife of the shooter Juraj Cintula, who tried to assassinate the head of the Slovak government, Robert Fico, tried to escape, but she was detained at the Bratislava airport. The woman wanted to fly to Warsaw, but the law enforcement authorities prevented her from doing so and detained her for 72 hours," the Russian article continued.
The same text was subsequently translated directly into Slovak and published on the website cz24.news, which AFP has repeatedly evaluated in the past due to its false content (here, here). This article had more than 170 shares on Facebook, it was also copied in several places on Facebook directly (here, here).
The same claims were also circulated on TikTok, where more than 45,000 users saw them through this post.
Wired magazine and Denník N also described how Russian propaganda channels tried to connect the attack on Fico with Ukraine.
The wife was taken away by the police immediately after the shooting
According to several media outlets (here, here, here, here), shortly after the shooting on Wednesday, police investigators went to the attacker's apartment in Levice and took the perpetrator's wife in for questioning at around nine o'clock in the evening.
When leaving the apartment building in Levice, the shooter's wife covered her face with a newspaper.
There were no reports in the media about Cintulová's escape or arrest at the Bratislava airport or elsewhere.
The authorities reject the claim: Cintulová has Slovak citizenship
Immediately after the shooting in Handlova, the Slovak authorities informed the media and the public about the condition of Robert Fico, as well as about the criminal case of the suspected shooter.
On Thursday, the day after the attack, the FB page Hoaxes and frauds - Ministry of the Interior of the Slovak Republic, which is operated by the Center for Combating Hybrid Threats, called on citizens to "state only the facts" and "not to spread unverified information."
"The narrative that the suspect's wife is supposed to be a refugee from Ukraine is not true. This information was refuted by the police," the post reads.
The AFP agency verified this information at the General Prosecutor's Office of the Slovak Republic. On May 21, 2024, spokeswoman Zuzana Drobová told AFP via e-mail that Cintula's wife "has Slovak citizenship." The Ukrainian constitution does not allow dual citizenship (here, here).
Drobová also rejected claims about the alleged detention of Cintula at the airport. "The mentioned person was not detained at the airport in Bratislava while trying to flee the country," she said on May 22, adding that other circumstances are the subject of a preliminary proceeding that is not public, so she could not provide more information.
Although it is not clear when exactly the woman was released from questioning or where she is currently located, contrary to what Russian sources claim, the police, the Ministry of the Interior, and the prosecutor's office have not released any reports that she has been charged or that she is in custody. "house arrest".
Slovak authorities have so far not informed about any "Ukrainian trace" in this case. A similar mention was not made either at the one-hour press conference on Sunday, May 19, attended by Deputy Prime Minister Robert Kaliňák, Minister of the Interior Matúš Šutaj Eštok, or Police Chief Ľubomír Solák, nor at the joint press conference with Prosecutor General Maroš Žilinka on Wednesday, May 22 (archive). Police President Solák said on Sunday that the police had been monitoring the suspect's apartment since he was detained.
The couple lived in Levice for several decades
On the evening of May 15, Markíza TV published a video interview with Ondrej Szab, a neighbor and caretaker of the house where the married couple lived. He said that he knows Cintula and his wife well. According to him, the now retired Cintulová used to be a teacher at the local gymnasium.
AFP contacted Szab on May 20 via phone call. He stated that he had no knowledge that Cintula was Ukrainian. According to him, the couple had lived in their apartment "for approximately 40 years", which contradicts the claims from pro-Russian sources, according to which she had only recently fled Ukraine.
The AFP agency also contacted Vieroslava Potočárová, deputy director of the Andrej Vrábel High School in Levice, where Cintulová taught geography. Potočárová looked into school records and told AFP that Cintulová worked at the school from 1979 until 2005, when she retired.
"She also taught me geography in the 80s," said Potočárová, adding that she does not remember Cintulová speaking Ukrainian.
Cottage as heritage
AFP knows the first name of the accused shooter's wife, as well as her maiden name, but has decided not to release it for privacy reasons.
Based on media reports that the police searched a cottage in the village of Jabloňovce in addition to an apartment in Levice (here, here), AFP found the parcel in question and the title deed - the cottage is partly owned by Cintulová.
In addition to the cottage, Cintulová also partially owns smaller plots of land with arable land also in the Jabloňovce district. The claim of her "recent emigration from Ukraine" is also contradicted by the fact that, according to the title deed, she acquired her share by inheritance in 2004, or in 2011. According to the title deeds, Cintulová is 75 years old.
You can find a list of all our articles related to false claims related to the Russian war in Ukraine in Slovak here and in English here.
Do you have a tip for a report that we at AFP could verify?
Contact us
false_claim: The wife of the shooter who attacked Slovak Prime Minister Fico is a Ukrainian refugee.

content:
L’Ecdc non collega il vaiolo delle scimmie ai laboratori ucraini
Il 24 maggio 2022 su Facebook è stato pubblicato un post in cui si riporta cosa avrebbe rivelato una fonte anonima dell’Ecdc a un «investigatore indipendente» di nome «Dr. Benjamin Braddock». Nel post si legge che la fonte «ha detto che l’analisi preliminare del ceppo di vaiolo delle scimmie attualmente in corso ha rilevato che il virus proveniva da un laboratorio e potrebbe essere correlato alla ricerca biologica degli Stati Uniti in Ucraina».
Si tratta di un contenuto fuorviante e privo di riscontri, che veicola una notizia falsa. Andiamo con ordine.
Il vaiolo delle scimmie è un’infezione endemica presente in diversi Paesi dell’Africa occidentale e centrale, causata da un virus della stessa famiglia del vaiolo, ma che si differenzia per minore gravità e capacità di diffusione. Il virus è diffuso in particolare tra primati non umani e piccoli roditori e si trasmette dall’animale all’uomo attraverso la saliva ed altri fluidi dell’animale, o in seguito a un contatto diretto. A partire da maggio sono stati registrati focolai di vaiolo delle scimmie in diversi Paesi dove il virus non è endemico.
Lo scorso 21 maggio 2022 su Twitter, l’account Dr. Benjamin Braddock ha pubblicato il contenuto riportato nel post oggetto di analisi. In precedenza Braddock, che nella sua bio su Twitter si definisce scrittore e attivista per i diritti umani e animali, ha condiviso teorie del complotto prive di fondamento sulla pandemia di Covid-19 (qui) e sui vaccini anti-coronavirus (qui) e sponsorizzato (qui) farmaci come l’ivermectina non raccomandati (qui e qui) dalle autorità scientifiche nella cura alla Covid-19 perché inefficaci.
Contattato dai colleghi tedeschi di Correctiv, il Centro europeo per la prevenzione e il controllo delle malattie (Ecdc) ha smentito la notizia diffusa da Braddock, spiegando che non esistono prove che i casi attuali di vaiolo delle scimmie siano da collegare a un virus proveniente da un laboratorio in Ucraina.
L’Ecdc ha invece affermato che è chiaro che, in base alle analisi effettuate, gli attuali casi di vaiolo delle scimmie sono strettamente correlati alla variante del virus del vaiolo presente in Africa occidentale. Anche l’Oms, lo scorso 29 maggio, ha comunicato che le analisi preliminari hanno confermato che i casi appartengono alla variante dell’Africa occidentale.
Precisiamo infine che dall’inizio dell’invasione militare russa dell’Ucraina sono circolate notizie infondate o false riguardo a presunte armi biologiche prodotte nei laboratori presenti in Ucraina e gestiti dagli Stati Uniti d’America. Su Facta ci siamo occupati diverse volte di questi casi di disinformazione (qui, qui e qui). In questo approfondimento abbiamo inoltre ricostruito come è nato e si è diffuso il mito dei biolaboratori in Ucraina. Di questo argomento ci siamo occupati anche in un episodio del nostro podcast.
Translation:
ECDC does not link monkeypox to Ukrainian laboratories
On May 24, 2022, a post was published on Facebook reporting what an anonymous ECDC source revealed to an "independent investigator" named "Dr. Benjamin Braddock." The post reads that the source “said that preliminary analysis of the monkeypox strain currently underway found that the virus came from a laboratory and may be related to U.S. biological research in Ukraine.”
This is misleading and unsubstantiated content, which conveys false news. Let's go in order.
Monkeypox is an endemic infection present in several countries in western and central Africa, caused by a virus from the same family as smallpox, but which differs in its lower severity and ability to spread. The virus is widespread in particular among non-human primates and small rodents and is transmitted from animals to humans through the animal's saliva and other fluids, or following direct contact. Since May, outbreaks of monkeypox have been recorded in several countries where the virus is not endemic.
Last May 21, 2022 on Twitter, the Dr. Benjamin Braddock account published the content reported in the post being analyzed. Previously Braddock, who describes himself as a writer and activist for human and animal rights in his Twitter bio, shared baseless conspiracy theories about the Covid-19 pandemic (here) and anti-coronavirus vaccines (here) and sponsored (here) drugs such as ivermectin not recommended (here and here) by scientific authorities in the treatment of Covid-19 because they are ineffective.
Contacted by Correctiv's German colleagues, the European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) denied the news spread by Braddock, explaining that there is no evidence that the current cases of monkeypox are linked to a virus originating from a laboratory in Ukraine.
The ECDC instead stated that it is clear that, based on the analyzes carried out, the current cases of monkeypox are closely related to the variant of the smallpox virus present in West Africa. The WHO also announced on May 29 that preliminary analyzes confirmed that the cases belong to the West African variant.
Finally, we would like to point out that since the beginning of the Russian military invasion of Ukraine, unfounded or false news has circulated regarding alleged biological weapons produced in laboratories in Ukraine and managed by the United States of America. On Facta we have dealt with these cases of misinformation several times (here, here and here). In this study we have also reconstructed how the myth of biolaboratories was born and spread in Ukraine. We also dealt with this topic in an episode of our podcast.
false_claim: ECDC has evidence of a link between monkeypox and a bioweapons laboratory in Ukraine.

content:
Το άρθρο ενημερώθηκε στις 6/3/2023 με την προσθήκη διόρθωσης την οποία μπορείτε να δείτε στο τέλος.
Κυκλοφόρησε ο ισχυρισμός πως πολωνικής προελεύσεως άρμα μάχης Leopard, καταστράφηκε στην Ουκρανία και καταλήφθηκε από τους Ρώσους. Ο ισχυρισμός είναι αναληθής.
Ουκρανία… Αποχαιρέτισαν το Λέοπαρντ…
Της Ιωάννας Υψηλάντη
Η χθεσινή “πρεμιέρα” του ενός, από τα… πρώτα 6 Λέοπαρντ, που δόθηκαν στην Ουκρανία, από την Πολωνία.
Αποχαιρετισμός και παραλαβή, από το αντίπαλο στρατόπεδο!
Ο ισχυρισμός συνοδεύεται από την παρακάτω εικόνα:
Τι ισχύει
Η Πολωνία δεσμεύτηκε να στείλει 14 γερμανικής κατασκευής, άρματα μάχης Leopard 2Α4 στην Ουκρανία, για να λάβουν μέρος σε επιχειρήσεις εναντίον των ρωσικών ενόπλων δυνάμεων. Τα δυο πρώτα, παραδόθηκαν είχαν παραδοθεί ήδη στις 24/2/2023.
Ο ισχυρισμός ξεκίνησε από φιλορωσικά κανάλια στο Telegram και αναπαράχθηκε από ιστοσελίδες.
Ήδη από την 1η Μαρτίου 2023, χρήστες του Twitter επισήμαναν πως η εικόνα έχει δεχτεί τροποποίηση:
Κάνοντας αντίστροφη αναζήτηση εικόνας με το εργαλείο TinEye, διαπιστώνουμε πως κυκλοφόρησε για πρώτη φορά το 2008. Η φωτογραφία δεν έχει καμία σχέση με την Ουκρανία και είναι πολύ παλιότερη, ενώ δεν υπάρχει ρωσική σημαία.
Επιπλέον, το εικονιζόμενο άρμα μάχης, δεν είναι Leopard 2, αλλά το παλιότερο Leopard 1. Η Ουκρανία, δεν έχει παραλάβει άρματα μάχης Leopard 1. Αυτό είναι εύκολα εμφανές από τις γρίλιες της εξάτμισης στην πίσω αριστερή πλευρά.
Σύμφωνα με σελίδα αφιερωμένη στα άρματα μάχης Leopard 1 και 2, το άρμα μάχης της υπό εξέτασης φωτογραφίας, είναι της εκδόσεως Leopard 1A5DK, που υπηρέτησε στις Ένοπλες Δυνάμεις της Δανίας.
Συμπέρασμα
Η φωτογραφία έχει τραβηχτεί το 2008 και δεν είναι από την Ουκρανία. Η σημαία έχει προστεθεί με ψηφιακή επεξεργασία. Το εικονιζόμενο άρμα μάχης είναι δανέζικο Leopard 1A5DK και όχι πολωνικό Leopard 2, σαν αυτά που έχει παραλάβει η Ουκρανία.
ΔΙΟΡΘΩΣΗ 6/3/2023
Η φωτογραφία έχει τραβηχτεί πριν το 2008. Τη βρήκαμε αναρτημένη σε φόρουμ το 2007 και η ρωσική σημαία απουσιάζει. Το ανωτέρω επιβεβαιώνεται από φωτογραφίες σε δανέζικο ιστορικό, αμυντικό φόρουμ.
Translation:
The article was updated on 6/3/2023 with the addition of a correction which you can see at the end.
It has been claimed that a Leopard tank of Polish origin was destroyed in Ukraine and captured by the Russians. The claim is untrue.
Ukraine... They said goodbye to the Leopard...
By Ioanna Ypsilanti
Yesterday's "premiere" of one of the... first 6 Leopards, given to Ukraine, from Poland.
Farewell and reception, from the opposing camp!
The claim is accompanied by the image below:
What is valid
Poland has pledged to send 14 German-made Leopard 2A4 main battle tanks to Ukraine to take part in operations against the Russian armed forces. The first two, delivered had already been delivered on 2/24/2023.
The claim originated from pro-Russian channels on Telegram and was replicated by websites.
As early as March 1, 2023, Twitter users pointed out that the image had been modified:
Doing a reverse image search with the TinEye tool, we find that it was first released in 2008. The photo has nothing to do with Ukraine and is much older, and there is no Russian flag.
Additionally, the tank pictured is not a Leopard 2, but the older Leopard 1. Ukraine has not received any Leopard 1 tanks. This is easily apparent from the exhaust grills on the rear left side.
According to a page dedicated to Leopard 1 and 2 tanks, the tank in the photo in question is of the Leopard 1A5DK version, which served in the Danish Armed Forces.
Conclusion
The photo was taken in 2008 and is not from Ukraine. The flag has been added with digital processing. The tank pictured is a Danish Leopard 1A5DK and not a Polish Leopard 2 like the ones Ukraine has received.
CORRECTION 6/3/2023
The photo was taken before 2008. We found it posted on a forum in 2007 and the Russian flag is missing. The above is confirmed by photos on a Danish historical, defense forum.
false_claim: False videos and images circulated about Leopard tanks allegedly in Ukraine.

content:
Facebookis levib valeväide, et USA kohtuotsuse kohaselt pole COVID-19 mRNA vaktsiin tegelikult vaktsiin, vaid ravim. Tegemist on kohtuasjas osalenud ühe tunnistaja tsitaadi, mitte kohtuotsusega.
„USA üheksanda ringkonna apellatsioonikohus tegi šokeeriva otsuse, mis võib muuta rahvatervise poliitikat kogu riigis,“ kirjutab postitaja.
Ta jätkab kirjeldamist, kuidas väidetava Tervisevabaduse kaitsefondi ja teiste Los Angelese ühtse koolipiirkonna vaidlustajate vahelises vastuolulises kohtuasjas otsustas kohus, et COVID-19 mRNA süste ei peeta traditsioonilise meditsiini määratluste kohaselt vaktsiiniks.
Faktid
Tegemist on veel käimasoleva kohtuasjaga, kus Los Angelese koolide töötajad eesotsas koroonapiirangute vastu võitleva organisatsiooniga Tervisevabaduse kaitsefond läksid 2021. aastal vaktsineerimisnõude pärast tööandja vastu kohtusse.
Tervisevabaduse kaitsefond vaidles, et COVID-19 vaktsiinid ei ole tegelikult vaktsiinid, vaid on hoopis „meditsiinilised ravimeetodid“ ja nende tegemist ei saa nõuda.
Hagi lükati mitmel korral tagasi, kuid tänavu juunis otsustas apellatsioonikohus tagasilükkamise otsuse tühistada.
See pani valeinfo levitajaid arvama, et hagejate väited ongi faktid. Nii see ei ole.
Los Angelese ühendatud koolipiirkond (The Los Angeles Unified School District) kuulus nende tööandjate hulka, kes 2021. aastal nõudsid oma töötajatelt COVID-19 vastu vaktsineerimist.
Esimene hagi, mis esitati 17. märtsil 2021, algatati töötajate poolt, kes ei soovinud end vaktsineerida. See hagi lükati neli kuud hiljem tagasi, kuna koolipiirkond oli oma poliitikat muutnud, võimaldades töötajatel vaktsineerimise asemel end regulaarselt testida. Hiljem kehtestas koolipiirkond taas vaktsineerimise nõude ilma testimise võimaluseta ning septembris loobus sellest nõudest täielikult.
Teine hagi esitati novembris 2021 Idaho osariigis asuva mittetulundusühingu poolt, mis loodi 2020. aastal ja on algatanud mitu kohtuasja koroonapiirangute, sealhulgas maski- ja vaktsiinikohustuse, vastu.
Mittetulundusühing nimega Tervisevabaduse kaitsefond (Health Freedom Defense Fund) väitis, et COVID-19 vaktsiinid ei ole tegelikult vaktsiinid, vaid on hoopis „meditsiinilised ravimid“ ning neid ei saa kohustuslikuks teha. Nad väitsid ka, et COVID-19 vaktsiinid ei takista haiguse levikut, vaid vähendavad selle tõsidust nakatunutel, mistõttu on süst ravi, mitte vaktsiin.
„See ei ole otsus, et Covid-19 vaktsiinid ei ole vaktsiinid,“ ütles Dorit Reiss, California Ülikooli San Francisco õigusteaduskonna professor AFP faktikontrollile. Apellatsioonikohus ei hinnanud hagejate teaduslikke väiteid.
Kuigi õiguslik võitlus LA koolipiirkonna vastu on kestnud umbes kolm aastat, on see endiselt suhteliselt varajases õiguslikus staadiumis, kuna mõlemad kohtuasjad on esimese astme kohtutes tagasi lükatud. 2022. aastal lükati Tervisevabaduse kaitsefondi hagi tagasi, sest kohus leidis, et vaktsiini võime vähendada haiguse ja surma riski oli vajalik, et kaitsta õpilaste ja töötajate tervist.
Kuid 7. juunil tühistas USA üheksanda ringkonna apellatsioonikohus selle tagasilükkamise ja saatis juhtumi tagasi esimese astme kohtusse, et mõlema poole argumente põhjalikumalt kaaluda. See omakorda viiski liikvele valeinfo, et apellatsioonikohtu otsus kinnitab, et hagejate väited vaktsiinide kohta on õiged.
Otsus: Vale. USA kohus ei ole teinud otsuse, et mRNA vaktsiinid ei ole päris vaktsiinid. Seda väitsid ühe kohtuasja hagejad. Hetkel kohtuasi veel käib.
Translation:
A false claim is spreading on Facebook that according to a US court ruling, the COVID-19 mRNA vaccine is not actually a vaccine, but a drug. This is a quote from one of the witnesses involved in the case, not a judgment.
"The US Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit issued a shocking decision that could change public health policy across the country," the poster writes.
He goes on to describe how, in a controversial case between the alleged Health Freedom Defense Fund and other challengers to the Los Angeles Unified School District, a court ruled that COVID-19 mRNA injections are not considered a vaccine under traditional medical definitions.
The facts
This is an ongoing case in which Los Angeles school employees, led by the Health Freedom Defense Fund, an organization fighting against corona restrictions, went to court against the employer in 2021 due to the vaccination requirement.
The Health Freedom Defense Fund argued that the COVID-19 vaccines are not actually vaccines, but are instead "medical treatments" and cannot be required to be given.
The claim was rejected several times, but this June the Court of Appeal decided to overturn the rejection decision.
This led the spreaders of false information to believe that the claims of the plaintiffs were facts. That's not how it is.
The Los Angeles Unified School District (Los Angeles Unified School District) was among the employers that required their employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19 in 2021.
The first lawsuit, filed on March 17, 2021, was initiated by employees who did not want to be vaccinated. That lawsuit was dismissed four months later because the school district had changed its policy to allow employees to get tested regularly instead of being vaccinated. The school district later re-imposed the vaccination requirement without the option of testing, and in September dropped the requirement entirely.
Another lawsuit was filed in November 2021 by an Idaho-based nonprofit that was founded in 2020 and has brought several lawsuits against corona restrictions, including mask and vaccine mandates.
A non-profit organization called the Health Freedom Defense Fund argued that the COVID-19 vaccines are not actually vaccines, but are instead "medical drugs" and cannot be made mandatory. They also argued that the COVID-19 vaccines do not prevent the disease from spreading, but rather reduce its severity in those infected, making the shot a treatment, not a vaccine.
"This is not a decision that Covid-19 vaccines are not vaccines," Dorit Reiss, a professor at the University of California San Francisco School of Law, told AFP Fact Check. The Court of Appeal did not evaluate the plaintiffs' scientific claims.
Although the legal battle against the L.A. school district has been going on for about three years, it is still in the relatively early legal stages as both cases have been dismissed in lower courts. In 2022, the Health Freedom Defense Fund's lawsuit was dismissed because the court found that the vaccine's ability to reduce the risk of disease and death was necessary to protect the health of students and staff.
But on June 7, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit reversed that dismissal and sent the case back to the trial court for a more thorough consideration of both sides' arguments. This, in turn, led to the spread of false information that the appeals court's decision confirms that the plaintiffs' claims about vaccines are correct.
Verdict: Wrong. A US court has not ruled that mRNA vaccines are not real vaccines. That's what the plaintiffs in one of the lawsuits claimed. At the moment, the case is still pending.
